The film's idea was developed with the intent to create a surreal and cinematic world that explores the themes of narcissism and the insecurities in the mind of a creative. Our target audience are those who would enjoy exploring the path of an artist struggling to deal with writer's block while also attempting to present their own perception of what an intellectual should look and act like. The film's tone magnifies the absurdity of everyday life by giving power to its minor characters and revealing moments of the main character's sensitivity. Through the lens of the cinematography, the film will be filled with bold colors and cinematic images that will reveal the power of The Beauty of it All.

As two young independent filmmakers, Theo Gray and Johnny Chisholm are dedicated to creating stories that stimulate their audience through creative content and cinematic imagery. The Beauty of it All strives to do both, as it plays out in a world that never stops unfolding.
But unfortunately, making a film is expensive, and we need resources to make the world we imagine come to life.

• Our goal is 5,000 dollars. The majority of the money will go towards the equipment that will allow us to create a particular look for the film. We are confident in our technical abilities to create a world that we imagine through the means of lighting and lenses. Your investment won't just stop at the Beauty of it All, it will provide us with equipment for our whole independent filmmaking careers. Allowing us to continue creating films that we are dedicated to an extremely passionate about! Your donation will always live on and will be the foundation for making our goals come true.

• Being young filmmakers, we are very aware that we won't make money from our films, but the substituted currency that we take very seriously is recognition. Recognition for a young artist can be the fuel that pushes them forward. The platform that gives that to us is film festivals. They provide the opportunity to show people our stories and all the sweat and tears that went into our films. This is big as it can open up new connections and possible opportunities that can further our careers as filmmakers. But film festivals are expensive and we need all the help to submit our film to future festivals that will allow people to see all the hard work we've put into, The Beauty of it All.
• Lastly, we have several actors and extras in our film, and being so, we have to supply water and food for everyone. Plus transportation to locations. A full and hydrated crew is a happy crew.

column3: font-weight: 700
column5: >The Impact

column1: The Beauty of it All strives on localism. We believe a film should hire from local talent. This creates a more authentic cast and crew, and throughout its production gives back to its local community by stimulating money in catering and other local services. All the film's actors, crew, locations, and support are based in the town of Sag Harbor, New York.

Finally, we hope to screen the completed film in Sag Harbor for its premiere. We want to show the community what can happen when a group of young filmmakers collaborates with a small town. We hope to inspire other young filmmakers to see that bringing your vision to life if possible.
We understand that not everyone can give their financial support. If that is the case, you can absolutely still be involved and show your support in other ways!
• Please share our Indiegogo link on any platform you can post on!

• There will be a scene where we need several extras, please contact us at, tgray01@mica.edu if you are interested. Other than that, thank you for taking the time to read and we hope you can support The Beauty of it All in any way possible!

Johnny Chisholm is a Sag Harbor native director and filmmaker whose main goal is creating stories that resonate with his generation. Chisholm combines his background in anthropology and writing with his numerous production skills to create films that hold his signature. Chisholm graduated from The College at Brockport in the Spring of 2019 with a Bachelor's Degree in media production and cultural anthropology. His latest film Fool’s Mate was selected into The Lift-Off Sessions film festival.

Theo Gray is an NYC based cinematographer and filmmaker who is originally from the small town of Sag Harbor, New York. He graduated from Maryland Institute College of Art in the Spring of 2019 and has taken his work into several genres such as narrative, documentary, and experimental filmmaking. Gray’s passion for creating the cinematic image has grown with his technical exploration of cinematography. Shaping light and emphasizing bold colors has been a common visual theme in his work.

The film's idea was developed with the intent to create a surreal and cinematic world that explores the themes of narcissism and the insecurities in the mind of a creative. Our target audience are those who would enjoy exploring the path of an artist struggling to deal with writer's block while also attempting to present their own perception of what an intellectual should look and act like. The film's tone magnifies the absurdity of everyday life by giving power to its minor characters and revealing moments of the main character's sensitivity. Through the lens of the cinematography, the film will be filled with bold colors and cinematic images that will reveal the power of The Beauty of it All.

As two young independent filmmakers, Theo Gray and Johnny Chisholm are dedicated to creating stories that stimulate their audience through creative content and cinematic imagery. The Beauty of it All strives to do both, as it plays out in a world that never stops unfolding.
But unfortunately, making a film is expensive, and we need resources to make the world we imagine come to life.

Our goal is 5,000 dollars. The majority of the money will go towards the equipment that will allow us to create a particular look for the film. We are confident in our technical abilities to create a world that we imagine through the means of lighting and lenses. Your investment won't just stop at the Beauty of it All, it will provide us with equipment for our whole independent filmmaking careers. Allowing us to continue creating films that we are dedicated to an extremely passionate about! Your donation will always live on and will be the foundation for making our goals come true.

Being young filmmakers, we are very aware that we won't make money from our films, but the substituted currency that we take very seriously is recognition. Recognition for a young artist can be the fuel that pushes them forward. The platform that gives that to us is film festivals. They provide the opportunity to show people our stories and all the sweat and tears that went into our films. This is big as it can open up new connections and possible opportunities that can further our careers as filmmakers. But film festivals are expensive and we need all the help to submit our film to future festivals that will allow people to see all the hard work we've put into, The Beauty of it All.
Lastly, we have several actors and extras in our film, and being so, we have to supply water and food for everyone. Plus transportation to locations. A full and hydrated crew is a happy crew.

The Beauty of it All strives on localism. We believe a film should hire from local talent. This creates a more authentic cast and crew, and throughout its production gives back to its local community by stimulating money in catering and other local services. All the film's actors, crew, locations, and support are based in the town of Sag Harbor, New York.

Finally, we hope to screen the completed film in Sag Harbor for its premiere. We want to show the community what can happen when a group of young filmmakers collaborates with a small town. We hope to inspire other young filmmakers to see that bringing your vision to life if possible.
We understand that not everyone can give their financial support. If that is the case, you can absolutely still be involved and show your support in other ways!
Please share our Indiegogo link on any platform you can post on!

There will be a scene where we need several extras, please contact us at, tgray01@mica.edu if you are interested. Other than that, thank you for taking the time to read and we hope you can support The Beauty of it All in any way possible!

We're a team of recent college graduates and award-winning filmmakers who aspire to leave a footprint in the vast art world.

Our portfolio includes a variety of films including narrative comedies, action shorts, experimental music videos, and feminist pieces, and we want to make Lazarus Taxon our biggest project yet. Your contribution is the first step to actualizing our dreams as filmmakers.
Art isn't just for the artist, it's for the public. We intend on making this film something you enjoy watching as much as we enjoy making.
We need $2,500 for the many costs a film entails. Your money will build our sets, provide our special effects, feed our crew, and put our film through festivals.
We have various perks as thanks for your generous contributions. These include DVD hard copies, physical memories from our set, and even producer credits!

Everyone has been forced to change due to outside circumstances. Lazarus Taxon comes from a personal place of depression and struggle of who we are in this world. We want to make a film that speaks to those grappling with the hardships of identity and provide a piece of media they can relate with.
Lazarus Taxon couldn't happen without you. Your contributions will allow this film to be made and seen.
If you can't contribute, you can still help us by sharing our page and getting the word out about this project!

Red Carpet Broadcasting is a independent film company that has partnered with Furries to produce the first ever Furry themed horror, slasher, comedy feature film called, 'Furries the Movie.' 

An 80's style horror classic film that portrays Furries as, ""the good guys"", where a group of friends attend a fur-con but soon realize a rogue killer is on the loose and stalking them. They must band together to stop him and along the way discover the necessary power they never knew they had, with the underlying theme, ""It's Okay to be Yourself."" 

The film is projected to release in theaters October 2020.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TINT-TLzoEU

We are suspending our crowd funding for Christmas with the Damned for now, due to the virus. Money is better placed elsewhere than in a neat vanity project.
We are not through, and will return once things settle down more. Everyone take care. Wash your paws, isolate as much as you are able.

 

Mojo Monkey Productions is dedicated to providing a platform to write, direct, produce, and distribute top quality independent film projects. Working with accomplished author Joe R. Lansdale, and a talented team, our goal is to bring interesting and currently relevant film ideas from concept to screen.

 

Our first project is ""Christmas With The Damned""  from a short story by Joe R Lansdale.

About the Film:

Calvin never was a fan of Christmas. The smell of eggnog turned his stomach and the decking of the halls was a tedious ritual that only made simple people smile. When another Christmas rolled around, he thought it would be just like the others. Something to agonize through for his eternally optimistic, holiday-enamored wife, Ella, and his young daughter Tina. But he had no idea how much agony and outright terror there was to come when the lights in the sky showed up, bright and beautiful, full of apocalyptic doom.

When the lights flashed, and Ella and Tina changed into something different. Something dangerous and unrecognizable. And most of mankind went right along with them. Christmas, and the rest of the world were put on pause
column2:
forever.

Months down the line, the only thing Calvin wants is have one final Christmas with the family while hanging with a philosophical, new friend named G.M. as well as a horde of flesh-hungry, undead neighbors with a decay problem and a shortage of mid-July Christmas cheer, who want a little something more than to sing carols.

Other Joe R. Lansdale Projects

Joe R. Lansdale has written novels and stories in many genres, including Western, horror, science fiction, mystery, and suspense. He has also written for comics and television.  His work has been made into films, BUBBA HOTEP, COLD IN JULY, as well as the acclaimed TV show, HAP AND LEONARD. He has also had works adapted to MASTERS OF HORROR ON SHOWTIME, and wrote scripts for BATMAN THE ANIMATED SERIES, and SUPERMAN THE ANIMATED SERIES. He scripted a special Jonah Hex animated short, as well as the animated Batman film, SON OF BATMAN.   His short stories ""The Dump"" and ""Fish Night"" have been adapted into short animated films, for the Netflix series LOVE, DEATH AND ROBOTS, as has the story, ""The Companion"" that he wrote in collaboration with his son, Keith, and his daughter, Kasey, as an episode of the SHUDDER CHANNEL'S CREEPSHOW,  also forthcoming films include, THE BIG BLOW, from Ridley Scott, and THE THICKET from Peter Dinklage, which is scheduled to begin production very soon.

 

 

 

","We are suspending our crowd funding for Christmas with the Damned for now, due to the virus. Money is better placed elsewhere than in a neat vanity project.We are not through, and will return once things settle down more. Everyone take care. Wash your paws, isolate as much as you are able. Mojo Monkey Productions is dedicated to providing a platform to write, direct, produce, and distribute top quality independent film projects. Working with accomplished author Joe R. column1:
0,"

Plagued with the guilt of feeling responsible for his late wife Amelia’s overdose, Alexander exiles himself into seclusion amongst the confines of a remote lake-house cabin. But when an occult messenger delivers a series of forgotten photos and mementos of his past lover, Alex suspects that something otherworldly may be interfering with his life. Soon he is thrusted into a downward spiral of regret and insanity as a specter of Amelia begins to make her presence known. Tormented by her ghost and overwhelmed with survivors guilt, Alexander must go face to face with his own demons in this surreal psychological horror.

A SURREAL NARRATIVE ABOUT LOVE, LOSS AND THE HORRORS OF ADDICTION.

The opioid epidemic has been prevalent in our society for the past couple decades and has cost the lives of millions. We’re using this film as an opportunity to commentate on the issue through the perspective of our lead protagonist, Alexander, as he deals with intense survivor’s guilt.  

Our character falls into nightmarish downward spiral due to a dark past, he can’t escape. A central theme in this film is that you can’t run away from your past and you can’t run away from what haunts you. We all battle with our own inner demons and it’s almost always an uphill battle, one that’s not always won. Alex’s demons stem from the actions of his past and the repercussions they’ve had on him throughout the remainder of his life. Guilt, regret, fear and rage are just a few of the complex emotions this film will delve into.

We find ourselves creating this film with the approach of an expressionist. Instead of paying too much attention to the logic of the film we’ll be focusing more on the films surreal visual language
column2: conveying complex emotions subliminally through visceral and evocative imagery. Alexanders grip on his dark past is the cause for the distorted reality that will be exhibited in the film.
column3: >
column5: >
column6:
>Crafting a film to its fullest potential is no easy task but it’s something our team strives to do each and every time we tackle a project. However this can’t be done without the proper funds in the first place, and that’s where you come in!  Your backing and support will ensure that we have the proper infrastructure to create the film you want to see. Because at the end of the day we want to create a cinematic experience for you! 

We also have a lot of great rewards for you backers such as digital downloads, exclusive posters, props, credits and more!


Films are a massive collaborative effort and without the proper resources and infrastructure, productions can easily collapse. We need your help raising funds as a means to ensure our production runs as smoothly as possible. Aside from intense special effects makeup and production design we need to cover the basics. Food for crew, transportation &
column7:
gas, securing locations and housing are just a few of the essentials we need in order to make this film happen. 

But also...
column9:
>We’re shooting on film and it comes with a price.

The grain, the life, and the texture is what a film like this calls for. It’s
what we see in our heads when visualizing this film, and it simply needs to
be done that way.

Digital is too perfect, too clear, and our goal is to move away from that.
column10: >
column11:
>FILM-MAKING IS OUR PASSION


It is what we love. What makes our team so strong is our combination of passion and trust amongst one another. For a look at more work from the director and cinematographer, click on the links below!

column1: In the fight for mental health, who is really in control? That is the question Stuck aims to address. Can we alter our outlook, or are we doomed to our biology? And how do we respond when we find out?
Stuck is written, directed, produced, and led by a team of women in the Nashville, TN area.

What we need is simple: funding. To properly address a delicate topic that affects people around the world every day, we need to be able to access the proper locations and equipment. While we strive to keep costs low, there are some items we cannot do without.
Your support will allow for the rental of studio space and equipment, purchase of wardrobe and set design, and compensation of industry professionals.

If we do not reach our entire goal, whatever has been raised will still be used towards the making of the film. If we surpass our goal, we will have the ability pour more into telling the best story possible.

In exchange for your contribution, we are offering a private link to screen the completed film before it releases to wider audiences. Donations over $50 will also guarantee inclusion of your name in a special section of the film's credits.

column2: >We encourage all who are interested to donate at least $1 to ensure they will be able to view the final film.

column1: We hope to explore an issue that is prevalent in our society and spark discussions about the nature of mental health.

If you cannot contribute to this campaign monetarily, but would still like to support our efforts, we ask that you please share this campaign on social media and with others in your lives. We also ask that you follow @whatifwearestuck on Instagram for updates about the film and how to watch.

‘See the Animal’ is our teams short graduation film at UCA, and it is our biggest and most exciting project yet. We’re all hugely dedicated to the project and feel its unique story and subject matter will connect with viewers all over.

 

Our film follows Jack, a dejected stooge in his long-time friends Seamus and Declan’s magic act. Frequently humiliated on stage by Declan but convinced to stay in the act by Seamus, Jack is caught between his loyalty and his own self-preservation as Declan begins to take things too far on stage. 

 

We’re aiming to create an immersive and realistic film, with a dark and uncomfortable edge that will ensure the film stays with audiences for a long time after the credits roll. 

 

Our crew have all personally donated to the budget of the film, but unfortunately we still have a long way to go in order to raise what we need to create our film! 

 

This is entirely non-profit for us, and any donations we receive will be entirely put towards making the production as magical as possible in a variety of ways - 

 

For example, in order to create Seamus and Declan’s reality-bending magic show most of our film will take place on stage in a theatre , and hiring one for our shoot will take up a large part of our budget. 

 

There will also need to be a big focus on production design by our talented art department in order to wrap our audience up in this magical world we’re striving for. 

 

Our passionate camera department is also raring to go and hoping to source industry grade equipment that will really give them the opportunity to experiment and create visually stunning and striking sequences like never before.

 

This is our last project here at UCA, so we’re hoping to really go above and beyond! We look forward to delivering ‘See the Animal’  to all of you, and in addition to the final film we're also offering some really exciting perks in exchange for any support as a way to say thank you. Give them a click to see what they're all about! 

 

We’re incredibly grateful for any support, even if its just a share of our page! Thank you for taking the time to visit our campaign and giving it a read
column2:
we hope we’ve been able to get across our enthusiasm for the project and made you just as excited as we are to turn it into a reality! 

 

Thank you,

See the Animal team.

""Larger Than Life"" is an original  series by Feliciano Segundo Jr. that will present a never before seen look at a group of incredible professional wrestlers known as The Ugly Ducklings.

The series will follow and explore the lives of all four members of the group (Rob Killjoy, Lance Lude, Colby Corino, and Coach Mikey) as the characters they portray inside the ring and the men they truly are after the show is over and the crowd has gone home. 

100% of the funds raised will go towards our production budget needed to create such a colossal yet original show. This includes money to feed our crew, travel costs as well as funds for distribution when the show makes its premiere in 2020.

The deadline for all funds to be raised has been extended to January 10th, 2020, which means every cent counts. Our goal is to tell a story that lives up to the greatness of such a talented group of guys. Please consider supporting this campaign and sharing this link to help us deliver the best possible series.

""Occupation Rainfall"" is one of Australia's largest independent feature films ever attempted.

Following on from the 2018 release of ' Occupation' - An ambitious film, where Aliens invade Australia and we follow a group of people from a small town as they fight back - the production team moved forward with a bigger, bolder and fresher sequel to continue the story.
""Occupation"" was released theatrically around the globe and followed up with a launch on Netflix US (which opened at #1 most popular), as well as Netflix Australia.
Occupation opened on Netflix US at #1 Popular.

The new story was written with a larger scope in mind, both visually and thematically.  The official synopsis reads:

""Two years into an intergalactic invasion of earth, survivors in Sydney, Australia, fight back in a desperate ground war. As casualties mount by the day, the resistance and their unexpected allies, uncover a plot that could see the war come to a decisive end. With the Alien invaders hell-bent on making earth their new home, the race is on to save mankind.""
With the production team, family, friends and a small team of private investors - Development, Pre-Production AND an extensive Principle Photography are all completed!

The team has assembled and filmed one of the best cast line ups in recent Australian productions, with an amazing and talented film crew to boot. See all the full cast and crew on our IMDB page here:  https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8615822/?ref_=rvi_tt

column2: Dan Ewing (Monster Problems), Jet Tranter (Tidelands) Temuera Morrison (Aquaman) Lawrence Makoare (The Lord of the Rings) David Roberts (The Matrix 2 &
column3: 3), Mark Coles Smith (The Last cab to Darwin), Dena Kaplan (Dance Academy), Vince Colosimo (Underbelly) Daniel Gillies (The Originals, Spiderman 2) and Ken Jeong (The Hangover) plus many more amazing cast.

column1: Now the team is onto the huge task of Post Production - and that's where you can come in....

Because we want to create the best damn sci/fi-action film we can for you, the audience, we always had planed a grass roots campaign to get the public involved and offer out some awesome perks along the way.
By waiting until filming is complete, we wanted to show how far along we are and how amazingly big this 'indie' film actually is. You can be involved in the final stages.

We are asking for funds that will go directly to the films post production to make it an even better and more polished film. Sounds, music and especially the extensive visual effects work that will turn Australia into an Alien war zone and will turn a good film into a spectacular film. Other funds will go towards talent and crew.
Our post production team are already hard at work including talented composers Simon Walbrook and Darren Middleton (from the band PowderFinger)
The more backers we get, the better we can make it.

You can directly be involved in the process from here on in. Just by backing us for a little over a cup of coffee, your name will go on our websites Hall of Fame as a thank you. Want to see BTS and trailers before anyone else? How about an exclusive Hi rez poster only for this campaign? Or pre buy a digital copy of the film with exclusive indiegogo intro.
We're also offering signed scripts from the cast and Alien suits worn in the film. Along with a perk that puts your name in the films credits - forever and worldwide.

The most exciting perks are the Red Carpet VIP pack to the films world premiere that lets you walk the red carpet and join the cast in the after party. Want to buff up your IMDB credits? We are also offering select Producer credits, and the ultimate Executive Producer title with your name on ALL the posters and dvd covers!
The film has already secured a big release across many countries, with more to go as we push on. We are aiming for a theatrical roll out in Australia and New Zealand in the second half of 2020.
Fans and movie buffs alike are already excited to see what Rainfall has in store:
'...A landmark in Australian science fiction' - From Digital Fox
'...An epic Teaser has Dropped' - From Cinema Australia
""Film Mode takes Rainfall to Cannes"" - From Deadline Hollywood
Writing, development, pre production and filming are all complete. Editing, sound design, music and visual effects are already well underway.
Meaning  that the challenge the team faces is to complete the film to an international scale that rivals Hollywood films in the same genre.

We believe that the team we have chosen to take the film from post through to release - the team that are working away feverishly on the film right now - has what it takes to deliver our goals to the world.
We hope that you are excited enough in this limited opportunity to be a part of making this ground breaking Australian, epic feature film!
Director Luke Sparke and Cinematographer Wade Muller on the set filming.
If you can't assist with one of these perks, there are more ways you could help with this campaign:
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Come and meet the team at Pop Culture events
• Go and see the film in cinemas

THE TEAM

We are teenage students, age 13 to 18, of The Film Academy Edinburgh. We meet weekly to learn the skills of filmmaking, and undertaking all front of, and behind-the-camera roles on the production of a variety of short films.
In 2019 alone, we had Official Selections at International Film Festivals on four continents.

THE PROJECT
We are now ready to raise the bar.
We have written a short film of around 18 minutes, three times longer than anything we have attempted previously, with the aim of achieving significantly higher production values.
Taking on all roles
column2: writing, acting, filming and post production, we will:

column1: •     Use a variety of Edinburgh locations
•     Employ professional actors to play the adult characters
•     Shoot on a state-of-the-art cinema camera
•     Simultaneously edit on Final Cut Pro
Our ambition is to enter the finished film into the Edinburgh International Film Festival 2021, and other prestigious film festivals around the world.

FILM SYNOPSIS
Our film, Buzz (working title), is a mystery thriller.
The gang, the dealer and the addict of the world of illegal drugs, are cleverly transposed in our story, into a world where Social Media is the drug of choice.
Using a 3-strand story structure, our film follows the impact of a single event on a ruthless drug gang, a low lever dealer and a committed addict, bringing together all three strands in a dramatic showdown at the end.

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP US
All films need a budget. Although the Film Academy Edinburgh will cover the majority of the film’s expenses, we have been tasked with raising a portion of the budget to enable us to pay for:

OUR AIM
We want our film to highlight the increasing overuse of social media that is fast becoming a social blight.
We are young and ambitious. We want to make great films. We want to learn from the current generation of actors and filmmakers in Scotland and, ultimately, be part of the next wave of Scottish filmmaking talent.

column2:
CHALLENGES
Through the number of short films we have produced we have learnt a great deal, and these films have had some success, but we understand that this project is a big step up and requires us to push our skills even higher.
We can’t do this on our own, so we have a film industry professional team that will mentor us every step of the way, which will help us achieve our goal.

column1:
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
It doesn’t have to be money that you contribute. We need your help to promote our project as well, by word of mouth, sharing the link to this page and on your own social media.

","THE TEAMWe are teenage students, age 13 to 18, of The Film Academy Edinburgh. We meet weekly to learn the skills of filmmaking, and undertaking all front of, and behind-the-camera roles on the production of a variety of short films.In 2019 alone, we had Official Selections at International Film Festivals on four continents.

THE PROJECTWe are now ready to raise the bar.We have written a short film of around 18 minutes, three times longer than anything we have attempted previously, with the aim of achieving significantly higher production values.Taking on all roles
column2: writing, acting, filming and post production, we will:

column1: Use a variety of Edinburgh locations
Employ professional actors to play the adult characters
Shoot on a state-of-the-art cinema camera
Simultaneously edit on Final Cut Pro
Our ambition is to enter the finished film into the Edinburgh International Film Festival 2021, and other prestigious film festivals around the world.

column2:
> 

Over the Easter weekend of 2020 the three friends Markos, Maria and Jokas come together on the island of Aegina in Greece. The three of them come from very different backgrounds* but evenly share a deep frustration over recent life events and the notions of late adolescence. During a night out, they start getting to each other and as they fail to control their emotions they spiral into escalation. The events leave them questioning their lives and identities. In a search for meaning all three find new ways to express and free themselves, one more, one less, and one maybe not all.
column3: >
column4: >""In conclusion to my education, I  decided to make a very personal film that attempts to investigate the relationships between my closest friends, in a place I am lucky enough to call home.""
column5: >- Julian
column8:
> 

As my formal education in film will come to an end with this project,  I decided to dwell deep into the matters that concern me most, the things that make me who I am, as a person and inevitably also as a filmmaker. I have travelled to Greece every year since I was born. My father has worked there for most of his life as an archaeologist. Its is like a second home to me, a home which has taught me more about myself than any other place I can safely call such. Meraki is a Docudrama based around the events of the Easter weekend of 2020. The story involves three of my closest friends and their struggle for purpose and identity, oftentimes citing real-life events. All of them are from Greece or currently live there and as such, they are playing themselves. The camera will stay strictly observatory and fluctuate between handheld and tripod coverage to maintain a fiction film aesthetic. The film will be accompanied by contemporary and colourful rhythms of the London jazz scene. Sound and Image will reflect the themes and methodology of Liminality. Liminality is a sociological concept which describes the process of the rite of passage, a threshold space often encountered when confronted with change and especially relevant in late adolescents.  I have undergone periods of rapid change at a constant capacity, learning, readapting and coming to terms with my own liminality is the main motivation behind making this film. It is an attempt to reflect critically upon notions of identity, by connecting all my dots, my places, my people and our stories.
column12:
>JULIAN SCHWANDNER

Julian graduated with a first-class honours degree in Film &
column13: TV Production from the University of Greenwich in July 2019. The second year of his bachelor programme he spent at the Film &amp
column14: TV faculty of the Academy of Performing Arts in Prague. He is currently undergoing a Master program in Audiovisual Arts - Film Directing at LUCA School of Arts in Brussels in Belgium. The Prague based short film ""Rost"" saw Julian win the award for best director at the 2018 SE10 Student Film Festival in London. His graduate project ""Hiraeth"" won five out of nine honours at the School of Design degree show of Greenwich University in 2019. This includes his personal honour for the best-directed film of the year.
column16:
>NIKOS NIKOLOPOULOS

Nikos is a Greek Director and Cinematographer based in Athens. He studied film direction at the Hellenic Cinema and Television School Stavrakos as well as photography at the Leica Academy in Athens. His debut feature film POLK was premiered at the 55th Thessaloniki International Film Festival in 2014 where it received the FIPRESCI special mention award. His work as a photographer has been widely recognised and published in The New York Times, The Rolling Stone, Positif, American Cinematographer and  Cahiers du Cinema.
column19:
>HELOîSE FERLAY

Heloïse Ferlay is a French animator who studies at the École Nationale Supérieure des Arts Décoratifs (ENSAD) in Paris. Her animation short YOLA was bought by the German- Francophone Network ARTE and was also screened at the Athens Animfest in 2017. Her work is profoundly delicate and driven by a strong dedication to detail.
column21:
>JAMES RUDI CRESWICK

Rudi is a London based musician who played bass for artists such as Tom Misch, Jordan Rakei, Alfa Mist and most recently, the Loyle Carner band. His home turf project Sketches of the Crypt will deliver the films score together with some beats he made on the Loyle Carner tour bus.
column24:
>AULONA FETAHAJ

Aulona is a Belgian filmmaker and audiovisual artist who currently studies at LUCA School of Arts in Brussels. Her work is remarkably form-fluid and shaped by technical explorations, oftentimes evolving around identity philosophy.

Horror needs a Face lift! Who is Skulley Caezar?
After seeing where horror has gone, we wanted to create a movie in the fashion of an old school Slasher movie crossed with the Psychological suspense thriller concept
column2: hence, Welcome to Nightmare Harbor the new franchise in Horror and the birth of Skulley Caezar!

column1: To sum it up we are making this terrifying film and need you and all the horror movie fanatics to come out and support. It starts with a great script and story line and we have just that of. We know It's impossible to guarantee everything will come together exactly as planned, but in the end we will have created a new horror franchise that all of us can be proud of.  All of us  at Nightmare Harbor cant wait to introduce to you the  New Face in Horror.,,Skulley Caezar ! Who is Skulley Caezar you ask ? That's why we need you, so you can help us introduce this new Villain to the world of Horror!
We want to thank you in advance for your contribution and helping us make this movie a possibility.
Sincerely, Crew of the Nightmare Harbor         P.S....Skulley Caezar says ""Die Mate!""
What We Need and what the funds will be used for !
We are ready to make this next big horror movie to scare the  pants off you, but we need your help to make this happen in a big way ! Are Goal is $50,000

* Bigger is better - As you know the more our campaign generates the bigger and better special effects we can add. Allowing us the ability to hire the  best special effects guys that our budget will allow. Our perks start at $1  and go up to $10,000 we know somewhere in between there is a matching  number that you can contribute.

* Cast and crew - Portions of the funds will be used to hire cast and crew, we have started to put feelers out there for casting, we have two casting agencies on deck once the campaign funding starts to roll in, we will be hiring them to assure best actors are called in for auditions.

* The crew we assemble will be local, yet the best the in the region. We have been recruiting as we speak. The more money we raise the better quality industry crew we can assemble. This allows us to produce a high quality film that can compete with best of them.
*Transportation - some portions of the funds will be used for transporting cast/crew/ camera equipment and  Catered food.

* Permits and licensing -Location,location,location ! Portions of  funds will be allocated to secure permits for locations /licensing / administrative /and any unsuspecting legal issue that may arrive.
Projected /Break down   8% Pre-production, 37% Filming, Effects 16% ,Props costume 9,5%, Studio 4.1 % Equipment 4.8% , Cast/Talent 5.2%, Editing/finishing 12.2%, Insurance/permits 1.8%

Mr. Grigsby feels like he has lost his mind and is on the verge of a nervous breakdown from horrifying dreams. Owning a boat has always been a dream of his and finding a boat at a great price now completes that dream. Little does he know this boat will become a nightmare. A nightmares that he will beg to wake up from. A slave pirate spirit is awakened and seeks REVENGE from his past Life! Watch as the new face of horror... Skulley Caezar is introduced. Grigsby has decisions to make, pack up, get as far away as possible, return what was taken or except his fate, allowing Skulley Caezar full possession of his Mind and the Soul.

We know there are always a risk in everything and producing a movie can be a risk and movie  making can be expensive. Everyone knows Hollywood Budgets contain a lot of fluffing of numbers, We are not Hollywood ! We are doing this with a shoestring budget to send Hollywood message! We are asking you to take a chance with us, help bring this new character to Life. Join our Journey and share our passion and excitement in launching this movie franchise and character. We Pledge to do our best to make you proud  and welcome you to the Nightmare Harbor Family!
Perks and Other Ways You Can Help

We have some exciting perks to offer from as little as a dollar thank you, to acting roles, signed scripts, t-shirts, coffee mugs, baseball caps, lanyards...from all price ranges. There is something for everyone, actually too many to list here so go to our perks section to see and give from your hearts.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• You can help get the word out and help us make some noise about our campaign.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools! Help us go viral,  you can help us introduce Skulley Caezar to world of Horror! Watch Out for or Referral  CONTEST with a unique Gift to the winner!

And that's all there is to it.

RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS follows private investigator Walter Whitney, a PI who suffers from memory loss.  When he is approached by a mysterious young woman to help her locate a lost family member, Walter finds himself in an whirlwind investigation that is way more than he bargained for.  But what does this situation have to do with the disappearance of The Mighty Crusaders, Earth's greatest heroes, 30 years ago?  What are his connections to that super team and the day they went missing all those years ago?  And who is the new patriotic themed hero appearing dressed as The Shield?
For your support and donation we have assembled a plethora of unique and exclusive gifts including:
- DVD copies of the final film
- DVD copies of our previous original comic book themed feature film FOUR COLOR EULOGY (see trailer here: www.fourcolorthemovie.com)
- A Behind The Scenes Production booklet
- Custom Action Figures (created by Terrific Custom Toys)

Our primary goal of $2500.00 will help us get this film made BUT if we are able to continue to raise more beyond that, it will allow us to extend the film some and even be able to add more Crusaders characters in it.

At this mark we will produce a complete set of Red Circle Investigations Movie Trading Cards, exclusive only to supporters of this campaign.  And they will be sent out to every backer who donates at $10 (Blue Ribbon Prize) level and higher!
At this mark we will be able to provide an upgraded Blu-Ray of RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS to all backers who choose a level that comes with the DVD.
At this mark, we will will be able to get a number of fantastic artists (including Designer
column2: type=3"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Nate Contini and Director
column3: album_id=364359570340779"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Jason Contini) to recreate and pay homage to classic Mighty Crusaders comic book covers by redrawing them featuring the characters in their costumes from the Red Circle Fan Film.  There will be 5 prints in total and everyone who donated at the $10 (Blue Ribbon Prize) or higher will receive prints of the complete set.

column1: Independent film making always comes with a lot of ""out of pocket"" costs.  This campaign is set up to help us go above and beyond what we can afford to do ourselves with the equipment that we already own. The Mighty Crusaders are such iconic and historic characters that have never been brought to life on screen before. That's why it is so important to us that we give these characters the treatment that they deserve and give you, the fans, the most professional vision of The Mighty Crusaders that we can give you.  With your generous support, our goal of $2500.00 will help us cover:
- Upgraded lenses for the camera to enhance the quality of the film
- Additional microphones and audio gear for highest sound quality
- Post Production filters and plug-ins to bring you better visual FX
- Materials and time for the many superhero costumes that need to be made or built
- Incidentals you never think about till you're on set: tape, safety pins, sharpies, towels, etc.
- Food - A hard working cast and crew has got eat to keep their strength up so they can give the best performance/work possible

Archlight Studios is a Mid-West based production company co-founded by Jason Contini and Nicholas J. Hearne.  Not only have we been very active in film production for over ten years, but we have also been active in the world of comic book publishing as well.  However this is not the first time we have melded the two (comics and films).  Our previous full length feature film, FOUR COLOR EULOGY, dealt with a young struggling comic book writer forced to return home to care for his ailing mother.  The film features a number of comic book references and has been called ""a more dramatic Kevin Smith film"".  The film premiered in 2016 and had a very successful theatrical run before coming to DVD.
For more on this film including trailers and background go to the FOUR COLOR EULOGY website or FOUR COLOR EULOGY Facebook Page.
In addition to the feature, Archlight Studios also produced a music video for Taylor Pietz's original single ""Color Me"" which featured as the opening theme song of the film.
Growing up in a St. Louis theatre family, Jason began acting at the age of 3 when he played The Littlest Prince in a regional theatre production of ""The King &
column2: I"".  Jason earned his Actor's Equity card doing three consecutive years of children's theatre with The Imaginary Theatre Company, the touring arm of The St. Louis Repertory Theatre. He has also worked with The Muny, Upstream Theatre, Bluff City Theater and Stages St. Louis to name a few. After a starring role in the Wyatt Weed's vampire thriller SHADOWLAND, Jason moved to Los Angeles to pursue film acting full time. There he starred in John Campea's THE ANNIVERSARY, and was both an actor and producer on Kermit C. Graham's upcoming war film KHYBER.  Jason moved back to St. Louis in 2013 to write, produce and star in FOUR COLOR EULOGY.  Since then, Jason has moved behind the camera having directed Taylor Pietz's music video for her original single ""Color Me"", and has been Wyatt Weed's go to assistant camera operator and assistant director on such fan film projects as TRINITY and THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  In addition to his work behind the camera, Jason is also the co-writer of Archlight Studios' upcoming western drama RETRIBUTION.

column1: Nicholas grew up in St. Louis, but at the age of 14, his family moved to a small town in Southern Missouri named Piedmont. During this time, Nicholas discovered a passion for acting by competing on the school speech team and in such plays as YOU CAN’T TAKE IT WITH YOU (as Grandpa), TURMOILS IN TUCSON (as Tom Trueheart), AN EVENING OF EDGAR ALLEN POE (Actor #1), and LONG LIVE ROCK N ROLL (as King Kenny Kool). Nick moved back to St. Louis in 2000 with his grandma Wilma and began training and studying his craft as a writer, primarily focusing on screenplays and comic books. In 2002 Nick returned to the stage in a production of GODSPELL (as Nick the Apostle) and since then such films as TRINITY, THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM, KILLERS BY NATURE, and FOUR COLOR EULOGY (of which he also co-wrote and co-produced) . Recently, Nicholas has become a member of The 2 Guys Talking Network and is the co-host of the network's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. podcast.  Nicholas also hosts his own podcast on the network entitled 2 Guys Talking Horror and is one of the primary hosts of the comic book themed podcast My Big Fat Pull List.  Nick is also one of the Co-Writers and Co-Producers of Archlight Studios' upcoming western RETRIBUTION.

Nate, a native of St. Louis, MO, grew up devouring any comic book he could get his hands on.  Over the years he focused his view and talents on training himself in sequential storytelling.  He learned to draw primarily by standing his action figures up and trying to draw what he saw.  His love of 80’s cartoons, action figures and comics led him to pursuing art and taking courses through The Joe Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art.  Nate has been a contributing creator to the 48 Hour Comic Project and has even been a recipient of ""Best Artist"" Award for his work on issue 2.  Aside from being the artist and co-creator of Archlight Comics flagship title LEGACIES END: CELESTIALS AND PALADINS, Nate is also one of the designers of the book having designed over half of the major characters.  Nate also did the character redesigns for the comic book characters that appeared in the film FOUR COLOR EULOGY.  On screen Nate has also appeared in small roles in both FOUR COLOR EULOGY and the opening racetrack sequence of THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  For more on Nathan check out his other art online.

An avid collector and film fanatic, John dabbled in comic art himself before pursing a career as an actor and drama teacher.  In the course of his exceptionally busy career,  John has appeared in over 200 theatrical stage productions and has worked with theatre companies all across the country including The Repertory Theatre of St. Louis, The Muny, The Black Rep, Stages St. Louis, The Starlight in Kansas City, The Fox in Atlanta, Theatre Project Company, Westport Playhouse, St. Louis Actor’s Studio, St. Louis Shakespeare, Mustard Seed and Avalon Theatre Company just to name a few.  He has played such iconic roles as Tevya in FIDDLER ON THE ROOF, Pseudolus, in A FUNNY THING HAPPENED ON THE WAY TO THE FORUM,  Shylock in THE MERCHANT OF VENICE, Robert in PROOF, The Stage Manager in OUR TOWN, Norman in ON GOLDEN POND,  Creon in Jean Anouilh’s ANTIGONE, and the title role in KING LEAR, a role for which he also earned the 2013 St. Louis Theater Circle Award nomination for Best Lead Actor in a Drama.  John went on to win that same award a year later for his portrayal of Willy Loman in DEATH OF A SALESMAN at Insight Theatre Company.  John also was the recipient of the 2010 Kevin Kline Award for Outstanding Actor in a Play for his portrayal of John Barrymore in BARRYMORE.  He also picked up two Broadway World awards for directing as well as St. Louis Theatre Circle Awards for Directing numerous times.  John has also appeared in a number of feature films including the indie anti-drug film APRIL IS MY RELIGION with director Bill Boll, the upcoming PAPER TIGER BURNS with director Gavin Culbertson and as Alfred Pennyworth in Wyatt Weed's THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  He was even featured in the St. Louis cult classic sci-fi film ESCAPE FROM NEW YORK.  Most notably, John was one of the Co-Writers and Stars of the very successful indie film FOUR COLOR EULOGY as well as Archlight Studios upcoming feature film RETRIBUTION.

Corey Leher is Chief Executive Officer of Archlight Entertainment, and Head Writer of “The Untamed Adventures of T.A.I.L.S.”, the current flagship comic series from Archlight Comics. Along with Co-founders Jason Contini and Nicholas J. Hearne, Corey helped launch Archlight Entertainment. This came after Contini approached Corey to be a writer for the relaunch and rebranding of a comic series that Jason had attempted years prior. When not executing the day-to-day logistics of running a company, Corey can be found contributing as a writer and producer to several of the Archlight Entertainment upcoming projects, including the supernatural western anthology ""THE DEVIL'S GUN"", ""RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS"", “Untamed Adventures of T.A.I.L.S.”, and “Daughter of Wolves”.  Prior to Archlight Entertainment, Corey received his Master’s in Education from the University of Washington - Seattle, in Sports Management, after having received his Bachelor’s in Arts from Westminster College in Fulton, where he majored in Transnational Politics, and minored in Anthropology and Sociology. Corey has lived all over the world, including countries like Senegal, Republic of Georgia, New Zealand, and his birth country of Zimbabwe.  When not working at Archlight Entertainment, Corey is at home with his wife raising their first child Nathaniel. He loves soccer, and is a huge Manchester United fan. Corey also enjoys Dungeons and Dragons, Comics, Movies and Television, and can often be found discussing the latest trends and events in the entertainment world.

Taylor is a St. Louis native who started her journey in performing at a young age. Taylor is a classically trained pianist and teaches private piano and voice throughout the St. Louis area. She currently teaches song-writing, choir, and dance fitness at John Burroughs School, and is the school’s resident choreographer.  She is also the resident choreographer and musical director for Whitfield School. She has worked with numerous professional theatre companies in the St. Louis area including The MUNY, New Line Theatre, Insight Theatre Company, The New Jewish Theatre, Bluff City Theater, and four seasons with STAGES St. Louis. Her many theatrical credits include: Our Town (Emily Webb) and 1776 (Martha Jefferson), the American regional premiere of Cry-Baby (Allison Vernon-Williams), the American regional premiere of Hands on a Hardbody (Heather Stovall), Evita (Eva Peron), Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson (Rachel Jackson) and the world premiere of Love Kills (Caril Ann Fugate) with New Line Theatre, for which she was named Best Actress in a Musical by the RiverFront Times in 2010.  Taylor received a 2013 Broadway World award for Best Supporting Actress in a Drama for her performance as Emily Webb in Our Town and was nominated for a 2013 St. Louis Theatre Circle Award for the same role.  Taylor is also an accomplished cabaret performer most known for her two shows CRAZY IS THE NEW BLACK and IF I ONLY HAD A BRAIN. No stranger to film, Taylor has appeared in such films as FIREPROOF GLOVES, GLASS TURNS CLOUDY, HAVE A NICE DAY, and FOUR COLOR EULOGY, for which she wrote the opening credits song “Color Me.”  Taylor is currently working on her first album, as well as the score for the upcoming western RETRIBURTION with Archlight Studios.

Archlight Studios does formally acknowledge that our project RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS: A MIGHTY CRUSADERS FAN FILM, is a NON-PROFIT fan film and is in no way afﬁliated with or represented with Archie Comics, Warner Bros., Time Warner and any other organization that owns the rights to The Mighty Crusaders.
Fan films are very popular and studios &
column2: production companies often allow them, provided they are not turning a profit of any kind. Our campaign is meant to raise money that will help cover the unforseen expenses that come up during low budget independent film production.   Everyone is working on this film out of love and passion and in their spare time.  No one will be getting paid on this project.  This is a completely non-profit film that will run free on sites such as Youtube and Vimeo as well as free screenings at various comic conventions (hopefully).

column1: This film, and any subsequent follow up chapters to this story, is solely meant to help celebrate the 80th Anniversary of the great MLJ/Archie hero characters. We want to allow fans to come together in support of these characters, and hopefully create some new Mighty Crusaders fans who will go purchase the classic comics along the way.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign and project.

As low budget filmmakers, we understand that some may not be able to financially donate and ""help"" this project even if they want to.  But there are other ways that you can help us get this film made!

column2: FOLLOW - This is just what it sounds like
column3: ""like"" and ""follow"" our Facebook page (www.facebook.com/MightyCrusadersFanFilm/) as well as our Twitter (@RedCircleFanFi1) and Instagram (@redcirclefanfilm) accounts.  (that way you'll still get to see all the updates that we post on those outlets.)

column1: SPREAD THE WORD - Low budget filmmakers need help spreading the word just as much as they need financing. You can help us by sharing the links to all of our social media accounts as well as telling friends, family, strangers, dogs, cats, basically anyone that will listen.  Let them know just how awesome this film could be with support.
FOLLOW THE CAMPAIGN PROGRESS: Follow this campaign (using the FOLLOW button on this page, above) to stay up-to-date on the progress of the making of this movie!

","RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS follows private investigator Walter Whitney, a PI who suffers from memory loss.  When he is approached by a mysterious young woman to help her locate a lost family member, Walter finds himself in an whirlwind investigation that is way more than he bargained for.  But what does this situation have to do with the disappearance of The Mighty Crusaders, Earth's greatest heroes, 30 years ago?  What are his connections to that super team and the day they went missing all those years ago?  And who is the new patriotic themed hero appearing dressed as The Shield?
For your support and donation we have assembled a plethora of unique and exclusive gifts including:
- DVD copies of the final film
- DVD copies of our previous original comic book themed feature film FOUR COLOR EULOGY (see trailer here: www.fourcolorthemovie.com)
- A Behind The Scenes Production booklet
- Custom Action Figures (created by Terrific Custom Toys)

Our primary goal of $2500.00 will help us get this film made BUT if we are able to continue to raise more beyond that, it will allow us to extend the film some and even be able to add more Crusaders characters in it.

At this mark we will produce a complete set of Red Circle Investigations Movie Trading Cards, exclusive only to supporters of this campaign.  And they will be sent out to every backer who donates at $10 (Blue Ribbon Prize) level and higher!
STRETCH GOAL #2 - W.E.B. (WATCHABLE EQUIPMENT BLU-RAY) UPGRADE - $3500.00
At this mark we will be able to provide an upgraded Blu-Ray of RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS to all backers who choose a level that comes with the DVD.

At this mark, we will will be able to get a number of fantastic artists (including Designer Nate Contini and Director Jason Contini) to recreate and pay homage to classic Mighty Crusaders comic book covers by redrawing them featuring the characters in their costumes from the Red Circle Fan Film.  There will be 5 prints in total and everyone who donated at the $10 (Blue Ribbon Prize) or higher will receive prints of the complete set.

Independent film making always comes with a lot of ""out of pocket"" costs.  This campaign is set up to help us go above and beyond what we can afford to do ourselves with the equipment that we already own. The Mighty Crusaders are such iconic and historic characters that have never been brought to life on screen before. That's why it is so important to us that we give these characters the treatment that they deserve and give you, the fans, the most professional vision of The Mighty Crusaders that we can give you.  With your generous support, our goal of $2500.00 will help us cover:
- Upgraded lenses for the camera to enhance the quality of the film
- Additional microphones and audio gear for highest sound quality
- Post Production filters and plug-ins to bring you better visual FX
- Materials and time for the many superhero costumes that need to be made or built
- Incidentals you never think about till you're on set: tape, safety pins, sharpies, towels, etc.
- Food - A hard working cast and crew has got eat to keep their strength up so they can give the best performance/work possible

Archlight Studios is a Mid-West based production company co-founded by Jason Contini and Nicholas J. Hearne.  Not only have we been very active in film production for over ten years, but we have also been active in the world of comic book publishing as well.  However this is not the first time we have melded the two (comics and films).  Our previous full length feature film, FOUR COLOR EULOGY, dealt with a young struggling comic book writer forced to return home to care for his ailing mother.  The film features a number of comic book references and has been called ""a more dramatic Kevin Smith film"".  The film premiered in 2016 and had a very successful theatrical run before coming to DVD.
For more on this film including trailers and background go to the FOUR COLOR EULOGY website or FOUR COLOR EULOGY Facebook Page.
In addition to the feature, Archlight Studios also produced a music video for Taylor Pietz's original single ""Color Me"" which featured as the opening theme song of the film.

Growing up in a St. Louis theatre family, Jason began acting at the age of 3 when he played The Littlest Prince in a regional theatre production of ""The King & I"".  Jason earned his Actor's Equity card doing three consecutive years of children's theatre with The Imaginary Theatre Company, the touring arm of The St. Louis Repertory Theatre. He has also worked with The Muny, Upstream Theatre, Bluff City Theater and Stages St. Louis to name a few. After a starring role in the Wyatt Weed's vampire thriller SHADOWLAND, Jason moved to Los Angeles to pursue film acting full time. There he starred in John Campea's THE ANNIVERSARY, and was both an actor and producer on Kermit C. Graham's upcoming war film KHYBER.  Jason moved back to St. Louis in 2013 to write, produce and star in FOUR COLOR EULOGY.  Since then, Jason has moved behind the camera having directed Taylor Pietz's music video for her original single ""Color Me"", and has been Wyatt Weed's go to assistant camera operator and assistant director on such fan film projects as TRINITY and THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  In addition to his work behind the camera, Jason is also the co-writer of Archlight Studios' upcoming western drama RETRIBUTION.

Nicholas grew up in St. Louis, but at the age of 14, his family moved to a small town in Southern Missouri named Piedmont. During this time, Nicholas discovered a passion for acting by competing on the school speech team and in such plays as YOU CAN’T TAKE IT WITH YOU (as Grandpa), TURMOILS IN TUCSON (as Tom Trueheart), AN EVENING OF EDGAR ALLEN POE (Actor #1), and LONG LIVE ROCK N ROLL (as King Kenny Kool). Nick moved back to St. Louis in 2000 with his grandma Wilma and began training and studying his craft as a writer, primarily focusing on screenplays and comic books. In 2002 Nick returned to the stage in a production of GODSPELL (as Nick the Apostle) and since then such films as TRINITY, THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM, KILLERS BY NATURE, and FOUR COLOR EULOGY (of which he also co-wrote and co-produced) . Recently, Nicholas has become a member of The 2 Guys Talking Network and is the co-host of the network's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. podcast.  Nicholas also hosts his own podcast on the network entitled 2 Guys Talking Horror and is one of the primary hosts of the comic book themed podcast My Big Fat Pull List.  Nick is also one of the Co-Writers and Co-Producers of Archlight Studios' upcoming western RETRIBUTION.

Nate, a native of St. Louis, MO, grew up devouring any comic book he could get his hands on.  Over the years he focused his view and talents on training himself in sequential storytelling.  He learned to draw primarily by standing his action figures up and trying to draw what he saw.  His love of 80’s cartoons, action figures and comics led him to pursuing art and taking courses through The Joe Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art.  Nate has been a contributing creator to the 48 Hour Comic Project and has even been a recipient of ""Best Artist"" Award for his work on issue 2.  Aside from being the artist and co-creator of Archlight Comics flagship title LEGACIES END: CELESTIALS AND PALADINS, Nate is also one of the designers of the book having designed over half of the major characters.  Nate also did the character redesigns for the comic book characters that appeared in the film FOUR COLOR EULOGY.  On screen Nate has also appeared in small roles in both FOUR COLOR EULOGY and the opening racetrack sequence of THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  For more on Nathan check out his other art online.

An avid collector and film fanatic, John dabbled in comic art himself before pursing a career as an actor and drama teacher.  In the course of his exceptionally busy career,  John has appeared in over 200 theatrical stage productions and has worked with theatre companies all across the country including The Repertory Theatre of St. Louis, The Muny, The Black Rep, Stages St. Louis, The Starlight in Kansas City, The Fox in Atlanta, Theatre Project Company, Westport Playhouse, St. Louis Actor’s Studio, St. Louis Shakespeare, Mustard Seed and Avalon Theatre Company just to name a few.  He has played such iconic roles as Tevya in FIDDLER ON THE ROOF, Pseudolus, in A FUNNY THING HAPPENED ON THE WAY TO THE FORUM,  Shylock in THE MERCHANT OF VENICE, Robert in PROOF, The Stage Manager in OUR TOWN, Norman in ON GOLDEN POND,  Creon in Jean Anouilh’s ANTIGONE, and the title role in KING LEAR, a role for which he also earned the 2013 St. Louis Theater Circle Award nomination for Best Lead Actor in a Drama.  John went on to win that same award a year later for his portrayal of Willy Loman in DEATH OF A SALESMAN at Insight Theatre Company.  John also was the recipient of the 2010 Kevin Kline Award for Outstanding Actor in a Play for his portrayal of John Barrymore in BARRYMORE.  He also picked up two Broadway World awards for directing as well as St. Louis Theatre Circle Awards for Directing numerous times.  John has also appeared in a number of feature films including the indie anti-drug film APRIL IS MY RELIGION with director Bill Boll, the upcoming PAPER TIGER BURNS with director Gavin Culbertson and as Alfred Pennyworth in Wyatt Weed's THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS: AN EPIC FAN FILM.  He was even featured in the St. Louis cult classic sci-fi film ESCAPE FROM NEW YORK.  Most notably, John was one of the Co-Writers and Stars of the very successful indie film FOUR COLOR EULOGY as well as Archlight Studios upcoming feature film RETRIBUTION.

Corey Leher is Chief Executive Officer of Archlight Entertainment, and Head Writer of “The Untamed Adventures of T.A.I.L.S.”, the current flagship comic series from Archlight Comics. Along with Co-founders Jason Contini and Nicholas J. Hearne, Corey helped launch Archlight Entertainment. This came after Contini approached Corey to be a writer for the relaunch and rebranding of a comic series that Jason had attempted years prior. When not executing the day-to-day logistics of running a company, Corey can be found contributing as a writer and producer to several of the Archlight Entertainment upcoming projects, including the supernatural western anthology ""THE DEVIL'S GUN"", ""RED CIRCLE INVESTIGATIONS"", “Untamed Adventures of T.A.I.L.S.”, and “Daughter of Wolves”.  Prior to Archlight Entertainment, Corey received his Master’s in Education from the University of Washington - Seattle, in Sports Management, after having received his Bachelor’s in Arts from Westminster College in Fulton, where he majored in Transnational Politics, and minored in Anthropology and Sociology. Corey has lived all over the world, including countries like Senegal, Republic of Georgia, New Zealand, and his birth country of Zimbabwe.  When not working at Archlight Entertainment, Corey is at home with his wife raising their first child Nathaniel. He loves soccer, and is a huge Manchester United fan. Corey also enjoys Dungeons and Dragons, Comics, Movies and Television, and can often be found discussing the latest trends and events in the entertainment world.

A 15-minute comedy short film, great production values, a quirky and surreal script with a female protagonist, produced and supported by a female-led team.

column2: >*NEW* Stay up to date with the filming and production by following us on instagram!

column1: My name is Kat. I am a German actress and the producer of this short film. Last October my partner and I heard a story on the radio about a man in the US who went on a series of dinner dates with women and always ran out when the bill came. The police got him, and the story was so strange that it made the news:
We immediately thought the story had potential for a dark comedy, and started thinking about whether a woman could play the role of the man running out on the dates.

That's how we came up with our main character, Steph. Think Villanelle, from Killing Eve, only she doesn't kill people, she just leaves them broke. She doesn’t like to conform to society’s rules. She’s conceited, anarchic and destructive in the pursuit of something that eludes and frustrates her. What's more, she gets weirder and more daring as the film goes on.

Through a mixture of surreal elements, montage, snappy interrupted dialogue and the film’s Wes Anderson-inspired aesthetic, the audience gets to know Steph’s pretty narcissistic idea of herself in a world she’s creating and quickly burning to the ground.

Our talented cast includes some acting 'royalty'. Playing two of the luckless guys are Alexander Tol (seen in the teaser), from the series ""Victoria"", and Philip Andrew who stars in the series ""The Spanish Princess"".

Kwame Asiedu
Rupert Fawcett
Steff Golding
Sam Patrick
Molly Merwin
Kara-Dee Rai
Chris Rogers
Emma Louise Selwood
Jay Oliver Yip
Ella Gonzales
Jess Bastick-Vines
A little teaser sequence from the script:
We plan to submit the film to festivals:
We hired women in key behind-the-camera roles for this production in order to show that more women should have those jobs in the film industry.
This comedy short film is for anyone who’s bored with mainstream story-telling and looking for something different, something a bit bonkers.

At the moment this production is entirely self-funded by the producer. The primary risk associated with this campaign is having enough funding to cover for the wages for all production artists including post-production.
You can also help us in getting the word out about our short film. Please share the link to the campaign and tell your friends about this.
*NEW* Stay up to date with the filming and production by following us on instagram!

Our documentary explores the environmental, political and sociological impacts of the food industry in the UK. We aim to explore the facts on consumption trends and the flaws they bring while simultaneously looking towards the future of food production and those who seek to change it. The Uk has shown growing concern over major subjects such as global warming, international relations &
column2: unsustainable energy. Our documentary hopes to show viewers what role they play in the world and how a change in their actions can help make a better tomorrow.

column1: Come with us through this journey, where we will show you the revolutionaries of the UK food market and how they are changing the system for the better.

We are asking for a budget of £1500 in order to achieve the best quality of filming and content possible! Of course with a flexible campaign, all of your money will be used to the best of our ability to create something stunning.

column2: all the small farming communities in between.

column1: • Interviewees and personnel that helped along the way

• As a documentary that focuses on the environmental and agricultural challenges faced, we are wanting to create a carbon and wastage neutral documentary (or as close as it possibly gets). For this, we need your help, in order to balance the scales and make something good for you and good for the planet.

It is a challenge to make a documentary that wishes to take on such huge corporations however once we can openly show this documentary, we want to be able to do it freely without any ties from anything, by doing this, we could show and spread this doc as far and wide, thanks to you.

You will be investing in a documentary that is focused on showing you a little more about this industry, we are committed to reach more knowledge to the viewers. Knowledge is power and hopefully, this will change with your help.

We understand that your money is in our hands, and you are helping us achieve our dreams. Naturally many things can happen, however even if we don't achieve the budget we are still able to work with a smaller amount of money and create a lower budget version of the project. The main difficulties would be reaching the more remote areas for our documentary and these travel expenses however we would get around these issues!

“Being the producer of this project is something I have been building up for the last 3 years in this university course. Producing is my calling, have been doing it since I was 16 in different areas ranging from television programs, to short films, it has all culminated to this project, as Documentaries are my passion, and so is the environment and agriculture, I am excited to put everything aside and make this project the best it can be”

“For the past 3 years, I’ve had a strong passion for making documentaries. Their way of showing real-life experiences shows just how powerful documentary is as an art form. I’ve directed multiple films and documentaries throughout my time at university and feel that I’ve gained real skills within my role that will be able to take this production to the next level.”

“Having been involved in sound design for the past 3 years of this course, I feel like my skills have developed to a point where I can confidently say I am proficient in the area. The films I've perfectly worked have been predominantly fiction but I’ve hungered to work on a documentary that has captivated me with a topic that I’m honestly interested in and feel like this project has accomplished that.”

“I’ve been editing since I was 16 from residential courses to university work and feel as though these last 3 years have really helped me gain a greater understanding of what works and how to tie a story together. Despite having taken a large break this past year from editing major pieces I’ve continued to practice in my spare time and feel I am ready to work on something large scale. I’m excited to work on a documentary relating to social issues and our world today, the topic is fascinating and I think with my editing I can pull together an engaging narrative that will leave a lasting impact on audiences”

It is completely understandable if you cannot donate, and I thank you if you've supported and are looking at this page right now! Instead of donating please share it in your social media! If you believe in our project and us that is already an incredible start. If you just want to talk to us about some more information get in contact! We are here to divulge this project and you are already helping.

Our documentary explores the environmental, political and sociological impacts of the food industry in the UK. We aim to explore the facts on consumption trends and the flaws they bring while simultaneously looking towards the future of food production and those who seek to change it. The Uk has shown growing concern over major subjects such as global warming, international relations & unsustainable energy. Our documentary hopes to show viewers what role they play in the world and how a change in their actions can help make a better tomorrow.
Come with us through this journey, where we will show you the revolutionaries of the UK food market and how they are changing the system for the better.
What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a budget of £1500 in order to achieve the best quality of filming and content possible! Of course with a flexible campaign, all of your money will be used to the best of our ability to create something stunning.
We are using the funding for :
Traveling through Manchester, London, Oxford, Edinburg & all the small farming communities in between.

“Having been involved in sound design for the past 3 years of this course, I feel like my skills have developed to a point where I can confidently say I am proficient in the area. The films I've perfectly worked have been predominantly fiction but I’ve hungered to work on a documentary that has captivated me with a topic that I’m honestly interested in and feel like this project has accomplished that.”

“I’ve been editing since I was 16 from residential courses to university work and feel as though these last 3 years have really helped me gain a greater understanding of what works and how to tie a story together. Despite having taken a large break this past year from editing major pieces I’ve continued to practice in my spare time and feel I am ready to work on something large scale. I’m excited to work on a documentary relating to social issues and our world today, the topic is fascinating and I think with my editing I can pull together an engaging narrative that will leave a lasting impact on audiences”

It is completely understandable if you cannot donate, and I thank you if you've supported and are looking at this page right now! Instead of donating please share it in your social media! If you believe in our project and us that is already an incredible start. If you just want to talk to us about some more information get in contact! We are here to divulge this project and you are already helping.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Lola O'Connors, a mid-20s introvert, struggles with social anxiety. One of her only outlets for self-expression is her love for hard rock. Specifically, she idolizes the front woman of her favorite band, May Hart. Who leads the otherwise all male rock band Limowreck. Tired of being shut in, she decides it's time to let the world see who she truly is and through the process discovers something about herself and her idol.
Money donated to this short film will help finance:
• Transportation of props, crew and equipment to location
• Scoring and recording of the films sound track and companion album
All donor names will be listed in the credits unless we are told not to.
Every cent that we raise will help us create a better film! Please help make this project the best that it can be.
If you can't help financially with the project please share this campaign and its promotional material on social media. The more people that see this project the more successful it will be!

Just Bake Cookies is the coming of age story of a young man named Quinton and his struggle to navigate his way from teen to manhood. We meet Quinton in high school as he saves another kid from being bullied by beating the assailants. Quinton's Grandfather, Pops has been raising Quinton ever since his mother passed away from Cancer a few years earlier. Pops is very wise and loving but has a hard time helping Quinton keep his anger in check. Pops comes to the realization that he needs reinforcements to rein in his well-meaning but ultimately undisciplined grandson. He enrolls Quinton in a local Kung Fu school and through his martial arts training, Quinton finds himself. Fast forward a few years later. Quinton has transitioned nicely into a good man and is now a Mixed Martial Arts world champion. However, Pops has developed Alzheimer's disease. Throughout Quinton's life, he's faced many challenging obstacles. His Grandfather's illness may be the toughest yet. Just Bake Cookies was written by Quinn Early and is directed by his son Cameron Early. The two have been able to share some amazing experiences together working as stuntmen on several movies and TV shows such as, Bright, S.W.A.T. and Seal Team. Just Bake Cookies is based on their relationship. Quinn's mother Ann Early was diagnosed with Alzheimer's in 2008 and passed away in 2013. Just Bake Cookies will also be used as a vehicle to raise money and bring awareness to this horrible disease that ultimately took Ann's life.
With your help, we'll be able to create an amazing film that will help raise money to stop Alzheimer's, which effects so many people.

The risks of the success of this project are as follows: The success of Just Bake Cookies will depend on the funding that we receive. We'll  begin filming in March, 2020. The casting is set and we have secured locations. The funding of the project will help get us to the finish line.
