STORY

Last Wash is the story of Benny, an artist who is content with his life as a day-shift laundromat attendant except for one thing:  he's hopelessly single. One day, he's forced to work open to close--but he's been the day shift attendant for years! Then Iris, the lead singer of a touring indie band, comes stomping in and makes him question everything.

It's an indie, 2006 vibe before smart phones, when anything was possible...even love.

About ~ 12 minutes in length.  Filming is scheduled February 2020 with post-production wrapping in May 2020.

 

WHERE IS THE PREMIER? 

It will be shown at the Kimo Theater in downtown Albuquerque in mid-May (actual date TBD) for the UNM Capstone Senior Show.

ABOUT US

Our team is comprised of University of New Mexico students and film professionals who are generously volunteering their time to mentor and work with us.  This film is part of our senior ""thesis"" that is required to graduate from the College of Fine Arts at UNM. We are working hard to make this film the best it can be.

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Your support will help us bring this story to the screen!

While currently this project is a labor of love, donations will go towards locations, equipment, supplies, props, costumes, hair and makeup, meals and to pay our cast and crew.  It is a 7 day shoot and the experience will be fun and comfortable for all who work on it.

Even the smallest donations will help!

#UNMFilm

Honey is a dark comedy/thriller about an eccentric witch who, along with her honeysuckle plant familiar, concocts a potion to give her delivery boy some manners.
Honey is a short film created by Towson University students for the Electronic Media and Film major. Learn more about us!
• This film is being created by an all-female above the line crew.
• We aim to power through with production of this film, despite the current hardships regarding school closure. Honey is a power team!
• This is a Baltimore-based production with a West Virginian writer/director.

• Honey's shooting dates have been postponed for the health and safety of our team. While we are waiting to hear when it will be safe to film, our team is hard at work with the pre-production process! We appreciate your patience and understanding in this time of uncertainty. However, we remain in high spirits with the knowledge that all we can do at this time is even better prepare ourselves for the production of this film.
• Please refer to this page's FAQ section with further questions.

Honey is a swing-jazz-loving, well-mannered, plant-loving witch. She makes honey pot potions to give her friends and neighbors a better day at work, or a little luck with love, whatever they need! However, her delivery boy Chester is a complete killjoy. He thinks she's a snake oil salesman and delivers her potions with as much enthusiasm as a dead slug. Honey, after consulting her familiar (a honeysuckle plant named Eleanora), decides to concoct a spell to make him sweeter: Miss Honey's Patented Sweetener Spell to be exact! Unfortunately, Chester isn't taking it. When Honey decides to have him over for tea as a last-ditch effort to give him the spell, things get a little out of hand and Honey reveals her real witch side.

Hello everyone! My name is Chloë Williams, and I am a West Virginian writer and director. I wrote Honey because I wanted to create something fun to make, and fun to watch. Honey has become such a vivid character to me. She practically jumps off of the page! My crew and I are so excited to bring her and her wild adventure to life through your generous donations. I know you'll fall in love with her 50's style and eccentric wit, and maybe you'll even come to love grumpy ol' Chester as well. (We already know you'll like Eleanora. She's a really neat plant.)

My crew and I are extremely passionate about and dedicated to this project. We are proud to boast our all-female above-the-line team. However, we are also very proud of the rest of our crew, all of whom are talented, go-getters. I couldn't be happier with the group we have for this production. Now all we need is you. Your financial support will ensure that this project is able to get off of the ground and onto the big screen. My team and I thank you in advance for your kind support.
Here is what your donation will go towards:
• Finding and booking a great location for Honey's home.
• Keeping the cast and crew well fed.
• Art department: finding Honey some great plants, witchy decorations, other props, and creating her 1950's look through costuming, hair, and makeup.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Share this campaign on your social media and/or send it to your friends and family, every little bit helps!
• Share Honey promo as it gets released on YouTube and other social media to get the word out!

We thank you so much and can't wait for production to begin!

- Chloë, Emily, Milly, and Caroline

“KENYA” is a postmodern science fiction/action film written by Shaun Davis and Directed by Loraine ffrench.
Every superhero has an origin story, detailing how they gained their powers and decided to fight crime
column2: and Kenya Cole (the protagonist of this story) is no different.

column1: Following a savage beating at the hands of a group of racist thugs, who have been emboldened by the Brexit vote, Kenya uses the experimental super soldier enhancement implant created by a generous engineer to exact revenge on her attackers and the shadowy organisation behind it all.

Set against the backdrop of Brexit in present-day South London, United Kingdom, and utilising a limited number of realistic practical sets and outdoor locations, with trained stunt professionals and no need for major special effects, “KENYA” could be made on a conservative budget.

“KENYA” is a gritty, urban saga of prejudice and murder, human weakness and female empowerment. It’s a hyper-realistic superhero tale of one woman’s struggle to escape her own limitations and unleash her true potential.

The subject matter in “KENYA” is extraordinary – but rooted in reality. Enhanced Human Operations, human bio-enhancement, “go-pills,” biological technologies, mental adaptation, skill learning, and nanotechnology… we want to use the science of bio-engineering to ground our action in reality.

Our superhuman abilities will remain mostly limited to telepathy and skill learning. But when we do see these powers in use, they will be amazing, memorable, bizarre, their style taking cues from the masters of the field: Stan Lee, Jack Kirby, Steve Ditko, Dave Gibbons, Jim Romita, Mike Mignola, Gil Kane, and Fiona Staples. To convincingly convey our superpowers on screen, we plan to utilise a combination of prosthetics, trained stunt professionals, low key CGI, and some good old-fashioned acting.
Loraine has always wanted to do an action film with a black actress as the lead character so, for her, this is her dream debut feature

Within the current climate there is a push for more diversity as well as more women Directors.  Also, at the moment, people want to back diverse films—so this is the perfect time to be creating new stories.
Having self-funded the pilot, we now need your help in making the feature film a reality.

The first step will be Pre-Production, for this vital step we need your help in achieving £10,000 - with this we'll be in a position to lock in talent and crew, source locations and bring on Producers and distributors. Essentially getting everything we need to start production in January 2021.
The perks start from a shout out on our social media pages to getting to be on set and meet cast and crew.

We're bringing the Black British experience into a sci-fi, kung fu fighting action film - a different viewpoint of the 'hero' - we think this is exciting and a great way to force change with the lack of diversity in British Cinema as well as empower others to create their own stories.
If you can't contribute financially, you can still contribute by sharing this Campaign and forwarding on and sharing to anyone and everyone.

Having self-funded the pilot, we now need your help in making the feature film a reality.

THE STORY 

On the first day of classes at a rural high school, Emmanuel, a civil-war fascinated teen with undiagnosed Asperger's, desperately struggles to maintain his friendship with his reenacting buddy, Judith, as she moves towards the popular crowd. Monocacy is a personal work of award-winning and local Frederick County, Maryland filmmaker Lincoln Robisch.  With this film, he and his production team wishes to showcase how neurodivergent individuals navigate relationships and are often negatively treated in the culture of rural high schools in America. 

DIRECTOR’S STATEMENT 

Monocacy, in one form or another, has been on my mind for the better part of 3 years. It is a story rooted in a conglomeration of my childhood experiences and is easily my most personal work to date. Our purpose in making the film is to shed a light on the experiences of those on the Autism spectrum within the culture of rural high schools in America today. The fictional Monocacy High School, of which the majority of the picture will take place in, represents a concoction of characteristics uniquely specific to our times. Our neurodivergent lead, Emmanuel, struggles to maintain a simple friendship amidst the school’s tumultuous environment of anti-political correctness. 

Much of my approach to tackling this subject has been informed by my experiences growing up as a sibling of an older sister with Autism. I have had the opportunity to see up-close how the culture of our times impacts individuals like her. For this reason, this project is of the utmost importance to me. I feel it is essential that this film be made now so that we are able to fully confront the negative normalities of our current culture as it relates to those that are neurodivergent. I hope you will assist us in this effort. Thank you.

Our fundraising goal is $5,000. To see what your donation will be going towards, we have provided a simplified budget breakdown for you below. Any amount of financial support is appreciated, and for certain thresholds, we are offering various perks. See side panel for these exciting incentives!
• $2,750 - Gear and Location Rentals (Cameras and Accessories, Lighting, Walkies etc.)
• $600 - Art Department (Wardrobe, Set Decoration, and Props)

In 2013, Asperger's syndrome (AS) became categorized as an autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This disorder's characteristics include impaired social interactions and limited repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, and activities. Motor skills may also be delayed, but strong verbal language skills and intellectual ability distinguish AS from other types of autism.

It is estimated that two out of every 10,000 children have the disorder. Boys are more likely than girls to be diagnosed with Asperger's syndrome, but this could be because girls with AS are often overlooked or misdiagnosed.
With this film, our goal is to increase awareness, understanding, and acceptance of such individuals among the autism spectrum.
For more information please visit these links:
*This film is not associated with the above organizations. Links are for educational purposes to inform our audiences.

Our production team is working in an abundance of caution to address the many risks associated with this film--especially while planning to film at this point in 2020. In order to shoot in August, we would need to at least be in Phase Two of the CDC’s “Opening Up America Again” guidelines. At this point, groups of 50 people or less will be allowed as long as distancing and sanitation protocols are enforced. We will ONLY follow through with these dates if the trajectory of the virus and the statistics in the area deem it safe to do so. If the trajectory and statistics say otherwise, we will move the dates.

Part of our distancing and sanitation guidelines will include: providing masks to everyone on set, individually-packing meals, placing hand-sanitation stations in convenient and commonly used areas, purchasing a contactless thermometer for daily temperature readings upon every person’s arrival to set, and of course, enforcing social distancing guidelines.

This on-set protocol has been developed through the research of professional sets that have either begun filming in various parts of the world, or of production companies which have laid out their plans for when their productions DO start filming again.
Every donation will help to carry out this protocol, thus providing a safer and healthier set.
We understand that some of our supporters may not be able to contribute financially at this time, but we'd love for you to share this campaign on social media to help get the word out!

Meet the Filmmakers! 

 

Director: Lincoln Robisch 

Lincoln Robisch is an award-winning writer and director from Frederick, MD. Among his accomplishments are winning Best Drama for his short film ""40-Love"" at the Ocean City Film Festival and having his short film ""For The Rabbits"" selected to premiere on the online exhibition site NoBudge. A senior in Towson University’s Electronic Media and Film program, he has also worked for the university’s Digital Media Department for several years. He has served multiple semesters on the executive board of Towson’s well-established media production society Lambda Kappa Tau. Lincoln’s childhood experiences growing up with an older sister with Autism have informed much of his work. Many of his cinematic ventures explore the frequently strained relationship of those that are neurodivergent to society. In exploring these themes, his approach focuses heavily on realism and portraying the potency of a single moment in time.

Co- Producer and Editor: Natalie Pelaez 

Natalie Pelaez is the co-producer and editor of Monocacy. She is part of Towson University's graduating class of 2020
column2:
she began making independent films in 2016. Over the past four years, Natalie's passion for editing has led her to work on a variety of genres—from drama to comedy to horror. Most recently, Natalie wrote, directed, and edited the short, ""Maria."" Her experience with the emotionally-packed film, made alongside a skillful crew, makes her excited to produce Monocacy. Natalie is also a member of Towson's media production society Lambda Kappa Tau where she held the position of Treasurer for a term. With her financial management and creative skills, she is confident that she and the team will be raising the bar to make their most incredible film yet. 

 

Co- Producer: Patrick McAllister 

Patrick McAllister is the co-producer of Monocacy. He is also apart of the graduating Class of 2020 at Towson University, majoring in Electronic Media and Film (EMF). As a student, Patrick has had the privilege of working on a wide variety of films, many with Natalie and Lincoln. Highlights include writing and directing his short film Simmer, a winner of several festival awards. Patrick has a passion for the camera department as he held the role of cinematographer or assistant cameraman on projects and got to hone in on his technical knowledge by working for Towson's equipment cage (EMF). Patrick is also active in Lambda Kappa Tau and is finishing up his term as Vice President. Partick is interested in producing entertaining films that contain stories that leave audiences with food for thought when credits role, and he believes Monocacy is one of those films. With his leadership and film production skills, he believes he will be able to assist in Monocacy's making successfully.  

Director of Photography: Seth Herzog  

Casting Director: Lauren Maiden 

Production Designer: Ayo Tunde-Sanya

Ayo Tunde-Sanya is a junior double majoring in Electronic Media and Film and Psychology at Towson University. She has been a member of the Art Department on numerous short films and featured as an Assistant Director. A few projects that she is most proud of to date are Lincoln Robish's Outlet, of which she was the production designer and Simi, a short film she wrote and plans to direct in the Summer of 2020. Ayo participates in many extracurriculars based on her majors. Pertaining to film, she is an active member of Lambda Kappa Tau, a media society. Ayo came into the film world determined to only be a screenwriter- she has written a total of two features, one of which placed her as a quarter-finalist in a national contest. After much navigation within three years of studying film at Towson University, she has found her passions broaden to screenwriting, directing, and working in the art department. She is excited to challenge her production design skills learned from her previous projects to work on Monocacy.  

Sound Designer: Brock Jones 
Brock Jones is the Sound Designer for Monocacy. He is a Class of 2019 graduate of Towson University's Electronic Media and Film department. He has been in love with audio and sound since high school, and his studies have led me to pursue sound design in film. Brock's sound design work has been featured on multiple award-winning films including, ""Dog Person"" - Directed by Justin Fairweather, ""Hit and Run"" - Directed by Alex Dapp, ""Outlet"" - Directed by Lincoln Robisch and ""Full Moon"" - Directed by Kenny Brossoie. During his time at Towson, Brock stayed active even outside his curriculum. He was an active member of the media society Lambda Kappa Tau as Marketing Chair, an intern for Studio Unknown, and completed various freelance sound designer work. Brock also participated in the school's Greek Life community as a founding member of the Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity's Towson chapter. Brock's passion and experience extend from sound design and reaches to audio engineering, production sound, and radio production. He is confident that he can bring a quality sound design to Monocacy. 

Thank you, for your support and for your time!

Sincerely, 

The Monocacy Production Team

The fictional Monocacy High School, of which the majority of the picture will take place in, represents a concoction of characteristics uniquely specific to our times. Our neurodivergent lead, Emmanuel, struggles to maintain a simple friendship amidst the school’s tumultuous environment of anti-political correctness. Much of my approach to tackling this subject has been informed by my experiences growing up as a sibling of an older sister with Autism. I have had the opportunity to see up-close how the culture of our times impacts individuals like her. For this reason, this project is of the utmost importance to me. I feel it is essential that this film be made now so that we are able to fully confront the negative normalities of our current culture as it relates to those that are neurodivergent. I hope you will assist us in this effort. Thank you.

column1: Our fundraising goal is $5,000. To see what your donation will be going towards, we have provided a simplified budget breakdown for you below. Any amount of financial support is appreciated, and for certain thresholds, we are offering various perks. See side panel for these exciting incentives!
$2,750 - Gear and Location Rentals (Cameras and Accessories, Lighting, Walkies etc.)
$600 - Art Department (Wardrobe, Set Decoration, and Props)

In 2013, Asperger's syndrome (AS) became categorized as an autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This disorder's characteristics include impaired social interactions and limited repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, and activities. Motor skills may also be delayed, but strong verbal language skills and intellectual ability distinguish AS from other types of autism.

It is estimated that two out of every 10,000 children have the disorder. Boys are more likely than girls to be diagnosed with Asperger's syndrome, but this could be because girls with AS are often overlooked or misdiagnosed.
With this film, our goal is to increase awareness, understanding, and acceptance of such individuals among the autism spectrum.
For more information please visit these links:
*This film is not associated with the above organizations. Links are for educational purposes to inform our audiences.

Our production team is working in an abundance of caution to address the many risks associated with this film--especially while planning to film at this point in 2020. In order to shoot in August, we would need to at least be in Phase Two of the CDC’s “Opening Up America Again” guidelines. At this point, groups of 50 people or less will be allowed as long as distancing and sanitation protocols are enforced. We will ONLY follow through with these dates if the trajectory of the virus and the statistics in the area deem it safe to do so. If the trajectory and statistics say otherwise, we will move the dates.

Part of our distancing and sanitation guidelines will include: providing masks to everyone on set, individually-packing meals, placing hand-sanitation stations in convenient and commonly used areas, purchasing a contactless thermometer for daily temperature readings upon every person’s arrival to set, and of course, enforcing social distancing guidelines.

This on-set protocol has been developed through the research of professional sets that have either begun filming in various parts of the world, or of production companies which have laid out their plans for when their productions DO start filming again.
Every donation will help to carry out this protocol, thus providing a safer and healthier set.
We understand that some of our supporters may not be able to contribute financially at this time, but we'd love for you to share this campaign on social media to help get the word out!
Follow us on Instagram and Facebook: @monocacyfilm

Meet the Filmmakers!  Director: Lincoln Robisch Lincoln Robisch is an award-winning writer and director from Frederick, MD. Among his accomplishments are winning Best Drama for his short film ""40-Love"" at the Ocean City Film Festival and having his short film ""For The Rabbits"" selected to premiere on the online exhibition site NoBudge. A senior in Towson University’s Electronic Media and Film program, he has also worked for the university’s Digital Media Department for several years. He has served multiple semesters on the executive board of Towson’s well-established media production society Lambda Kappa Tau. Lincoln’s childhood experiences growing up with an older sister with Autism have informed much of his work. Many of his cinematic ventures explore the frequently strained relationship of those that are neurodivergent to society. In exploring these themes, his approach focuses heavily on realism and portraying the potency of a single moment in time.Co- Producer and Editor: Natalie Pelaez Natalie Pelaez is the co-producer and editor of Monocacy. She is part of Towson University's graduating class of 2020
column2: she began making independent films in 2016. Over the past four years, Natalie's passion for editing has led her to work on a variety of genres—from drama to comedy to horror. Most recently, Natalie wrote, directed, and edited the short, ""Maria."" Her experience with the emotionally-packed film, made alongside a skillful crew, makes her excited to produce Monocacy. Natalie is also a member of Towson's media production society Lambda Kappa Tau where she held the position of Treasurer for a term. With her financial management and creative skills, she is confident that she and the team will be raising the bar to make their most incredible film yet.  Co- Producer: Patrick McAllister Patrick McAllister is the co-producer of Monocacy. He is also apart of the graduating Class of 2020 at Towson University, majoring in Electronic Media and Film (EMF). As a student, Patrick has had the privilege of working on a wide variety of films, many with Natalie and Lincoln. Highlights include writing and directing his short film Simmer, a winner of several festival awards. Patrick has a passion for the camera department as he held the role of cinematographer or assistant cameraman on projects and got to hone in on his technical knowledge by working for Towson's equipment cage (EMF). Patrick is also active in Lambda Kappa Tau and is finishing up his term as Vice President. Partick is interested in producing entertaining films that contain stories that leave audiences with food for thought when credits role, and he believes Monocacy is one of those films. With his leadership and film production skills, he believes he will be able to assist in Monocacy's making successfully.  Director of Photography: Seth Herzog  Casting Director: Lauren Maiden Production Designer: Ayo Tunde-SanyaAyo Tunde-Sanya is a junior double majoring in Electronic Media and Film and Psychology at Towson University. She has been a member of the Art Department on numerous short films and featured as an Assistant Director. A few projects that she is most proud of to date are Lincoln Robish's Outlet, of which she was the production designer and Simi, a short film she wrote and plans to direct in the Summer of 2020. Ayo participates in many extracurriculars based on her majors. Pertaining to film, she is an active member of Lambda Kappa Tau, a media society. Ayo came into the film world determined to only be a screenwriter- she has written a total of two features, one of which placed her as a quarter-finalist in a national contest. After much navigation within three years of studying film at Towson University, she has found her passions broaden to screenwriting, directing, and working in the art department. She is excited to challenge her production design skills learned from her previous projects to work on Monocacy.  Sound Designer: Brock Jones Brock Jones is the Sound Designer for Monocacy. He is a Class of 2019 graduate of Towson University's Electronic Media and Film department. He has been in love with audio and sound since high school, and his studies have led me to pursue sound design in film. Brock's sound design work has been featured on multiple award-winning films including, ""Dog Person"" - Directed by Justin Fairweather, ""Hit and Run"" - Directed by Alex Dapp, ""Outlet"" - Directed by Lincoln Robisch and ""Full Moon"" - Directed by Kenny Brossoie. During his time at Towson, Brock stayed active even outside his curriculum. He was an active member of the media society Lambda Kappa Tau as Marketing Chair, an intern for Studio Unknown, and completed various freelance sound designer work. Brock also participated in the school's Greek Life community as a founding member of the Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity's Towson chapter. Brock's passion and experience extend from sound design and reaches to audio engineering, production sound, and radio production. He is confident that he can bring a quality sound design to Monocacy. Thank you, for your support and for your time!Sincerely, The Monocacy Production Team",7.0,0,"2 Campaigns

>NOTE NEW PERK FOR EXECUTIVE PRODUCERS ONLY : 1/2 PIECE OF FLOWN KAPTON FOIL FROM THE APOLLO 9 LUNAR MODULE!

Overview

The most incredible Apollo images, fully restored at the highest resolution, are brought to life for our “Apollo Reflections” series – Beautiful 4K films featuring Apollo photography described by the men who were there. We began with “Reflections: Apollo 7 in Pictures and Words,” featuring astronaut Walt Cunningham. Your contributions through our first Indiegogo campaign raised over $6500 to complete post-production of our second film, “Reflections: Apollo 13 in Pictures and Words,” with Apollo 13 astronaut Fred Haise.

Now we are seeking funds to help us with post-production of our third film in the “Apollo Reflections” series: “Apollo Reflections: The General on Gemini &
column3:
Apollo"" with Astronaut and  General Tom Stafford.

Apollo Reflections

If a picture is indeed worth a thousand words, then the story of Apollo, told through the nearly 20,000 photographs taken during the eleven manned Apollo missions between 1968 and 1972, would literally take tens of millions of words to tell.

The Apollo Program was, undoubtedly, one of the greatest accomplishments in human history.  Human beings, for the first time, left the Earth and gazed back at our beautiful planet, the source of all we have ever known, learning more not only about the wider universe, but also about ourselves and our own world. 

This project cannot possible begin to come close to telling the full story of Apollo - what we are doing is producing the most beautiful, fully restored, high resolution Apollo mission flight photographs available anywhere and featuring them in a series of documentary-style interviews with the Apollo Astronauts who took them.  Collectively the Apollo mission images and the reflections of the astronauts about them tell a story the likes of which will never be forgotten.  These iconic images will long endure.

Some of our favorite Apollo mission photographs, and the favorites of the astronauts who took them, are the focus of a series of interview documentaries Apollospace is producing with a focus on Apollo program photography as we celebrate the 50th anniversaries of these amazing missions. These incredible images, many hidden in obscurity for decades, are brought to life as part of our “Apollo Reflections” series – films featuring Apollo era photography described by those who were there – beginning with “Reflections: Apollo 7 in Pictures and Words” featuring Apollo 7 astronaut Walt Cunningham.
column4:
>

Your contributions to our first Indiegogo campaign helped us complete our second film, “Reflections: Apollo 13 in Pictures and Words,” with Apollo 13 astronaut Fred Haise.
column5:
>

Those contributions also helped us record additional astronaut interviews – including one we did with Gemini and Apollo astronaut General Thomas Stafford during the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 10 mission in May, 2019. 

We were most fortunate to be able to interview General Stafford in his namesake museum in Weatherford, Oklahoma right in front of his Gemini 6 spacecraft!

We also recorded his public event later that day at his alma mater high school!

Now we need to bring his great stories to life!

Earthrise over the moon from Apollo 10
column6:
>Color TV image of Stafford aboard Apollo 10:

UFOS?!?! - Ok, there’s a lot more to that story!

The iconic images: Earthrise, Aldrin on the Moon, the footprint, the whole Earth from space – the “Apollo Reflections” films are a platform for these and hundreds more images viewed in the highest resolution and described by the men who witnessed these incredible sights, which we hope will inspire you...

Through my company, Apollospace, I have been wonderfully fortunate not only to meet most of the Apollo era astronauts, but even more fortunate to call several of them friends.  This has provided me with a unique opportunity to record the memories of Apollo Astronauts as they reflect on their missions and the Apollo photographs.  This film series is a unique contribution to Apollo lore and history that you can be a part of and help make happen. 

Unfortunately, many Apollo Astronauts are no longer with us, including my friend and Apollo 12 moonwalker, Alan Bean, pictured above at his studio with me in 2000, who passed away suddenly last year before I was able to interview him for this project.  Sadly, no astronauts survive from the Apollo 12 and Apollo 14 missions - but fortunately we have enjoyed an opportunity to record the reflections of a number of surviving Apollo Astronauts.

When I sat down to interview Fred Haise for his film, he called the image collection “incredible” and ""amazing."" Other people have commented: “they are without a doubt the highest quality image archive I have seen, and you need to be congratulated on the work and effort you have gone to!”
column7: “Amazing quality images … I hope more people see the work you are doing it is truly amazing! It's a gold mine for those who know it!”
column8:
“I was blown away by the quality of the pics, the quantity, and the completeness.”

Following the release of our Apollo 13 film, Fred Haise wrote to thank me for our “great productions” and that he liked the ""down to earth more informal interview style"":
column9:
>Get credit in the film along side Fred Haise!

While Fred was not directly involved in this film’s production, Fred was one of the first to support it and his generous support helped make this film possible.  Fred is credited as executive producer on the Stafford film, and I am extremely grateful for and humbled by Fred’s generosity and kind words: “The product I know will be outstanding but that is strictly due to the talent and efforts of yourself … thanks for your great work preserving some history from those who flew!”

One of our producer/contributors commented about our Apollo 13 film: “…what a wonderful and amazing film. Fred Haise provides such a terrific narrative. The clarity of the filming of Fred’s historical and anecdotal recounting as well as the crystal-clear photographs is remarkable … It gives me great pride to have my name associated with this film and thank you for the exquisite and professional product.”

Campaign Goals

This campaign has a goal of $7500 for prost-production needs to complete the Apollo 10 related film “Reflections: The General on Gemini &
column10:
Apollo” with Apollo 10 astronaut General Thomas Stafford.  Filming is complete and funds generated will first be used for post-production needs.  Tom Stafford was the pilot of Gemini 6, and Commander of Gemini 9, Apollo 10, and the US crew for the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project Mission.  In the film, Stafford talks about Apollo 10, his two Gemini missions, and the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project (ASTP), the last of the Apollo era missions.

Funds raised beyond the requirements of this film will be used to cover productions costs for additional interviews.

Contributor Perks

We are offering some great, and incredibly unique, perks for contributors to this campaign, including:

column1: <li>“Thank You” credit with your name listed on our website and in the film
<li>“Special Thank You” credit in the film
<li>The Apollo 10 Flight Images Collection USB including all 1400+ Apollo 10 mission photos in the highest resolution and quality ever offered
<li>The completed film, ""Apollo Reflections: The General on Gemini and Apollo""
<li>The Complete Apollo 7 through Apollo 11 Photograph Collection, ""First Steps"", with over 5000 ultra-high resolution photos on a custom Saturn V shaped USB
<li>Producer and Executive Producer credits in the film and the opportunity to have input in the final cut with the director and editor
<li>Executive Producer credits in the film and the opportunity to have input in the final cut including face time with the director and editor
<li>Exclusive raw footage not included in the film
• There is even autographed memorabilia hand-signed by the General himself! (Note that the autographed items offered are unique and will vary slightly from the images of the perks).

• PLUS (since our next film will feature Apollo 9) an approximately 1/2 inch piece of FLOWN Kapton Foil from the first manned lunar module, Spider, retrieved by Apollo 9 astronaut Rusty Schweickart and from his personal collection with related documentation.
• Everyone who contributes any amount will also get a link to the completed film.

Background

Apollospace, LLC holds tens of thousands of raw public domain Apollo era digital mission images, representing the highest resolution scans NASA has made from original film.  These raw images have been, and continue to be, restored, corrected, and enhanced for public distribution and enjoyment, as well as featuring them in our “Apollo Reflections” series.

I have had an interest in space since I was too young to read – drawing pictures of rockets and planets on my walls.  I grew up watching the Gemini and Apollo Program missions and dreaming of one day venturing into space myself.  While that didn’t work out quite like I’d hoped, my passion for space exploration compelled me to amass a large collection astronaut autographs and space photos, and later to create Apollospace.  From approximately 1996 through 2007, I ran and operated Apollospace as a DBA/ sole proprietorship.  I traveled extensively to various NASA Regional Planetary Image Facilities to review the complete library of Apollo photographs and select the most iconic and compelling images, for which I acquired inter-negatives of those images through NASA, and produced and sold 8×10 photographs from those negatives on the Apollospace website for over ten years. 

I sold thousands of signed and unsigned photographs to collectors around the world, including many I personally had signed by the astronauts themselves who took the photos or were featured in them.  That provided many opportunities to discuss Apollo era imagery with the people who were actually there, and provided valuable insight into how the photographs should look. 

There have been a series of scans made of the Apollo photographs, most notably prior to the 40th anniversaries in 2009 and more recently as part of a Space Act Agreement with Arizona State University in preparation for the 50th anniversaries.  Apollospace acquired all the available ASU/JSC scans for this project.

The Apollospace image process page details the technical work of bringing these photographs to life.  But more than an historical record of one of the greatest accomplishments in human history, these images are art.   Each Apollo era photograph appearing on this site was taken by a human hand and with a human eye.  50 years later, each one been restored, corrected, and enhanced with a human eye as well, to be as visually pleasing as they are historically and naturally accurate.

Please help us bring these photos to life as described by Apollo Astronaut Tom Stafford, and others, by contributing to this campaign so we can complete our Apollo 10 related film and begin producing others in the series.  Please contribute to this project if you can and be part of, as well as help us preserve, the incredible history of Apollo and share this campaign with your friends.

Thank you,

Jeremy Theoret

‘Blind’ is a film about seeing. Comedic in patches yet serious in others, the story follows Henry, a young photographer who craves some kind of hardship. When his wish is granted it’s in a way he’ll never see coming.

The film will be simple, engaging and entertaining. From car-crashes to hot-air balloons, the process will no doubt have some problems, but we will be stronger problem-solvers! Our cast and crew have given so much time and energy already, but we need you support to finish what we’ve started.
Watch the video to see our wonderful cast and crew in action!

Film production is a hard and expensive art, indie stories are full of passion, but passion can only go so far. To get this story off the ground, we’re looking to raise $3200 for production, this will be going towards:

column3: Laura

column1: Ben Walter is as hard-working as he is talented. That’s a lethal combination. He applies himself completely to his craft, letting himself be taken by the plethora of emotions that make up the characters he plays. Not only is Ben a great actor, he’s also the founder of the theatre company ‘Patalog Theatre co.’ We’re beyond excited to have him onboard.

Lucy Ansell's personality is as great as her acting skill. Circling Melbourne’s underground theatre world, it’s fair to say that we’re all in awe by the way she carries herself. The thought of Lucy acting and getting involved with this production sends shivers of comfort down everyone's spines.
Zoe is a genius. Her script consultancy skills are out of this world. (seriously, if you need something edited, she’ll tear you a new one then help you stitch it back up)
The script would not be where it is today if it was not for her stringent utilitarian editing. We feel very secure with her as our 1st AD.

Edie is a true legend, so committed to anything she does. Her expression is so pure that I have no doubt she’ll create something beautiful while performing the role of Ella. You may have seen her on TV as she’s starred in many commercials, we’re all (Edie included) excited that she’s taking on a role in this film.

Joey is the definition of good vibes. So calm, so cool and so comforting. Having worked in narrative, commercial and arthouse genres, Joey’s experience is plentiful. We have complete trust in his methods and his problem-solving skills. Check out some of his work here: https://www.joeyknoxfilm.com

Nina has a great eye for design. She understands the vibe of story so well and then has the ability to translate that into the mise-en-scene of the shot. Everything has a place and everything has a meaning, Nina knows it all…

Potentially the best songwriter we’ve ever heard. Not only can Jyoee compose music to an extraordinary level, his ability to teach music is second to none. He really has a unique yet humble perspective on performance and what performing is all about.
His first and much awaited EP will be coming out sometime in 2020. Stay tuned!

Jake is a provider, not only can he get things done, his ability to stay creative while juggling the logistics of production makes him a very well-rounded producer. Having worked on feature documentaries and a range of online content, Jake can seriously do it all, from script consultancy to colour-grading.

Hugo is directing this movie. He’s worked on some odd projects in the past and is extremely excited to give everything he has towards making this film. He really believes in the crew and the project as a whole, and we hope you believe in us too.

Lucy Ansell's personality is as great as her acting skill. Circling Melbourne’s underground theatre world, it’s fair to say that we’re all in awe by the way she carries herself. The thought of Lucy acting and getting involved with this production sends shivers of comfort down everyone's spines.
Zoe is a genius. Her script consultancy skills are out of this world. (seriously, if you need something edited, she’ll tear you a new one then help you stitch it back up)
The script would not be where it is today if it was not for her stringent utilitarian editing. We feel very secure with her as our 1st AD.

Edie is a true legend, so committed to anything she does. Her expression is so pure that I have no doubt she’ll create something beautiful while performing the role of Ella. You may have seen her on TV as she’s starred in many commercials, we’re all (Edie included) excited that she’s taking on a role in this film.

Joey is the definition of good vibes. So calm, so cool and so comforting. Having worked in narrative, commercial and arthouse genres, Joey’s experience is plentiful. We have complete trust in his methods and his problem-solving skills. Check out some of his work here: https://www.joeyknoxfilm.com

Nina has a great eye for design. She understands the vibe of story so well and then has the ability to translate that into the mise-en-scene of the shot. Everything has a place and everything has a meaning, Nina knows it all…

Potentially the best songwriter we’ve ever heard. Not only can Jyoee compose music to an extraordinary level, his ability to teach music is second to none. He really has a unique yet humble perspective on performance and what performing is all about.
His first and much awaited EP will be coming out sometime in 2020. Stay tuned!

Jake is a provider, not only can he get things done, his ability to stay creative while juggling the logistics of production makes him a very well-rounded producer. Having worked on feature documentaries and a range of online content, Jake can seriously do it all, from script consultancy to colour-grading.

Hugo is directing this movie. He’s worked on some odd projects in the past and is extremely excited to give everything he has towards making this film. He really believes in the crew and the project as a whole, and we hope you believe in us too.

My name is Rick Quan, I am a two time Emmy Award winning journalist and documentary producer. I am trying to raise funds to produce a documentary on Oakland native Allen Joe. Now 94 years old, his story is long overdue.

Asian American men have long suffered from negative stereotypes, often being portrayed as weak and unattractive but Allen was just the opposite. As the first Chinese American champion bodybuilder, he worked out with physical fitness legend Jack LaLanne and Steve Reeves, who played Hercules in the movies. Allen was also a mentor and role model for martial arts icon Bruce Lee.
By having his story told, Allen will finally receive some of the credit he deserves for being an Asian American pioneer and for helping Bruce Lee with his career and life.

Broken Brain is a dark short film that revolves around the way mental issues are hidden by humans.

Renowned neurosurgeon Dr. Walker has been traumatised by the poor mental health of those close to him, leading him to obsess about the complexities and inner working of the brain. His compulsion to win a lost love will compromise his professional integrity, and permanently damage their lives.
Filming is scheduled to begin 28th of February, with post-production commencing in April. At it's completion Broken Brain will be submitted into a number of film festivals.
We are a team of third-year film production students at Royal Holloway University of London, who are fundraising for our graduation film entitled Broken Brain.
Runners: Jonas Leškevičius, Graciela Mae Chico, Rebecca Mundy
What the Money will be Spent on?

To achieve our goals for this production, there are many aspects to consider. Besides the expensive equipment that is needed during the five-day production, there are actors and crew members that need to be paid, travel expenses, complex props, expensive location and food for the actors and crew. We believe that £2500 is a decent budget to make a quality production.
In the event we exceed our budget the money will be spent on
column2: additional equipment e.g a great quality steadycam. Shipping costs for perks and gifts. And cover additional fees for specific members of the crew.

column1: We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us reach our goals.
We ask you to help us in getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please share our campaign with everyone you know to help us reach our goal and make the quality short film a reality.

Mi nombre es Paco Soto, director de Rural Cops y administrador de la productora Cafetico Films, fundada junto con mi esposa Carol Colomer, recientemente fallecida. Su deseo era que este proyecto en el que tanta ilusión y empeño puso, se finalizara y saliera adelante, por lo que por ella y en su homenaje Rural Cops va adelante.

Rural Cops Es una comedia policíaca que se estructura en cortometraje, largometraje y ambos formatos conteniendo una versión alternativa e  interactiva, donde el espectador puede decidir lo que va a ocurrir en algunas de las secuencias.

Sinopsis: El Sheriff Michael Ballester lleva más de 30 años de servicio trabajando en colaboración con las diferentes policías en el mundo y decide viajar desde Los Ángeles (EEUU) a España, concretamente a la localidad de Torretatxell, junto con un equipo de reporteros del conocido reality “Rural Cops” con el objetivo de realizar un reportaje en profundidad de cómo es el día a día de este retén de Policía Local, llevándose el reportaje del año.
- El cortometraje se distribuirá por festivales de cine, tanto nacionales como internacionales.

- El largometraje se estrenará en salas comerciales y posterior venta de derechos a Tv. (dependiendo de la cantidad que se obtenga en la campaña, podremos costear mas o menos copias para su estreno en salas, deseando al menos un mínimos de 10 salas en todo el país).

- Versiones interactivas del cortometraje y largometraje estarán incluidas en el dvd/blu-ray y en los festivales de cine que así lo deseen, donde el público puede interactuar y ser partícipe de la película.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
Necesitamos 21.700 euros para cubrir la fase final de postproducción y distribución del cortometraje, y embarcarnos en el largometraje. El resto de financiación está ya cubierto con los patrocinadores y colaboradores que a día de hoy están en el proyecto. Aquí los tienes:

Con tu apoyo formarás parte de Rural Cops y obtendrás, dependiendo tu aportación, toda una serie de ventajas y recompensas, como incluirte en los créditos de la película, y el envío de tu camiseta, taza, dvd/blu-ray/copia digital, póster e invitación el día de su estreno.

column3: showinfo=0"">

column1: Y si tienes una empresa o negocio y deseas que aparezca en la versión del largometraje tu producto que será visto por miles de espectadores en un entorno tan valorado como el cine, estás a tiempo.

column3: showinfo=0"">

column1: RURAL COPS es algo más que una película tradicional, ya que el proyecto está estructurado en un cortometraje, que será la antesala del largometraje, ambos con versiones interactivas.
Es un proyecto original, producible y que empatiza con el amplio público al que va destinado

RURAL COPS busca aumentar paulatinamente su presencia online publicando y promocionándose de forma constante, como una cuenta atrás, hasta el estreno de la película, marcando el ritmo paulatino del día a día y mostrando los avances del rodaje.

Se persigue organizar y programar las acciones de comunicación online, ofreciendo una imagen consistente y compacta: CREAR, AFIANZAR Y FIDELIZAR, GENERANDO ESPECTACIÓN en el futuro público que acudirá a las salas.

La propuesta presentada en formato de cortometraje, largometraje y versiones interactivas, enlazados entre sí y con el valor añadido de estar basado en hechos reales de las fuerzas y cuerpos de seguridad, no sólo llega al público en general, sino que los más de 324.000 miembros de las fuerzas y cuerpos de seguridad pueden sentirse identificados y empatizar con los personajes, lo que los convierte en potenciales espectadores y seguidores de RURAL COPS.
Conseguimos hace unos años sacar adelante nuestro primer largometraje crowdfunding OPERASIONES ESPESIALES , ahora llega el turno de RURAL COPS.

Contamos con un reparto de lujo: Ramón Langa, Pablo Pinedo, Javier Bódalo, Emilio Gavira, Manuel Serrato,Antonio Meléndez Peso, Lola Moltó, Juanma Ruiz, Sergio Brotons, Manuel Yañez, Laura Lemus y 250 figurantes.
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Te ofrecemos la opción si no puedes colaborar a través de Indiegogo, poder hacerlo directamente desde la web con la novedad de que aceptamos criptomonedas, BITCOIN, BITCOINCASH Y ETHEREUM

Six Degrees of Illumination: An Anthology of Six Short Films
Pictured: Director Cat Commander, Costume and Production designer Lena Sands checking the frame.

Hi, I'm Cat! In 2016 I moved from Australia to Los Angeles to pursue an MFA in Film and Television at Mount Saint Mary's University. I had been writing plays in Australia, and wanted to find a way to hone my skills and start creating content for film, television, and online.

Through my studies, I have been fortunate to connect with others with complementary skills.  Six Degrees of Illumination has been in development for nine months and I am proud to have assembled a small but dedicated group of cast and crew, industry professionals and emerging artists, who worked diligently on the project and felt deeply connected to the material.

Together we aimed to bring character driven stories to life that are delicately written and visually stunning. Six Degrees of Illumination introduces six characters and focuses on their interactions with each other: the kind of chance interactions that can make us realise that things aren't as bad as they seem.

We have completed principal photography and are excited to begin the post production process.  With your help, we hope to elevate the work already put in. Extra funds we raise will ensure that the project is completed by the end of April to the highest quality.

We are seeking $5000 to complete our project. Where possible we used cost-free locations, however unexpected costs for location hire, and additional design costs added to the budget. Post production, including editing, colouring and sound design/music composition will ensure that our final product reflects the hard work done so far, and complete our desired feel of the project. Final graphic design, publicity and festival entry fees will ensure that our work is showcased and give these stories the platform they deserve.

Six Degrees of Illumination will be completed no matter what we raise through this campaign, however your generosity will elevate what we have already done on our small budget. We want to ensure that final film/s show off our beautiful locations, incredible set design, and the wonderful performances that portray the relationships between our six main characters.
As well social media shout outs and personalise postcards, we will offer access to the film before it is publicly posted online and an exclusive invite to our cast and crew screening in Los Angeles.

We are also offering a signed copies of production script and items from the set (props, costumes). For  screenwriters, you can take advantage of my expertise in providing script coverage and story editing with Valhalla Entertainment, WeScreenplay, and personal consulting.
For those high-rollers among you, Associate Producer or Executive Producer credits will give you a movie credit and imdb listing.

This is an amazing time to be a female film maker, and Six Degrees of Illumination had a core crew of incredibly talented women who worked together in a way I've never before experienced. We get shit done, and we plan to continue working together on future projects (as well as just hanging out with each other when we're finished)! By contributing you will be supporting a team of women who will go on to make many more incredible films, and you can say you've been supporting us from the very beginning!
Pictured: From left: PA Paris Corbitt, Production Designer Lena Sands, Hair and Makeup Mary Kate Gales, Director Cat Commander, DoP Kate Ketcham, 1st AD Mandy Eckman.

If you aren't in a position to donate, don't worry, we get it!  It only takes a few seconds to share the campaign or give us a shout out, and we'd really appreciate it. Comment on our social media posts, send us words of encouragement and get the word out there about our film: Six Degrees of Illumination.

""On a warm night in June 2013 Damo set down in Nanaimo, BC for an epic night of long heavy space rock jams in front of a rabid sold-out crowd. Two synth stations, fuzzed-out guitars, three drummers and pummeling bass coalesced behind Damo's commanding presence, the result was a sprawling, transcendent, seamless soundscape. Backed by Moths &
column10: Locusts and joined by members of Wolf Parade, and Colliding Canyons.'""
column15:
>A DOCUMENTARY ABOUT DAMO SUZUKI

 

 

‘Energy: Damo Suzuki’

In 2014 legendary musician Damo Suzuki was diagnosed with colon cancer. Energy is a unique and intimate portrait of his life as he confronts a life-changing illness and attempts to continue his never-ending tour.
column17:
> 

Directed by Michelle Heighway ‘Energy’ are currently crowd-funding, with the film due for release in December 2019. 

Although Damo’s struggle with his health provides the film’s main narrative arc, ‘Energy’ also examines the past, present and future of this highly influential musician’s work, whilst also capturing his singular outlook on art, protest, lifestyle and alternatives to mainstream thought.
column18:
>

Equally prominent in the film as an intimate depiction of the loving care given to Damo by his partner Elke Morsbach and their home life together. 

Damo Suzuki and Elke Morsbach 

As Suzuki fights cancer we’re taken on a colourful, thought provoking, humorous and free-thinking journey, which often finds the viewer willing the strength for Damo to survive the operations and begin his beloved touring again.

With animation of Damo's lucid, hospital bed dreams of starvation, riding on motorbikes for food, old cartoons, hypnotised brainwashed birds, fancy hats, mini skirts and medication, Michelle pieces together a beautiful portrait. This is augmented by vintage archive footage and access to his carefully preserved treasure trove of memories, made up of old photos, drawings, posters and more.
column19:
>

“This documentary is a wonderful story of hope and survival. It’s a personal portrait of the life and times of a nomad, poet, unique performer on his very inspiring journey. This has been a really compelling experience that has changed me on so many levels
column20: and I feel this will transfer to the audience”, concludes Heighway.
column21:
>

 

The enigmatic Suzuki was found by the now seminal band CAN in the streets of late ‘60s Germany, praying and performing bare chested in jeans with long black hair. Impressed and inspired, they asked him to play a show with them that night, with no rehearsal. He did, and the rest is history
column22:
this was a pivotal point for Damo and his sense of outsider art, centred around creating and performing with no plan.

(Image above taken from  RedBull Academy . Damo shared a great set of sketches which re creates Damo's back story from the 70's , which was another factor that inspired animation within the feature documentary)

Suzuki is renowned for playing shows that are never rehearsed as part of a never-ending tour with Damo Suzuki's Network, a constantly changing line-up of band members who act as ‘sound carriers’. Damo had been touring the world doing the above for 20 years, before it came to a halt when he was diagnosed with cancer in 2014.
column23:
>

Damo Suzuki’s never-ending world tour has resulted in some of the most spontaneous and exciting shows in modern music, with the singer enlisting on-the-spot backing bands in cities across the world. 

Michelle Heighway runs the independent production company i4visuals. Michelle is known for her critically acclaimed documentary Mr. Somebody? , which is also a rare intimate portrait that took place over 4 years, this was premiered at Sheffield Doc Festival 2014.

 

Damo and his Robot Sidekick Image Design by Elliot Elam (Designed for Damo Suzuki Network show at Leeds  Brudenell Social Club - Available Products - Mug and Tote Bag.

column24:
Tote Bag.

column25:
>

 

What is Energy ?

Energy is Michelle Heighway's 2nd Feature Documentary. After critically acclaimed 5 year passion project Mr. Somebody?

The help we require and what you receive in return

We need your support to help us fund the production costs - in return you can choose to receive a neat product/perk (scroll down for the complete list on the right-hand side of this page and view our image gallery at the top of the page underneath the video trailer for photos of the various perks to purchase).

This  campaign will cover costs for Post Production

Animation/Archive/Editor / Grade / Music / Music Rights.

To weave wonderful stories of the past and the present and to bring them to life in a way they deserve to be told.
column26:
>

We have created some unique perks for purchase !

The Impact

Your contribution and sharing of this project with make a huge difference with regards to the progress of completion. To release this independently will be really great for us.

We are also looking to collaborate with Sponsors and Charity Organisations and other free spirited creative producers or philanthropists!!

Why Energy?

This documentary is very universal and will connect hugely to everyone really, from free thinkers , musicians, creatives and people going through battles in life with Cancer or any kind of personal goal or vision. It is a inspiring wonderful journey that I just can not wait to share with you all!    

Michelle's  successful track record with her 1st Feature was received  well via Indiegogo. Which premiered at one of the worlds greatest Documentary festivals Sheffield Doc Festival 2014 and screened  at Leeds International 2014.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We will be really grateful for all social media sharing!

Re tweet !  - share !

We have loads of cool Indiegogo share tools!

It will also be cool to raise awareness to past Sound Carriers / Musicians that have played with Damo that may also want to share any archive footage! 

Thanks so much for reading!

Energy!

 

PR contacts:
National print: duncan@:9pr.co.uk
Radio, TV and regional: ian@9pr.co.uk
Online: josh@9pr.co.uk

 

 

Team 

Michelle Heighway - Director

Michelle is known for her critically acclaimed documentary Mr. Somebody? , which is a rare intimate portrait that took place over 4 years, this was premiered at Sheffield Doc Festival 2014.

 

Kiran Acharya - Associate Producer

Campaign trailer edited by Kiran Acharya

Writer at the Quietus and also a freelance Editor based in London.

 

Ned Netherwood - Associate Producer / Promoter

","19.06.2019UPDATEHi EVERYONE! AFTER A WONDERFUL #Crowdfunding consultation. I was advised I can have a one time EXTENSION on Indiegogo of 10 extra days! I added 10 more days to help raise more funds to make this documentary the best way we can! #UPDATE #BLOG in the updates section! Thanks so much everyone!11.06.2018NEW PERK!                                                                         UPDATE 10 x Limited Edition Double LP Vinyls available! Moths and Locusts & Damo Suzuki . Signed with a signed photo also. (Photo as seen in Limited Edition Photo Print Perk - I will have these signed by Damo also to make it fair!)""On a warm night in June 2013 Damo set down in Nanaimo, BC for an epic night of long heavy space rock jams in front of a rabid sold-out crowd. Two synth stations, fuzzed-out guitars, three drummers and pummeling bass coalesced behind Damo's commanding presence, the result was a sprawling, transcendent, seamless soundscape. Backed by Moths & Locusts and joined by members of Wolf Parade, and Colliding Canyons.'""  VIDEO UPDATE  8.06.2018 ENERGYA DOCUMENTARY ABOUT DAMO SUZUKI  ‘Energy: Damo Suzuki’In 2014 legendary musician Damo Suzuki was diagnosed with colon cancer. Energy is a unique and intimate portrait of his life as he confronts a life-changing illness and attempts to continue his never-ending tour. Directed by Michelle Heighway ‘Energy’ are currently crowd-funding, with the film due for release in December 2019. Although Damo’s struggle with his health provides the film’s main narrative arc, ‘Energy’ also examines the past, present and future of this highly influential musician’s work, whilst also capturing his singular outlook on art, protest, lifestyle and alternatives to mainstream thought.Equally prominent in the film as an intimate depiction of the loving care given to Damo by his partner Elke Morsbach and their home life together. Damo Suzuki and Elke Morsbach As Suzuki fights cancer we’re taken on a colourful, thought provoking, humorous and free-thinking journey, which often finds the viewer willing the strength for Damo to survive the operations and begin his beloved touring again.With animation of Damo's lucid, hospital bed dreams of starvation, riding on motorbikes for food, old cartoons, hypnotised brainwashed birds, fancy hats, mini skirts and medication, Michelle pieces together a beautiful portrait. This is augmented by vintage archive footage and access to his carefully preserved treasure trove of memories, made up of old photos, drawings, posters and more.“This documentary is a wonderful story of hope and survival. It’s a personal portrait of the life and times of a nomad, poet, unique performer on his very inspiring journey. This has been a really compelling experience that has changed me on so many levels
column29: and I feel this will transfer to the audience”, concludes Heighway. The enigmatic Suzuki was found by the now seminal band CAN in the streets of late ‘60s Germany, praying and performing bare chested in jeans with long black hair. Impressed and inspired, they asked him to play a show with them that night, with no rehearsal. He did, and the rest is history
column30: this was a pivotal point for Damo and his sense of outsider art, centred around creating and performing with no plan.(Image above taken from  RedBull Academy . Damo shared a great set of sketches which re creates Damo's back story from the 70's , which was another factor that inspired animation within the feature documentary)Suzuki is renowned for playing shows that are never rehearsed as part of a never-ending tour with Damo Suzuki's Network, a constantly changing line-up of band members who act as ‘sound carriers’. Damo had been touring the world doing the above for 20 years, before it came to a halt when he was diagnosed with cancer in 2014.Damo Suzuki’s never-ending world tour has resulted in some of the most spontaneous and exciting shows in modern music, with the singer enlisting on-the-spot backing bands in cities across the world. Michelle Heighway runs the independent production company i4visuals. Michelle is known for her critically acclaimed documentary Mr. Somebody? , which is also a rare intimate portrait that took place over 4 years, this was premiered at Sheffield Doc Festival 2014. Damo and his Robot Sidekick Image Design by Elliot Elam (Designed for Damo Suzuki Network show at Leeds  Brudenell Social Club - Available Products - Mug and Tote Bag. Fish Head Design by Lori Wollens  T SHIRT DESIGN #1Available Products -  Mug , T-Shirt & Tote Bag.T SHIRT DESIGN #2 - Abstract HeadT SHIRT DESIGN #3 - Damo Sketch - Red HatKey Rings/ Bottle Openers - Designed by Anya Clayton  What is Energy ?Energy is Michelle Heighway's 2nd Feature Documentary. After critically acclaimed 5 year passion project Mr. Somebody?The help we require and what you receive in returnWe need your support to help us fund the production costs - in return you can choose to receive a neat product/perk (scroll down for the complete list on the right-hand side of this page and view our image gallery at the top of the page underneath the video trailer for photos of the various perks to purchase).This  campaign will cover costs for Post ProductionAnimation/Archive/Editor / Grade / Music / Music Rights.To weave wonderful stories of the past and the present and to bring them to life in a way they deserve to be told.We have created some unique perks for purchase !The ImpactYour contribution and sharing of this project with make a huge difference with regards to the progress of completion. To release this independently will be really great for us.We are also looking to collaborate with Sponsors and Charity Organisations and other free spirited creative producers or philanthropists!!Why Energy?This documentary is very universal and will connect hugely to everyone really, from free thinkers , musicians, creatives and people going through battles in life with Cancer or any kind of personal goal or vision. It is a inspiring wonderful journey that I just can not wait to share with you all!    Michelle's  successful track record with her 1st Feature was received  well via Indiegogo. Which premiered at one of the worlds greatest Documentary festivals Sheffield Doc Festival 2014 and screened  at Leeds International 2014. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:We will be really grateful for all social media sharing!Re tweet !  - share !We have loads of cool Indiegogo share tools!It will also be cool to raise awareness to past Sound Carriers / Musicians that have played with Damo that may also want to share any archive footage! Thanks so much for reading!Energy! PR contacts:National print: duncan@:9pr.co.ukRadio, TV and regional: ian@9pr.co.ukOnline: josh@9pr.co.uk  Team Michelle Heighway - DirectorMichelle is known for her critically acclaimed documentary Mr. Somebody? , which is a rare intimate portrait that took place over 4 years, this was premiered at Sheffield Doc Festival 2014. Kiran Acharya - Associate ProducerCampaign trailer edited by Kiran AcharyaWriter at the Quietus and also a freelance Editor based in London. Ned Netherwood - Associate Producer / PromoterNed is the author of Electric Storm: Daphne, Delia & The BBC Radiophonic Workshop . Ned is also the Founder of  wasistdas.co.uk . column2:
>OUR MISSION 

Hi! My name is Naz Red, I am an independent, underground filmmaker who has spent the last twelve years making short films and honing my craft. I have wanted to make films since I was a little boy. For me, a good movie is just the greatest thing ever. A great movie can put me in a good mood for days, weeks even. I love movies that give you a movie high, movies that are punch drunk in love with movies in other words. While I love all types of movies from all over the world, the type of films that I love making myself are scary, bloody, funny films that are fun and alive like ""Evil Dead 2"" or Peter Jackson's ""Dead Alive"". I love movies that are just so infectiously in love with cinema that it comes through. That is the attitude in which my team and I are making our first feature length horror comedy hybrid ""Debbie and The Devil"". We are trying to create a film that causes pure joy in the hearts and minds of the movie mad.
column3:
>WHAT WE NEED

In order to do this, we need money to make it happen. While the film is low budget, we still need money to hire a crew and for blood FX and to pay the cast, not to mention to cover practical costs such as food and transportation.
column5:
>THE PRODUCER

April Mendoza is an independent filmmaker and producer based out of Rancho Cucamonga, CA. She currently studies Cinema and Television Arts at Cal State Fullerton and graduated from Chaffey College in 2014 where she met several of the crew members she works with today. She's produced several short films over the last 7 years, so working on a feature-length film will be an exciting new challenge! Horror films and psych thrillers have been a huge influence on her growing up, so Debbie and the Devil is right up her alley!
column6:
>The Director of Photography

Lucas Pitassi has lensed music videos and short films and cut his teeth on countless sets, learning the craft of photographing the beauty of the moving image. He is committed to making Debbie and The Devil and the camera used will be his, the one and only RED DRAGON.

Apart from the DP and producer, Scarlett Brooks will be playing Debbie and Shannon Williams Klein will be playing the Devil, and both are amazing actresses to say the least.
column7:
>TOGETHER, WE ARE WILD 7 PRODUCTIONS

The reason why we here at Wild 7 productions feel it is important to make this film is simple: We want to bring something beautiful and fun and thrilling into the world. True, we are making what some would describe as a horror film, but really what we are doing is creating art. We want to create something that inspires people to read about the history of film and horror and hopefully make a film of their own. In a world that has gone topsy turvy, making a film that comments on the wild times we are living in through the lens of horror is what we aim to do. Yet apart from those admirable goals, we just want to make something that is fun and entertaining.

Making movies are the most important thing to us here at Wild 7. We are a team of people who live, breathe and eat cinema. While we are making this film for the market and so we are submitting to every major festival there is (Sundance, Cannes, SXSW) the road to completion will have many challenges, but we intend to face those challenges head on. I have made many short films and have acted myself and so I have been on sets small and huge many times. I feel it is now time to make the feature.

You yourself can be a part of Wild 7 if you contribute and like and share and spread the word that Naz Red and his crew are making ""Debbie and The Devil"", so be apart of horror movie history and kick in a few bucks!

column1: 'The Rites of Penance' is a short film by Anglo/ Irish Writer and Director Justin Shevlin. Prior to moving behind the camera, Justin's extensive work as an actor has taken in companies across the UK including the Royal Shakespeare Company, Shakespeare's Globe, Trafalgar Studios, the Bristol Old Vic and the Nottingham Playhouse, as well as on TV and Film, in shows such as 'Waking the Dead', 'Midsommer Murders', 'New Tricks' and more recently opposite Maggie Gyllenhall in 'An Honourable Woman'.

This campaign is raising funds towards the production budget of the short film, to cover location permits, props and costumes, equipment hire and cast and crew fees. The film is being developed as part of the Raindance Film Festival Masters Program to screen at festivals both here and across Europe and will also act as a proof of concept for the feature film upon which it is based.

Backing this project will help us, quite literally, to get the film made and ready for its festival submissions. We are producing the film entirely independently, without any recourse to public funding or grants.
• We are raising £4000 towards our production budget to cover location permits, props and costumes, camera and lighting hire, and cast and crew fees.

• Rewards and Perks range from digital downloads of the finished film, funder screening events, festival invites, signed scripts and posters, a behind the scenes documentary, all the way through to Associate Producer Credits.
• All proceeds go directly to the production budget.

Writer and Director - Justin Shevlin is currently completing his MA with the Raindance Film Festival Masters Program. Born in Kenya, he grew up in England and Ireland and began his professional career as an actor, joining The Royal Shakespeare Company straight from Drama School and has since worked extensively in Theatre, TV and Film across the UK and in Europe. His CV and IMDB includes leading roles for Shakespeare's Globe, Trafalgar Studios, The Bristol Old Vic, The BBC, ITV, the Sundance TV Channel and Sky. As a Video Director, he has worked for the past six years in advertising.

Director of Photography - Jackie Read graduated Sum Cum Laude from West Chester University, PA, studying Theatre and Communications, before completing her Masters in Cinematography at London's Goldsmiths University. She spent time building a broad practical experience, first working as as a focus puller and camera operator, before moving up to Director of Photography and has since shot Shorts, Documentaries and Promos.

Sound Designer - Maciej Londo is a Polish born sound mixer and designer with a background in live sound engineering. Passionate about sound, film and music, his focus is on location sound and sound design for film. Since moving to the UK he has been involved as location recorder, sound mixer and sound designer in a wide variety of TV, film and commercial projects.

Cast - Niall Bishop is native of Galway in the west of Ireland and trained with the Focus Theatre and Gaiety school of Acting in Dublin as well as with the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama in London. Theatre work includes the London revival of Abbie Morgan's 'Tiny Dynamite', 'A Prayer' and 'An Inspector Calls' as well as TV and Film work including most recently 'Red Rock' for Ireland's TV3.

Cast -Venice Van Someren studied at Ecoles Jacques Lecoq in Paris and at London's Drama Centre. Most recently seen in the critically acclaimed  'Dear Brutus' at the Southwark Playhouse, Venice has also appeared in 'Therese Raquin', and Tom Stoppard's 'The Real Thing' on stage, and in the short films 'Ortus', 'Salad Days are Gone' and in 'Silver' for the BFI.

Cast - Yinka Awoni is from London, but considers travelling as the 'University of Life', from which he has graduated with honours. His work as an actor has included Theatre, TV and Film. Numerous credits include 'Holby City, 'Clean Break' on TV, 'God of Carnage' and 'Othello' on stage and 'Never Forget', 'The Night Before', 'In2ruders' and 'Homeless Ashes' on film.

Filming a single take film, in multiple locations, at night, poses some significant hurdles. Part of the production process includes a detailed rehearsal period to help us best realise the challenge we have set ourselves. Justin's extensive background experience in theatre, as well as our cast's, means that they are well versed in 'live', long sequence performance, but we are also helped by the fact that our D.O.P, Jackie Read, also started out by studying Live Performance and can bring her experience to the technical challenges we face. We are also helped by the breadth of professional industry mentorship that has been brought to the project, via the Raindance Film Festival Master's Program. Our mentors can include shooting Clint Eastwood films and Producing Award winning Independent Feature Films amongst their credits.
We know not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
• Help us get the word out, by sharing our project with family and friends and help us make some noise about the campaign.
• Use the Indiegogo Twitter/ Facebook tools to share the project on your social media.

Thank you for taking the time to look at our project and thank you for any help you can give us!
