We’re a group of film students, all learning our craft while specialising in different roles on the film. Any money we raise will go straight into production of the film, i.e., transporting equipment, keeping the actors fed and paying for location and post-production costs. Cast and crew will all be working for free!

Shooting starts very soon and we're hoping to raise €11,000 - so time is of the essence. If you can afford to give us ten euro, that’ll really help. If you can afford to give us ten thousand euro, that’ll really, really help!
Check out the excellent perks we're offering our funders...it's a win-win situation!

Colm is from Douglas, Co Cork. He studied for three years in University College Cork, obtaining a BA Film and Screen Media. His main interests lie in directing, writing and editing along with film theory. Colm produced and edited a short documentary film called Beautiful Boy which was screened on RTÉ 2 in April of last year as part of RTÉ’s Shortscreen.

After completing her Degree in Media Production and Communications, Orla went on to work for 10 years in Event/Festival Production. Over the years she has secured positions with Dublin Theatre Festival, The Gaiety School of Acting and DCTV's Generator.

Shane is a Director, Writer, Producer and Editor who has self funded and created both shorts, client based corporate videos and a feature film, Vaudevillains. He taught and directed theatre in Bull Alley VEC in Dublin for four years, also working as lighting and set designer for the college. He has had international success with his short Easy Street.

column2: Cinematographer from Cork City Ireland. She graduated from Crawford College of Art &amp
column3: Design in 2016 and is currently undertaking a Masters in Digital Feature Film Production. In her Degree she specialised in photography, however her practice included, mixed media installation, video &amp
column4: illustration and upon completing her Degree, she was offered a Graduate Residency in Photography. Before becoming part of the Masters course Meghann completed training in Professional Makeup Artistry &amp
column5: has worked in Digital Media Content Creation.

column1: Caoimhe’s background is in fine art and she graduated from Limerick School of Art and Design in 2014 with a First Class Honours Degree in Fine Art Painting. She received the Ormston House graduate award and had her first solo exhibition inSeptember 2015 in Ormston House, Limerick. Her practice as an artist was largely based in video art and installation. She was on the board of directors of 126 Artist Run Gallery from February to September 2016.

Paddy is a Dublin based screenwriter, producer and graphic designer. He’s also been a well known DJ on the city’s club scene for over a decade. His genre of choice is comedy and his work often tends towards the darkly comic. Paddy’s short film, Miscalculation, was screened at the 2014 Cork and Opuzen film festivals. He is one half of Pdee Productions, which he runs with director Deirdre Fitzgerald.

David is an award winning director, whose work has appeared in festivals around the world and on RTÉ. He is also an actor, having trained in Bow Street, The Gaiety, and Bull Alley Theatre Training Company.

Eamonn is a 33 year old award winning film maker. He has been writing, directing and producing for the past eight years. He wrote, produced and directed five of his own short films which screened at festivals such as
column2: The Underground Cinema Film Festival, Newry Film Festival, Devour Film Festival, Waterford International Film Festival, the inaugural Indie Cork Film Festival. His first short film, Untitled, went on to be nominated for three awards at The Underground Cinema Awards.  He was also a recipient of the first Film In Cork award for producing short film Earthly Bonds, starring Peter Coonan, screen at Cork Film Festival, Dingle International Film Fest, and Fastnet International Film Fest.

column1: Elaine Gallagher is an Irish writer, director, producer and stand up comedian from Kells, Co. Meath. Her previous work includes the Irish Film Board funded short film, An Rinceoir (2011), which screened at a great number of film festivals around the world, from its premiere at the Galway Film Fleadh (2011) to The Irish Film Festival Ottawa (2016). An Rinceoir also currently appears on the Irish language syllabus for the Junior Certificate First Year programme.

Tracy's background is largely in theatre, where she has worked as a director and playwright with her own company Red Bear Productions (www.redbeartheatre.com). In 2018, Tracy will work on a new play for The Abbey Theatre and The Complex Theatre. In 2016, Tracy was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award and for the First Fortnight Award for COAST. The previous year, she was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award for HARDER FASTER MORE (written and directed by Tracy).
John graduated from UCC in Film and Screen Media with English. His short film, Beautiful Boy, won best documentary at the Schull film festival 2017 and aired on RTÉ 2 television.
As well as making a financial contribution, there are other important ways you can help if you feel so inclined. Here's how you can assist  building awareness about The Comeback:
1) Send this Indiegogo link to your friends and colleagues.
2) Join and like our Facebook page.

After completing her Degree in Media Production and Communications, Orla went on to work for 10 years in Event/Festival Production. Over the years she has secured positions with Dublin Theatre Festival, The Gaiety School of Acting and DCTV's Generator.

Shane is a Director, Writer, Producer and Editor who has self funded and created both shorts, client based corporate videos and a feature film, Vaudevillains. He taught and directed theatre in Bull Alley VEC in Dublin for four years, also working as lighting and set designer for the college. He has had international success with his short Easy Street.

Meghann is a Visual Artist, Photographer & Cinematographer from Cork City Ireland. She graduated from Crawford College of Art & Design in 2016 and is currently undertaking a Masters in Digital Feature Film Production. In her Degree she specialised in photography, however her practice included, mixed media installation, video & illustration and upon completing her Degree, she was offered a Graduate Residency in Photography. Before becoming part of the Masters course Meghann completed training in Professional Makeup Artistry & has worked in Digital Media Content Creation.

Caoimhe’s background is in fine art and she graduated from Limerick School of Art and Design in 2014 with a First Class Honours Degree in Fine Art Painting. She received the Ormston House graduate award and had her first solo exhibition inSeptember 2015 in Ormston House, Limerick. Her practice as an artist was largely based in video art and installation. She was on the board of directors of 126 Artist Run Gallery from February to September 2016.

Paddy is a Dublin based screenwriter, producer and graphic designer. He’s also been a well known DJ on the city’s club scene for over a decade. His genre of choice is comedy and his work often tends towards the darkly comic. Paddy’s short film, Miscalculation, was screened at the 2014 Cork and Opuzen film festivals. He is one half of Pdee Productions, which he runs with director Deirdre Fitzgerald.

David is an award winning director, whose work has appeared in festivals around the world and on RTÉ. He is also an actor, having trained in Bow Street, The Gaiety, and Bull Alley Theatre Training Company.

Eamonn is a 33 year old award winning film maker. He has been writing, directing and producing for the past eight years. He wrote, produced and directed five of his own short films which screened at festivals such as
column2: The Underground Cinema Film Festival, Newry Film Festival, Devour Film Festival, Waterford International Film Festival, the inaugural Indie Cork Film Festival. His first short film, Untitled, went on to be nominated for three awards at The Underground Cinema Awards.  He was also a recipient of the first Film In Cork award for producing short film Earthly Bonds, starring Peter Coonan, screen at Cork Film Festival, Dingle International Film Fest, and Fastnet International Film Fest.

column1: Elaine Gallagher is an Irish writer, director, producer and stand up comedian from Kells, Co. Meath. Her previous work includes the Irish Film Board funded short film, An Rinceoir (2011), which screened at a great number of film festivals around the world, from its premiere at the Galway Film Fleadh (2011) to The Irish Film Festival Ottawa (2016). An Rinceoir also currently appears on the Irish language syllabus for the Junior Certificate First Year programme.

Tracy's background is largely in theatre, where she has worked as a director and playwright with her own company Red Bear Productions (www.redbeartheatre.com). In 2018, Tracy will work on a new play for The Abbey Theatre and The Complex Theatre. In 2016, Tracy was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award and for the First Fortnight Award for COAST. The previous year, she was nominated for the Fishamble New Writing Award for HARDER FASTER MORE (written and directed by Tracy).
John graduated from UCC in Film and Screen Media with English. His short film, Beautiful Boy, won best documentary at the Schull film festival 2017 and aired on RTÉ 2 television.
As well as making a financial contribution, there are other important ways you can help if you feel so inclined. Here's how you can assist  building awareness about The Comeback:
1) Send this Indiegogo link to your friends and colleagues.
2) Join and like our Facebook page.
3)  Follow us on Twitter & Instagram — retweet, repost and share, share, share!
4) Talk about the project to everyone you know!
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

Текст на русском ниже по странице.

 

Please, stop reading this and watch the video first. 
“Bathwell in Clerkentime” is a black and white 2D animated musical short film that will be created entirely in FLASH. It will be the third and the last episode that will complete the Clerkenwell trilogy.

The first film from that trilogy was made  back in 2002 and is called “Bathtime in Clerkenwell”.  This animation was about the great revolution of cuckoos, leaving their weight-driven wall clocks and taking over London.  Film won following awards:

Jury Award for the Best Animation at Sundance Online Film Festival 2004, prize ""for the perfection of music and fantastic Imaginary"" at Ottawa animated film festival 2004, Grand Jury Award for the best animated short at Florida Film Festival 2003, The Best of Show Award from ASIFA-East 2003, Grand Prize from ASIFA--West, prize for the best film in ""applied animation"" category at KROK --2003 (Russia-Ukraine), diploma from IX Russian Festival of Animated Films, Best Animation at Boston Underground Film Festival, Third Prize at Film Fest New Heaven.
column3:
showinfo=0"">
The second film, “Last time in Clerkenwell”, was released five years later and focused mainly on the global expansion of Cuckoo Empire. London was not enough for the cuckoos - they took over the entire planet and wanted more.  This is the list of  awards:
 Best applied animation at the International Film Festival of Animation Bimini , Honorable Mention at Tribeca International Film Festival (New York, USA), ""Excellence in Design"" from ASIFA-East (New York, USA), Special Jury Prize at Seoul International Animation Film Festival (SICAF, Korea). Best music video at the Animation Block Party (New York), Best animated clip at Tindirindis IFF, Special Distinction Award in TV Program Category at China International Animation and Digital Arts Festival (CICDAF 2009). It is after this film got honorable mention at Tribeca, I received a message from David Bowie, asking me to send him   a disc with all my films. It appeared that he was one of the jurors that year.

column1: The third and last part will also be set in Clerkenwell and will be dedicated to various  relationships between the cuckoos. Can’t say more about that right now! The animation will be in the same style as two previous parts, mostly black and white.

The music is written by my friend Stephen Coates from  “The Real Tuesday Weld”, who provided soundtracks for the two previous films.
During this campaign me and Stephen will  tell you all about Clerkenwell. We prepared more than 30 stories and will be posting an update with one Clerkenwell story everyday!  I address all of you, international fans of Clerkenwell animations, please help me to make this happen.  If you like the project, if you want this film to be completed, please contribute and spread the word. When you donate to this project  or when you ""like"" "" Bathwell in Clerkentime "" page on Facebook you are helping me. Thank you for your support!  
Link to film's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pg/bathwellinclerkentime/posts/?ref=page_internal

You will get exclusive backer updates about the project and “Thank you” shout-outs on Facebook.

All of the above + a downloadable  high resolution desktop still  from film. You can select from the pictures above, the one below, or new stills that will be introduced later in this campaign.

$20 or more

All of the above + you will receive a private, password-protected link to stream “Bathwell in Clerkentime” after the animation is completed and before the general public sees it. 

$25 or more

All of the above + you will receive access to download a digital copy of the film, after it is completed and before the general public sees it. 

$50 or more

All of the above + personal gif card with dancing cuckoo.
column3:

$100 or more

$150 or more

$500 or more

Для русскоговорящих друзей

Перед тем как прочесть это, пожалуйста посмотрите презентационный ролик в самом верху страницы, там сделаны субтитры на русском языке.

“Bathwell in Clerkentime” это чёрно белый двухмерный анимационный музыкальный фильм, который будет сделан целиком во Флэше. Он будет являться третьей и последней частью, завершающей трилогию анимационных короткометражек о приключениях кукушек из Клеркенвелла. 

Первая часть трилогии называлась «Время принять ванну в Клеркенвелле», вышла в 2002 году и рассказывала о великой революции Британских кукушек, которые повылезали из своих ходиков и захватили Лондон. Этот фильм получил следующие награды: 

Приз жюри за лучшую анимацию на фестивале Sundance Online, приз за ""совершенство музыки и фантастическое воображение"" на фестивале анимации в Оттаве, главный приз жюри за лучшую анимацию на  кино фестивале в Орландо, Best of Show от ASIFA East (Нью Йорк), гран-при за лучшую анимацию от ASIFA West, (Лос Анжелес), приз за лучшую прикладную анимацию на фестивале анимации Крок, диплом Суздальского фестиваля анимации, приз за лучшую анимацию на Бостонском кинофестивале, приз на фестивале в Нью Хэйвене.  

Второй фильм, под названием «Потерянное время в Клеркенвелле» был сделан через  5 лет после первой части и рассказывал об экспансии империи кукушек. Лондона им оказалось мало, они захватили всю планету и  хотели ещё большего. Эта часть заработала следующие награды: приз за лучшую прикладную анимацию на международном фестивале анимации Бимини, почётное упоминание на международном фестивале Трайбека в Нью Йорке, приз за ""совершенство дизайна"" от ASIFA-East (Нью Йорк), специальный приз жюри международного фестиваля анимации в Сеуле, приз за лучшее музыкальное видео на фестивале Animation Block Party (Нью Йорк), приз за лучший клип на фестивале анимации Тиндириндис, специальный приз фестиваля анимации CICDAF в Китае. После того как фильм был показан на фестивале Трайбека ко мне поступило послание от Дэвида Боуи   с просьбой выслать ему все мои фильмы. Он, как оказалось был в жюри. 

  Третья  и последняя часть будет иллюстрировать взаимоотношения между кукушками. Место действия, естественно, Клеркенвелл, большего увы сказать не могу. Фильм будет выдержан в стиле предыдущих частей, в черно белой графике. 

Музыку к нему тоже написал мой друг, англичанин Стивен Коутс из гуппы The Real Tuesday Weld.

Во время этой кампании мы со Стивеном постараемся рассказать вам всё о Клеркенвелле, каждый день в течение месяца опубликовывая по одной истории, а их мы подготовили более тридцати.   Я обращаюсь ко всем поклонникам Клеркенвелльских кукушек, если вам понравился этот проект и вы хотите помочь мне закончить этот фильм – распространите эту информацию, делайте пожалуйста взносы, а так же не забудьте посетить страничку фильма в Фейсбуке:  https://www.facebook.com/pg/bathwellinclerkentime/posts/?ref=page_internal

Те кто по каким-то причинам не могут использовать эту платформу, могут перечислять денюжку на пэйпэл budovskiy@yahoo.com или на карточку Сбера 4276 2700 3517 8845

Взнос $50  и больше

Всё вышеперечисленное + персональная гиф открытка с танцующей кукушкой.

Short Summary

My name is Lake Peterson and I am a writer, director, and prop maker. The tiny details make up the bigger picture. I was homeschooled all my life, which gave me the opportunity to learn in a more hands-on environment. When I was 8 years old, my mom brought home 4 silkworms. We watched them grow and would feed them twice a day. They grew and grew and grew until finally one morning they had been replaced by 4 perfect bulbs of silken white. A couple weeks would pass without any movement until one day they emerged: beautiful furry moths. They would flutter their wings but couldn’t fly
column2:
my mother explained to me that they were too fat to fly. The next day they were dead. Moths only live a couple of days. This was when I learned about mortality and what it means to be a moth.

 

What We Need

All money raised goes towards:

column1:
Our Team

Ryan Johnson
Cinematographer
Ryan is one of the kindest souls I know. He always puts in the extra effort to make sure the work gets done. He’ll sacrifice a lot to help everyone out and I really admire him for that. He’s one of my closest friends and we’ve worked many times in the past together.

Lake Peterson
Production Designer
I will be doing my own production design and prop making. This project is heavily reliant on props and sets that set the visuals of the world. I have always loved to make things with my hands.

Amber Luke
Costume Designer
Amber has an amazing eye for fabric and thread. She has an outstanding sense of wonder. Amber is one of my closest friends and her creativity really helps give this project life.

 

Thank You

Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign. If you would like to help, but are unable to contribute funds, please spread the word and share this page. We would really appreciate it. With your help I believe we can make something very ghoul.

 

","Short SummaryMy name is Lake Peterson and I am a writer, director, and prop maker. The tiny details make up the bigger picture. I was homeschooled all my life, which gave me the opportunity to learn in a more hands-on environment. When I was 8 years old, my mom brought home 4 silkworms. We watched them grow and would feed them twice a day. They grew and grew and grew until finally one morning they had been replaced by 4 perfect bulbs of silken white. A couple weeks would pass without any movement until one day they emerged: beautiful furry moths. They would flutter their wings but couldn’t fly
column2: my mother explained to me that they were too fat to fly. The next day they were dead. Moths only live a couple of days. This was when I learned about mortality and what it means to be a moth. What We NeedAll money raised goes towards:

Kicking the Hornet's Nest tells an incredible story of tragedy and advocacy as it follows a husband and wife, both accomplished physicians in the Harvard medical system who encounter their worst nightmare when a routine hysterectomy procedure with supposedly minimal risk leads to an unexpected diagnosis of an aggressive cancer, and a prognosis, they discover, severely worsened by the very device used to perform the procedure. A device hailed as the gold standard of gynecological, robotic surgery. 

In the midst of tremendous grief, the couple launches a relentless campaign to expose the practice, and ban the device known as a Power Morcellator, all while trying to beat the disease. Together they ignite a debate about risk and benefit, enrage an entire specialty, and challenge the medical establishment to look closer and listen to the victims. 

 

 

The importance of this film lies in its propositions to the audience, surely composed of both experts and laypeople, physicians and regulators, patients and loved ones, professors and students, men and women. This film pits innovation against precaution and professional enthusiasm against critical examination. Your contribution to this project is an investment in an active community, in an informed community, and in a thoughtful medical culture. 

How much do you trust your doctor?

What is the greatest risk you would accept for more comfort and convenience?

What about if you discovered a flaw in an otherwise productive tool?

If you made a mistake, would you admit it? Would you apologize?

If someone was hurt and angry and loud, would you listen or would you shut them out?

This film tackles these questions and explores the potential consequences of the typical ways we answer them. 

 

 

My name is Kyle Floyd. I am a 2017 graduate of Boston University's College of Communication, where I focused on documentary production. As a junior, I directed and produced a 40-minute documentary about the unique struggle facing victims of campus sexual assault. https://kafloyd.wixsite.com/aftermath.  

I am drawn to investigative projects and stories that examine institutional or systematic wrongdoing specifically because they aren't simple, and they can't be solved by removing one individual. Blockbusters featuring heroes and villains dominate modern entertainment in large part because they provide a good adrenaline rush, but also because they boil down conflict to good vs. evil, a tale as old as time itself that requires no critical thought or effort to understand human nature. This is not one of those films and this is not a simple issue. Like the issue of campus sexual assault, it's meant to examine personal motivations and traditional behaviors that stand in the way of reform. I want to contribute to growing critical viewers and ultimately critical citizens who scrutinize and then improve our society.

I began working on Kicking The Hornet's Nest in the summer of 2014, my sophomore year. This nearly-five year production has taken me around the United States, into the homes of those personally affected and into the offices of physicians with a front seat to this controversial procedure. At times the experience was painful, and at other times it was intimidating, but ultimately I was forced to throw myself into a subject matter of which I had no prior knowledge, and attempt to capture a range of strong opinions and an enormous amount of medical information in a way that could be communicated in a clear and balanced fashion.

Additional Footage - An evidence-based documentary such as this faces unique challenges in terms of recreating dramatic events. An assortment of material including stock footage of locations that couldn't be accessed in production and archival footage of past events and news broadcasts will work collectively to build a visual backbone for the film and put the viewer in the moment.

column3:
'>Graphics/Animation - 2D and 3D graphics and animation sequences will be enlisted to illustrate medical procedures and processes in detail as well as to outline statistical arguments and numerous academic studies associated with the cases being discussed.

 

  • ​​​Original Score - a musical score assembled specifically for this film will contribute to a sense of movement and compliment a story that moves frequently between emotional beats and startling insights.

 

  •  Color Grading/Correction - A professional color grade and correction will give the film a polished, consistent visual style.

column1: Sound Mixing/Editing - A professional sound mix will balance all of the different kinds of audio used in the film, such as interview audio, archival audio, the original score, and other sound effects. Sound editing will provide an opportunity to clean up sound that was originally recorded in noisy or less than ideal circumstances.

• E/O Insurance - An errors and omissions insurance policy will help to ensure the film's rights and protections to the interviews and all other materials used on the basis of a fair use argument.

 

 

In the entertainment industry, agents shed blood, sweat and tears to get their client the best credit on the project the possibly can. From Production Assistant, all the way up to Producer, these titles represent a hierarchy of contribution and commitment. I want to recognize every individual who gives to this campaign and empower them as champions of the work. By offering up several of these titles as perks I don't mean to just reward, but to give a feeling of ownership and collaboration in telling this important story. Please take a moment to check out these perks and others such as exclusive videos, and early access to different items. 

While working on this film alone over the past four years has enabled me to start quickly, pickup and go spontaneously, and keep my process as logistically simple as possible, I need an extra push to get to the finish line and cross it in the fashion this subject matter deserves.

So I'm building my virtual crew, and I have many roles to fill. Let's make a movie! 

 

It's not all about money. Seriously. Yes, funds are vital (for obvious reasons), but regardless of whether you are able to contribute financially, you can support this project by spreading the word with Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms. In this way, you can be an engine for raising awareness and driving people to get behind the film and the issue, with the click of a button. 

This film is about a relentless campaign that only gained traction because someone picked up the ball and moved it forward. Because someone drove a message into the open by all available means and with all available energy. By participating AND by sharing, you are helping to build the virtual crew, grow an audience, and exponentially strengthen the conversation. 

Tell your friends, family, colleagues, neighbors, students about this campaign and please share this page as well as follow along on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

Have you ever wanted to be a part of changing thousands of lives?  Yea?  Didn't think so...Us either.  But what we do want is a new couch for Jake's living room.  As we all know, Jake is awesome...he has THE COOLEST STUFF.  He has the greatest theater setup known to man,  But you cannot enjoy these things, once your butt hits cushion.  Jake's current couch has supported butts since 1605...it's time to put that couch to bed.  Help us by donating to something bigger than yourself...something noble...dare I say, something Christ-like.
• We found an amazing sleeper/theater sofa hybrid for $899

• Perks?  You want Perks?  I'll give ya perks!  Any donator will receive a lifetime of couch sitting, free worry that the couch below you harbors decades of other peoples butts, stale farts,  and yes...even baby making.  Also, you will granted dibs over any other movie watchers for a spot on the new couch.
• If we do not reach our goal, we will track down and murder every person on Jake's friend list.  But seriously...only two people.
• The funds will be put towards the ongoing couch fund.  However long it takes to raise the funds, we will end BCS(Bad Couch Syndrome) once and for all.

The sequel to Hooper's 2014 film, The Anatomy of a Great Deception, ""AGD2"" is set for an international theater release in September 2019.

According to Hooper, ""AGD1 is about how the demolition of Building 7 first opened my eyes.  AGD2 continues the analysis of 9/11 while addressing how such a large deception was pulled off and how it's linked with other major events in history.""  Hooper shares private struggles and victories on a much deeper level, as well.  ""I think people who've had their eyes opened by looking into 9/11 will find this film to be cathartic, and a handy tool to give a friend, whose eyes you'd like to open,"" adds the filmmaker.

In September 2014, we met regular-American-turned-filmmaker, David Hooper, while grappling with the ramifications of  “one innocent question” about 9/11.   The Anatomy of a Great Deception Trilogy continues with AGD2 in September 2019, on the heels of AGD1’s 45-city release, viewed by 30 million people and counting.

AGD2 delves deeply into the 9/11 attacks, and much further, while addressing “how” such a massive ruse was orchestrated.  Like AGD1, Hooper discloses the unvarnished truth of his personal struggles and victories in coping with many staggering discoveries that will leave viewer’s jaws on the ground.  Together, these films tell the story millions across the world have experienced, who’ve had their eyes opened.
For More information about the movie, check out the film's ELECTRONIC PRESS KIT

Of the funds raised, about $70k will be used to finish the movie, which includes the final edits plus video and sound engineering.  The remainder of the funds will be used to execute the Marketing &
column2:
Distribution Plan of the film.  

The film will be released through conventional film sales channels, including digital platforms.  But, it's the proprietary distribution plan that really has potential, which aims to get the film positioned for sale in the checkout/impulse-buying area of thousands of retailers both online and offline across several geographic regions at a time.

Depending on the campaign's level of success, the film will initially be released in NYC, Detroit, Chicago &
column3: San Francisco, where the filmmakers have personal ties to each city.  If this strategy is successful, we'll continue releasing the film in a city-by-city pattern until something or someone stops us.

column1: WHO SAID WHAT ABOUT THE FIRST FILM

“This is a tremendous film.”
- Ed Asner, Former President of the Screen Actors Guild. 
  Actor, JFK &

“I couldn't stop watching it.  What struck me is that it is so genuine, authentic and honest.”
- Rich “Sully” Sullivan, Radio Host, WGST640 Atlanta

“This film has the best chance in years to push the 9/11 debate into the mainstream.  I highly recommend it.”
- Richard Gage, AIA, Founder, AE911Truth

“This is a very compelling film.”
- Omar Sharif, Actor, Lawrence of Arabia

“Your way of filming and telling makes the work you did a beautiful one – and not only for the sake of objective truth, but as a subjective work, where the vicissitudes of your own life give much prize to the cause.”
- Christophe Guillouet, Architect

“I just watched ""Anatomy"" and I'm floored!  Far and away the best 9/11 movie I've seen - and I've seen many of them. But this will be the only one I recommend to friends!” 
- David Schroeder, CEO, TAoB Studios.

“The movie, ""The Anatomy of A Great Deception"" is one of the best-produced and researched films that I have ever seen on the subject of ""9-11 Deception"" pulled on the American public.  If you know of anyone that is a skeptic on the ""9-11 conspiracy"" this DVD will put their mind to rest.”
- Paul Walter, News Director, NewsWithViews.com

Right now, the best thing that can be done to promote the film is to participate in the funding campaign.  We're introducing several neat ways to get involved in the film.  Click on any of the perks listed on the right-hand side of the page to get started.  It only takes a minute to make a difference.

 

HOW YOU CAN MAKE A BIGGER DIFFERENCE

If you care about getting the truth out, please tell your friends to visit our campaign.  And have them tell their friends.  Perhaps, promote it on your social media accounts.  We are very excited to bring the crowd into our project and will be unveiling some neat ways to promote the truth, while earning money doing it! 

 

IF YOU DON'T LIKE USING CREDIT CARDS ONLINE . . .

If your would rather mail a check than doing business over the Internet, we get it.  You can mail us at:

GenPop Media

20222 Island Estate Dr.

Grosse Ile, MI 48138

And thank you in advance!

 

HELPING THE TRUTH MOVEMENT

We will be donating a portion of our proceeds to Architects &
column2:
Engineers for 9/11 Truth (AE911Truth.org).  They are a non-profit, non-partisan organization of architects, engineers and other scientific professionals dedicated to revealing the facts about the complete destruction of all three World Trade Center high-rises on September 11, 2001. 

Filmmaker David Hooper at the 2014 Detroit Premiere for AGD1

Richard Gage, AIA for AE911Truth.org introducing AGD1 at The Fillmore Theater in Detroit in 2014.

why I want to do this project?

reading this story is what made me want to step up and direct for the first time!  I was approached to act in this piece a few years back and when I had time to look at it again and knew that actor Peter Outerbridge was still interested in starring ...that's when I decided to direct!  I believe that Viaticum will reach a wide audience and resonate on many levels.  It touches upon alcoholism, gay-bashing, teen-suicide, teen-bullying, dysfunctional families and the ensuing result.  Another part of the story that is truly thought provoking is the idea of how religion plays into our lives and the comfort that sacraments can provide.   In addition to Viaticum being an important film with a relatable story, the film is very female centric -  It  is written by a woman and is being directed by a woman.  The lead female character , Liz is an emotionally complex everyday woman. She doesn't just cry and doesn't just smile. And that is what drew me even more to this project.  It rang true.  This kind of story helps people to feel not so alone in their struggles and can provide a sense of hope and connection.  The film presents some hard questions and potential answers.  I am passionate about bringing this story to life!

Lara has had a successful acting career in film and television for 30 years.   Most recently she has ventured into writing and ""Viaticum"" will be her directorial debut.  She is well known for starring in ""A Dark Truth""(2012), ""King of Sorrow""(2007), as well as writing and starring in ""Ice Girls"" (2016) a Family Channel MOW, distributed by Netflix in the USA.

We are lucky and thrilled to have one of the most amazing Canadian actors of our time, Peter Outerbridge, on board this project!  Ever since the early 90's, Outerbridge has been a steady presence not only on the silver screen but also on TV. Among many others, he played three different characters on the science fiction show The Outer Limits, had a recurring role in season three of Chris Carter's mystery spin-off Millennium, played the lead in three feature-length episodes of the 2004 version of The Murdoch Mysteries, and scored his biggest lead role to date in the same year, when he was cast as headstrong scientist David Sandström in The Movie Network's ReGenesis. The science-themed show successfully aired for four years and has been broadcast internationally in over 20 countries. ReGenesis has been nominated for several

Evert Houston is an artistic creator dedicated to the invention, innovation and architecture of original story. His individual specializations include acting, writing, directing and producing for theatre, film, photography, original creations, performance art and live cinema. Mr. Houston's very first film which he wrote, produced and starred is the award winning: CHURANO, which was sold to the CBC Main Network, for a 3-year licensing period across all platforms as part of Canadian Reflections.
Trudy Weiss is Toronto actress, with a long list of credits.  She is well known for Entebbe (2018), Hannibal (2013) and Suits (2011).

Kaelen Ohm is a Canadian actress and musician. Born in Fernie, British Columbia she worked at the local Vogue Theatre during high school and after graduation, attended the Vancouver Film School for Film Production. She appeared in AMC's Hell on Wheels in Season 3 and played Katie in Alexander Carson's debut feature film, O' Brazen Age in 2015.  She was recently chosen for the prestigious Canadian Film Centre Actors program.  She currently resides in Toronto, Canada.

Brad has been a working actor for over 30 years in LA and Toronto. Credits include: Iron Eagle IV,  I am The Pretty Thing That Lives in The House, and Mystery ER. Brad's passion and respect for the art of acting paved the way for him to become an acting coach, he has empowered the careers of hundreds of actors through Milne Studio.

Dempsey Bryk is an American/ Canadian actor, born to actors Greg Bryk and Danielle Bryk in New York, NY. He grew up in Toronto, Ontario, and as a child Dempsey was a competitive boxer, placing first at the Ontario Bronze Gloves
column3: debater
column4: and mathematician, but he was also featured on family renovation shows such as A Bryk at a Time (2013) and ""Bryk House."" Dempsey was school president and attained an IB and an OSSD diploma in high school. After he graduated, he attended the University of Western Ontario on scholarship with an AEO acceptance to the Richard Ivey School of Business for only one year, before leaving for New York to study acting. He studied Meisner acting at the Neighborhood Playhouse Acting Conservatory. Only months after graduating he was cast in Mary Kills People (2017) , Saving Hope (2012) , and as a guest star on Heartland (2007) , and also wrote, co-directing, produced, and starred in his play ""Oh loves a girl"" Off-Broadway in New York (NYNW theater fest).

column1: Heidi has a long list of credits as an actress and is best known for her stunning performance in Dead Ringers (1988), followed by The Boys Club (1996) and RED (2010). Heidi was a co-founder of CVAV (Canadian Voices of Asbestos Victime) She was a key player in banning the exportation of asbestos to third world counties. An independent documentary film, Canary In The Mine, chronicled her battle.
Arcadia Kendal is an actress, known for Sacrifice (2011), Murdoch Mysteries (2012), Ice Girls (2016) and Breakout(2013). She has been nominated for two Young Artist Awards in her short career.

Katerina is a Second City Alumi actor who was the original, ultimate Italian princess in the improvised comedy hit ""Tony N Tina's Wedding.""
She then served as the Queen of the Nile being cast as ""Cleopatra"" in the Discovery Channel's ""Cleopatra's Palace and the Real Cleopatra,"" which was showcased globally in over 130 countries. Katerina has had guest starring roles on hit television shows such as ""Darcy's Wildlife"", George F. Walker's dramatic CBC hit, ""This Is Wonderland"". She also worked with JJ Abrams on ""Fringe"" as the go-to ""FBI Agent Dawson"" on the FOX network and also appeared in SYFY's ""Warehouse 13"". She has given her time for a touching and important PSA for the Princess Margaret Hospital titled ""Tears of Joy"" with Oscar-nominated director Hubert Davis and most recently a heartbreaking PSA for Partners Mental Health that deals with teen suicide, titled, ""Right by You"" with up and coming director, David Quinn
writers:  Lara Daans and Maureen Jennings (novelist extrodinaire)
producers:   Kelly Gilbert, Bryan Ratushniak     director:  Lara Daans

the good news is we've already shot two days on this project and we have amazing footage with great performances! We are now looking to finish up production this coming July 2018, shooting in Toronto.  We plan to shoot four more days to complete our principle photography.  This will be followed by post-production.  All of this costs real money in the world of film, even on the tightest of budgets.

Our goal is to raise $20,000.00 to pay for equipment, set dressing, locations, and yes, food!  Crews have to eat!  We will be also using your generous donations to pay the incredibly talented people who have come aboard and agreed to lend their brilliant minds to the project honorariums to show our appreciation of their hard work at an extremely busy time of year. We will also be using the funding to apply to film festivals. By donating to our film, you will literally get to see your kindness spread awareness, touch peoples hearts, and potentially save lives.
Our goal is to make a great short film that will inspire all involved to carry this energy forth and go on to make a feature film.  The script is in the works!
We understand if a monetary contribution is not in the cards, but you can still help if you'd like:
*share our campaign with your friends and family!
*If you are local and would like to volunteer time, we are always looking for new talent.
*know of anyone who's local that would love to help?  pass them onto us :)

My beginnings in the entertainment industry date back to my days as a child actor which I abandoned for my love of figure skating.   My academic pursuits were always in the maths and sciences and for a while I thought I was headed to a medical career.  It was during these university years that my passion for dance and acting changed my path forever.  After being hired for several gigs I realized I was only going to be happy if I gave 100% to my true passion..that of an entertainer!  I have been lucky to have worked on amazing projects with outstanding cast and crew.  I value all of these experiences and each on has led me to who and where I am right now.  Above all,  I have had the priveledge of working with my husband, Damian Lee, a prolific film maker.  For the past twenty years I have been ""learning by osmosis"" as the  saying goes.   My exposure to independent film making and all that it encompasses is beyond what any school ever could teach.  I have been a part of development, script writing, financing, distribution, casting, and all aspects of getting a film shot right through to the editing room and the final mix.  I have brought some of our more artistic films  (Woman Wanted, Hearts of War and King of Sorrow), to the film festival circuit achieving great accolades and  winning awards there.  I have learned how each of these stages of getting a film made offer the film maker key choices and opportunities to make the film better.  These decisions all require the director to have not only a great vision, but the ability to pass it on to a team they trust and whom can contribute to all of these steps.

At this point in my career,  I am eager to take all of the knowledge I have acquired and apply it,  along with my own creativity, to a project I believe in.  Directing has always come naturally to me.  In fact my career began as  a dance choreographer of music videos and fashion shows.  I was directing my talent and learning how to get performances, not that different from film directing.  While on the set of Ice Girls, my first produced screen play, I was able to contribute not only as a performer but also as a director when the scenes were on the ice and required a skater's eye.  This experience inspired my to take the next step and direct my first short film.  Viaticum was a gift.  Maureen had passed the story on to me to read several years ago.  Always a favourite of hers, she had dreams of seeing her story come to life.  I was honoured when she allowed me to write the script with her, and even more thrilled at her support of my directing the piece.  I am committed to making Viaticum the work of art it deserves be.
","why I want to do this project?

reading this story is what made me want to step up and direct for the first time!  I was approached to act in this piece a few years back and when I had time to look at it again and knew that actor Peter Outerbridge was still interested in starring ...that's when I decided to direct!  I believe that Viaticum will reach a wide audience and resonate on many levels.  It touches upon alcoholism, gay-bashing, teen-suicide, teen-bullying, dysfunctional families and the ensuing result.  Another part of the story that is truly thought provoking is the idea of how religion plays into our lives and the comfort that sacraments can provide.   In addition to Viaticum being an important film with a relatable story, the film is very female centric -  It  is written by a woman and is being directed by a woman.  The lead female character , Liz is an emotionally complex everyday woman. She doesn't just cry and doesn't just smile. And that is what drew me even more to this project.  It rang true.  This kind of story helps people to feel not so alone in their struggles and can provide a sense of hope and connection.  The film presents some hard questions and potential answers.  I am passionate about bringing this story to life!

Lara has had a successful acting career in film and television for 30 years.   Most recently she has ventured into writing and ""Viaticum"" will be her directorial debut.  She is well known for starring in ""A Dark Truth""(2012), ""King of Sorrow""(2007), as well as writing and starring in ""Ice Girls"" (2016) a Family Channel MOW, distributed by Netflix in the USA.

We are lucky and thrilled to have one of the most amazing Canadian actors of our time, Peter Outerbridge, on board this project!  Ever since the early 90's, Outerbridge has been a steady presence not only on the silver screen but also on TV. Among many others, he played three different characters on the science fiction show The Outer Limits, had a recurring role in season three of Chris Carter's mystery spin-off Millennium, played the lead in three feature-length episodes of the 2004 version of The Murdoch Mysteries, and scored his biggest lead role to date in the same year, when he was cast as headstrong scientist David Sandström in The Movie Network's ReGenesis. The science-themed show successfully aired for four years and has been broadcast internationally in over 20 countries. ReGenesis has been nominated for several

Evert Houston is an artistic creator dedicated to the invention, innovation and architecture of original story. His individual specializations include acting, writing, directing and producing for theatre, film, photography, original creations, performance art and live cinema. Mr. Houston's very first film which he wrote, produced and starred is the award winning: CHURANO, which was sold to the CBC Main Network, for a 3-year licensing period across all platforms as part of Canadian Reflections.
Trudy Weiss is Toronto actress, with a long list of credits.  She is well known for Entebbe (2018), Hannibal (2013) and Suits (2011).

Kaelen Ohm is a Canadian actress and musician. Born in Fernie, British Columbia she worked at the local Vogue Theatre during high school and after graduation, attended the Vancouver Film School for Film Production. She appeared in AMC's Hell on Wheels in Season 3 and played Katie in Alexander Carson's debut feature film, O' Brazen Age in 2015.  She was recently chosen for the prestigious Canadian Film Centre Actors program.  She currently resides in Toronto, Canada.

Brad has been a working actor for over 30 years in LA and Toronto. Credits include: Iron Eagle IV,  I am The Pretty Thing That Lives in The House, and Mystery ER. Brad's passion and respect for the art of acting paved the way for him to become an acting coach, he has empowered the careers of hundreds of actors through Milne Studio.

Dempsey Bryk is an American/ Canadian actor, born to actors Greg Bryk and Danielle Bryk in New York, NY. He grew up in Toronto, Ontario, and as a child Dempsey was a competitive boxer, placing first at the Ontario Bronze Gloves
column3: debater
column4: and mathematician, but he was also featured on family renovation shows such as A Bryk at a Time (2013) and ""Bryk House."" We are students within the Full Sail MFA (Master of Fine Arts) program, with the goal of creating a unique and fun film:

• This campaign is important to our team, as it is the culmination of a year long learning process and will reflect the progress made as a class.
    • We aim to bring to life a project that which we can all be proud to put our names in the credits and show to family, friends, and potentially festivals!

• Through the generous donations received, we will be able to not only achieve this goal, but we will accomplish something that is bigger than ourselves. Together, we can create a well made film that all will enjoy.
So let's cut to the chase: we need funding! Our desired goal is $3,250. This is a very visually oriented project, and will require a high attention to detail!
<li>We are looking to recreate a private detective office, similar to one seen in Noir films of the past!<ul><li>Venetian blinds, low lighting, a single desk and a chair
column2: we have to make this thing look right!

column1:
• The crown jewel of the production is Alfonso Giovanni's mustache emporium, otherwise known as FALSTACHIO'S!
    • This will require heavy set design to convey the feel of a real mustache shop. It will be equipped with mustaches in framed cases, paintings of mustaches
By providing ample funds to create this project, you will be benefitting:

STUDENTS! - This is an entirely student run production that provides an excellent, real-world learning experience of how a film is produced and distributed!
  • Through the filmmaking process, students will be able to take this knowledge and build upon it post-graduation.
• We look to show this film in and around Orlando, and wherever the festival circuit may take it.
• It is important to promote film within Orlando in order to bring both productions and ideas to the area.
We understand that the amount we're looking for is difficult to achieve, but it is all necessary to complete the vision we have crafted.

• Challenges
    • We are still in the midst of locking down the location for shooting. This could present higher costs when creating the sets and securing the actual location for the production.

• We plan to overcome this challenge by researching and cold calling various potential locations. Through our constant efforts, we will find a proper location that can be used for the shoot and stay within the budget.
If you are unable to contribute at this time, but may know someone who can/wants to help:
• Share this page and spread the word! Let everyone know that they have the opportunity to fund a project that will push film students to achieve their dreams.

And that's all there is to it.

Why do we handle depression the way we do? Why is depression this mysterious thing that is diagnosable and something that people can just quantify? Why do we just try to cover it up and suppress it with painkillers? Why do we stop at awareness? These are questions that I had to struggle with in my own depression. For me, my world didn’t just suddenly became all gloomy or sad one day, but this darkness had been building in me after my most recently failed relationship. I had put so much into our connection, and to have its dissolution pull her and friends apart made my world all the darker. This film came out of that struggle
column2: I first wrote it as a cathartic piece acknowledging where I had been and where I am now. I needed to process my depression, what caused it, and what brought me out.  As I was having a conversation about the project and how it was helping me process, a friend opened up to me about how he himself had an experience with depression through a family member and how simply talking about it brought so much light into his situation. Then I began to realize that one of the most encouraging and helpful weapons we have to fight this is conversation… face to face. Sometimes all it takes is a simple talk with another real human being to keep someone from leaving this world. And if my story could start these conversations then why not share it? I must share it.

column1: This story at first was very grounded in reality and had little fiction. However, now after ten drafts and over 10 months of working on the script I feel that the particular experiences and events in the main character Charles’s life are now very different from my own, but still resonate just as painfully. And, as Charles discovers, anxiety doesn't have to lead to despair and suicide, but can lead to hope and restoration.

In Rubaru we first meet Charles at what he thinks is the end of his story. He begins sharing memories and as we walk through his journey his life and well-being become more and more complicated until we come to the most important relationship he has. This is a film that places you in someone else’s shoes, in a slice of life where you can see all the pain and ups and downs that someone goes through and how that affects them. But, most importantly, it doesn’t end there. It’s sometimes hard to find in all the mess of life, but through the crap Charles goes through we find the beauty and the goodness that lies in store for him.

Born and raised in Fremont California, Marco grew up watching classic films and acting in plays and musicals. Along the way he aspired to be an actor, teacher, writer, IT guy, and finally an editor of film. Along that very bumpy journey he began writing stories that tackled difficult and emotional topics from very personal experiences. He loves to tell stories that are about tough subjects and get people to talk face to face. Now 24 and attending Biola University as undergraduate senior, Rubaru marks Marco's first feature-length directorial debut and he's already currently writing the next one.

Ever since animating LEGO bricks in middle school, Andy has had a passion for telling stories visually on screen. In high school he seriously began exploring film and has since been involved in freelance work, teaching film camps, dozens of professional and student projects, and many of his own narrative pieces including “A Piacere,” and the award-winning short, “After Yesterday.” While he appreciates most genres, he has a particular desire to tell stories that are deeply relatable and intentional and, from a place of authenticity, are able to make audiences consider an idea in a fresh or different way. Check out Andy’s work at andyjbrewster.com

Growing up, film was more of a hobby for Zach in the sense that he never gave it real attention beyond watching movies all the time and having somewhat of a reputation as the “movie guy” in school. It was never meant to be his career. However, by the time he got to Biola and saw what film students got to do, he knew there was no other option. He is currently a Media Management major minoring in Business Administration and a student in the Torrey Honors Institute.

This intimate story explores the impact of depression on a young man's life and the importance of face to face conversations with family, friends, coworkers, and other real human beings. Mental health, loneliness, isolation, depression, these are far too common themes in our culture that seem too overwhelming to conquer. There isn't one single bullet to solve all their problems, but Rubaru shows how one person's intentional conversation can change someone's life. As we make and share this story, we want to spread that message and encourage people to do the same towards people they know, battling mental health one person at a time, face to face.

Filmmaking is an expensive endeavor, but we're making this entire feature length film for approximately $20,000. This sounds like a lot, but when you consider feeding the entire cast and crew for a month, transportation, art department, marketing, post production, location fees, etc. it adds up quickly and this is pennies compared to Hollywood films. How are we able to do it?

Since we're students at Biola University, we have access to state of the art gear and sound stages for free and have connections to venues around LA and Orange counties that post-graduate filmmakers wouldn't have. This DIY strategy is allowing us to do things uniquely efficiently and put every penny we raise to exponentially enhance the way we tell our story.
We're putting a lot of our own savings towards this project, working with sponsors, churches, and businesses, but we need your help to feed our 30+ team and finish a large apartment set.
Starting conversations with those around you, sharing this project with friends and family on our website, Facebook or Instagram.

Based around the music of Thee Shambels, Lonely à la Mode delivers three stories of heartbreak, longing and missed opportunities, somewhere akin to the movies of Wim Wenders and Sam Shepherd.

Three songs, three films! A Matryoshka doll of a film! A trapeze artist misses his partner, lovers disconnect on a subway train, a brother and sister navigate life with mental illness and a boorish Southern patriarch gets his comeuppance at his own funeral...

I returned to song writing in 2005 after a decade working in newspapers. Three minute stories in a minor key, with characters conjured up like a drunken teenager with a Ouija board. By recording the album ‘Lonely à la Mode’ with my band Thee Shambels, in 2016, I thought I could move on to new songs, new stories.

But the characters I’d created wouldn’t leave me alone, and those stubborn little spirits were joined by others. You see, a rock ‘n’ roll song isn’t really long enough to tell their tales in depth. So, to exorcise the ghosts, I turned to film—a childhood obsession—and I invoked them once more.

In one form or another, I've been working on this film for two years, but it wasn't until Samatha Jean Moore came on board as a producer that the wheels started to roll. She was instrumental in guiding me to shoot in her home state or I should say, the Commonwealth, of Kentucky.
""It's dripping with Southern Gothic,"" she said, ""you'll love it.""

We’re not asking you to take a risk, we’ve already shot the film, it’s in the can, but we need some more money to get the film out there.  One of the ways we can do this, is by entering film festivals, this costs money: Producing the DVD screeners, the entry fees, and when we get into the festivals we want to represent the film, which means Samantha and I will travel to the film festivals, wherever they might be, and talk to people about our film, and that’s where we need your help.
Remember! We’ve already shot the film, it’s done! You’re not contributing to some hair-brained scheme where the project will never see the light of day.

Your contribution will help us distribute Lonely à la Mode. Actors and crew who have given their time and skills, will get exposure once the film is available. Also, we want to raise awareness of the Kentucky film Industry and it's towns and cities as a destination for film makers, big and small.
We've called in tons of favors, begged stolen and borrowed and committed not an insubstantial  amount of money, we just need your help getting it out there.
If you can't contribute financially, don't worry! You can still help by sharing the project. Tell people about it on Facebook and use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Music

Modern Americana with dark shades of European folk, Brooklyn based ‘Thee Shambels’ tell stories full of heartbreak and longing. Singing with an eye on the hangman and a hand on the bottle, Englishman – but no gentleman – Neville Elder, croons, wails, and waltzes with the enthusiasm of the demented sideshow hawker. Wallow in their melancholia!

Listen to the full album here.

Thee Shambels pictured below: (left to right) Neville Elder (guitar and vocals) Sarah Mischner (vocals) JJ Murphy (drums and guitars) and Scott Kitchen (Bass).

We have a new post production campaign! http://indiegogo.com/projects/food-lies-production

I’m Brian Sanders, and I’m making a feature length documentary called Food Lies. It's the sordid history of our dietary guidelines, the epidemic of chronic disease and obesity that followed, what the new science is telling us humans should actually be eating, and how to eat that food sustainably.

“What should we eat?” There’s so much conflicting information out there, you can even find a website espousing the miracles of an all-twinkie diet. You spend money and willpower trying to make healthy decisions, but you just gain more weight. It seems hopeless
Misinformation and bad science has led us astray over the past 60 years. It wasn’t malicious
column3: we just got some things wrong. 'Eating fat makes you fat' seemed logical. Cholesterol in food and cholesterol in clogged arteries seemed like an obvious connection. 'Heart healthy grains' was repeated so many times by so many reputable organizations, we just accepted it as fact. The problem is, none of it’s true.

column1: I’ve been a filmmaker since middle school. I’ve also built and sold a tech company, worked as a mechanical engineer, and now, I’ve quit my job to devote the rest of my life to this cause. I’ve researched every conflicting dietary approach and it’s all finally starting to make sense—even some of the vegan arguments. I’ve put this research into practice, and now, at age 35, I’m in the best shape of my life. My vitals and blood work are flawless and I haven’t been sick in 3 years. The same goes for countless family, friends, and millions around the world.

We’re so close to finishing this film, but we need your support. With your contributions, we can shoot the remainder of the documentary, complete post-production, and inform the public about this crucial issue. Please pre-order a copy of the film and check out our great rewards. Thank you for your support.
This film will cover much more than what's depicted in the trailer. Highlights will include:
• How we misunderstood nutrition and spread the wrong information
• The resulting epidemic of chronic disease and obesity
• Tons of graphics to explain things easily
• How to source these foods both ethically and sustainably

column3: '>This film will be handy for:

column1: • Someone who’s confused by continuously conflicting headlines on what’s supposedly healthy.
• Your vegan coworker who not-so-subtly accuses you of killing yourself and the planet every time you have meat for lunch.
• Someone with chronic disease or family history of one and wants to learn how diet can help treat, prevent, or reverse it.
• Your aunt who doesn't know anything about nutrition and wants a tight 90-minute audio-visual presentation of all the info.
• You to send to someone as a recap of everything you’ve been trying to tell them for the past 3 years.
• Someone who lost their roommate—and their roommate’s Netflix subscription—so they have nothing to watch.
• Sharp people who already know this stuff, eat this way, and want to expand their knowledge base.
Find out more about the film at FoodLies.org  <
We've already shot half of the film!

We won't accept money from any outside interests, food companies, or organizations. We aren't even accepting money from traditional production companies. We know they will take some creative control and influence the final product.
In other words, we're doing this all on our own—and with the help of generous contributors like you!
We still need your support to help shoot the remaining interviews with these great experts:
We’d like to thank Nina, Mark, Prof. Noakes, and Dr. Eenfeldt at DietDoctor.com for allowing us to use their footage for our trailer.
We filmed with Gary Taubes when he was visiting Santa Monica. We also shot with Dr. Ted Naiman and Denise Minger in Seattle. Everyone has been so amazingly generous with their time and resources!
Above is an interview with Dr. Shawn Baker who was in LA to do Joe Rogan’s podcast.
The simple answer is - this is my life.
I've truly gone all-in on this ""movement."" I've left the world of well-paying, stable jobs behind, and jumped into this fully. I'm excited where it's going to take me.

I also live by these principles and have achieved optimum health. I recently got a full physical and cholesterol panel and am (in the doctor's words) ""in perfect health."" My cholesterol and other markers show I am totally free of all indicators of heart disease, diabetes, or any metabolic disease.

I also am the host of the Peak Human Podcast which initially is a 13-part free course on nutrition. I've interviewed 12 of the top experts in their field to explain (much of) this confusing and conflicting information in one series.
To me, this is more than just a film, this is my life's work. I've committed to continue on after the film is completed to contribute to the health of our world in areas such as:
- working with doctors to create health plans that prevent and reverse chronic disease instead of just masking the symptoms
- reduce our reliance on industrial agriculture
- continuing to research, promote, and support accurate, unbiased information on health

You’ve heard enough about me by now.

 

Jay Hanamura

Jay is a Director/Writer/DP/Editor living in Honolulu. Having recently been awarded with Hawaii’s Young Ad Person of the Year Award, Jay’s mother feels compelled more than ever to tell strangers that her son is a prodigy.

When not referring to himself in the third person or impressing people with his humbling humility, he can be found surfing, hiking, cooking meat/veggies, traveling, and pulling all-nighters to make brands come to life.

 

Peter Estermann

Peter is a Screenwriter and Copywriter who has worked for some of the most prestigious advertising agencies in Los Angeles, New York, and Seattle. In his spare time, he reads books on nutrition, evolution, and psychology and attempts to engage in civil online debates, which he always regrets.

Although Peter loves espousing the benefits of ancestral diets, his wallet loves the low demand for organ meats, and he's felt conflicted about this project from the start.

 

Joe Monte
Joe is too young and too fit to be concerned with nutrition, but is down for the cause nonetheless. His editing skills are wise beyond their years.
We couldn't have a more dedicated team - each one of us is so passionate about spreading the correct information about nutrition. We live and breath this daily!

Above we see Brian, Jay, and Peter in Hawaii where they grew up together and on a recent trip to Tokyo. Side note: instead of encountering a bunch of rice and noodles in Japan, we found a huge focus on fatty meat, seafood, and vegetables.

We need you to finish the film! So far we've squeezed by on our personal dime. I've basically gone broke making this film. I believe in it so much, I'm ok with this. We do need your help to finish it, however. We still have to:
• Travel and shoot a special feature on sustainability

column2: graphics - we want this to look great

column1: • It's getting boring to list all this...
Our initial goal of $60,000 is just to get this process in motion. Once we get this, we can be sure we can move forward and raise the rest of the funds needed to make this a top quality film.
We have so many great rewards we're offering in exchange for your support!
Pre-ordering a copy of the film is the easiest way to support it's creation. You'll be the first to receive a digital download in high quality 4K.
Copy of the Film w/ Extra Features

You'll get the film along with the bonus and behind the scenes content. We have so much content already, there's no way it can all make the final cut. This exclusive content will not be available elsewhere.

Anyone contributing $50 or more will receive an invite to the private Food Lies Slack group where you can interact with fellow supporters and the filmmakers. Special content will be released there as the film is being made.
Receive a high quality print of the official movie poster signed by Brian. Printed on semi-gloss paper at 18"" x 24"".
This coin symbolizes your commitment to a ""Sapien Diet"" - one which focuses on nutrient density, embraces healthy fats, and is free of sugar, refined grains, and vegetable/seed oils.
Sapien Victus - Human Nourishment. What Homo Sapiens are meant to eat. Victus means sustenance, nourishment, means of living, food.
Cibus Est Medicina - Food is Medicine. Our ancestors new this - it's sad that we ever forgot this.
Personalize this with your name and month/year you began eating this way. You can also upgrade to a velvet case to display this special coin.
This unique coin will never be sold outside of this crowdfunding campaign. Get this limited edition collector’s item today!

The kind people at Butcher Box are supporting us in creating this film. They are offering discounts on their grass-fed meat delivery service. It’s one of the best and most affordable ways for anyone to get the healthiest meat possible. Now that we know meat is good for our health, let’s get the good stuff!
Bonus: Get $10 off and FREE bacon for life (on any order) by using the code FOODLIES at checkout at ButcherBox.com

Thrive Market is also helping us raise funds for this film by contributing 5 five-year free memberships to their online market. Each one is a $300 value! It’s a great way to buy products that are truly healthy at a good price.
I want to hear from people who are knowledgeable and passionate about this topic. I’ll be available for a 45-minute phone call where we can discuss your ideas for what the film should cover.

This goes a step beyond just a phone call - let’s meet in person! Let’s schedule an extended lunch in the LA area and discuss anything and everything to do with nutrition and the film. I can’t wait to meet and hear from you!

 

Share a Steak with Dr. Shawn Baker
The doc has been kind enough to lend some of his much-valued steak-eating time to a lucky contributor. This would take place in the LA area ideally in late July.

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you still can help! Please help us spread the word. Post about us on social media. Email your family and friends. Text your cousin. Talk about it with your barista. Do whatever you can to let people know they can be part of a very important film that changes the way we think about health and nutrition.
Follow our journey and get a bunch of super fun info along the way:

Facebook

 

If you’re still reading this, let’s be friends.

I grew up in two different, very small towns. Some would call them ""throw-away"" towns, but we'll call them outskirts for formality's sake. My parents had varying health issues, from being legally blind, to struggling with mental illness. This caused me to grow up quite quickly, and take on responsibilities normal kids my age wouldn't have to. My childhood experience felt unrelatable to any one of my friends', and of anything I saw on T.V. or movies. Since then, more things have come out revolving around having parents who are different and how that shapes our upbringing, but nothing has really encapsulated the experience of growing up with parents who are disabled.

It's been a dream of mine since I was a child to make a film surrounding this idea, and to someday start an organization to be a resource for kids in these situations. The film is only a first step, and the short, an extension of that.  Making the short film for my thesis enables me to extend the reach of the story, and potentially get recognition for the story and get to make the full feature film.
Ultimately, helping me will help other kids going through this to know that they aren't alone and in what ways it can get better for them.
I'm trying to raise 4,000$ to start. We made it through production by asking for a lot of favors, but I have racked up quite a bit of IOU's to other artists whom I respect greatly.
- Craft Services (food for production on set)
- Cinematography (we were able to get a professional from the industry to DP the project)
- Post Production (animation and sound design are quite extensive and require a great amount of time and work to make them impactful!)
- Festivals! (This one's my favorite part because it helps others hear about us and our mission!)
If you donate, you'll be eligible for different prizes/memberships:
- A personalized  ""Thank you"" card from the director, and free sticker!
- Membership to exclusive monthly Charlie Newsletter with updates, and exclusive BTS info!
- Membership to exclusive monthly Charlie Newsletter with updates, and exclusive BTS info!
- Signed poster from the Director and  Starring Actor
- Membership to exclusive monthly Charlie Newsletter with updates, and exclusive BTS info!
- Signed poster from the Director and  Starring Actor
- Exclusive live ""meet-and-greet"" with the Director and Co-Producer online, for a Q&
- Membership to exclusive monthly Charlie Newsletter with updates, and exclusive BTS info!
- Signed poster from the Director and  Starring Actor
- Exclusive live ""meet-and-greet"" with the Director and Co-Producer online, for a Q&
- Prerelease private link/copy of the short
It's always helpful to share our page! The more people that see it, the more impact we can have!

Making a film takes an army, and even if you're not a filmmaker, this is a GREAT way for you to get involved. Donating, telling others, or just talking about it are all incredibly helpful to the cause.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

","Short Summary

I grew up in two different, very small towns. Some would call them ""throw-away"" towns, but we'll call them outskirts for formality's sake. My parents had varying health issues, from being legally blind, to struggling with mental illness. This caused me to grow up quite quickly, and take on responsibilities normal kids my age wouldn't have to. My childhood experience felt unrelatable to any one of my friends', and of anything I saw on T.V. or movies. Since then, more things have come out revolving around having parents who are different and how that shapes our upbringing, but nothing has really encapsulated the experience of growing up with parents who are disabled.

It's been a dream of mine since I was a child to make a film surrounding this idea, and to someday start an organization to be a resource for kids in these situations. The film is only a first step, and the short, an extension of that.  Making the short film for my thesis enables me to extend the reach of the story, and potentially get recognition for the story and get to make the full feature film.
Ultimately, helping me will help other kids going through this to know that they aren't alone and in what ways it can get better for them.

It's always helpful to share our page! The more people that see it, the more impact we can have!

Making a film takes an army, and even if you're not a filmmaker, this is a GREAT way for you to get involved. Donating, telling others, or just talking about it are all incredibly helpful to the cause.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
