THE STORY

All We Ever Wanted is a sci-fi drama short film written by Andrew Fleming and to be directed by Michelle Garza Cervera. It is a film about letting go, dependency and the extreme choices we are willing to make in pursuit of our concept of a perfect life. The film will explore these ideas through a dark drama lens with elements of horror.

We focus on Gen, a woman whose partner Luciana, is in the final stages of locked-in syndrome. They are offered a chance to regain the life they thought they had lost through a procedure that will transfer Luciana's consciousness into a healthy clone. Everything appears to go smoothly until Gen is informed that Luciana's original body has unexpectedly awoken...

Gen is forced to make the an impossible decision: abandon the original Luciana and carry the secret into her new life, or sacrifice her potential happiness with the healthy clone Luciana.

Although the world of All We Ever Wanted is one where salsa-dancing, cloning and consciousness transfer exist it is far from a utopia. It is a world where processes, procedures and passive-aggressive bureaucrats rule. The operation takes place in a decaying and oppressive public health clinic run by cynical workers that have become far too used to witnessing this miracle. This creates a contrasting backdrop for Gen and Luciana’s desperation and optimism.

Through the three female characters, Gen and both Luciana's, we want to explore their relationships in a way that doesn't shy away from the darker emotions that come along with the fear of loss.  

We believe the science-fiction and horror genres provide strong tools to represent complex flesh-and-bone female characters. Through their own gaze and experience, we will narrate their path through this complicated situation.

 

YOUR SUPPORT

All We Ever Wanted is an ambitious short film in which we need to create a unique and convincing world. Therefore we really need your help in getting the funds required to bring this film to life. We will be dedicating all our own time and effort to the project but we will require atmospheric locations, creative artistic directors &
column2:
make-up artists and, of course, amazing acting talent to realise this dream.

MEET THE CREW

Director

Michelle Garza Cervera (Mexico, 1987). Studied at Centro de Capacitacion Cinematográfica (CCC) in Mexico City and finished the Directing Specialization with a Honorific Mention in 2016. She has written and directed several short films that have been selected in more than 40 international film festivals. Currently developing her first feature film script Huesera with the support of the Mexican Institute of Cinematography (IMCINE) . Chevening Award 2017-2018 to study the MA: Directing Fiction for Film at Goldsmiths University of London.  

Writer

Andrew Fleming is an Irish screenwriter currently living in London. He started screenwriting six years ago after attending a Film-making evening course in Amsterdam. His first short film Stutter, a two minute animation, has been shown at festivals across Europe and America. All We Ever Wanted will be his first live action production. He is currently studying the MA Screenwriting at Goldsmiths University.

His favourite film-makers are David Fincher and David Lynch and his more recent influences are low budget science fiction film-makers such as Mike Cahill and Shane Carruth.

Development Producer

Katerina Konstantopoulou was born in Athens, in 1989. She graduated from University of Greenwich in 2012, (BA in Film Directing) and she is currently completing her postgraduate studies in Film Producing at Goldsmiths University. Since 2008, she has directed short films, participated in international film festivals around the world and worked as photographer and assistant director at the theatre.

She loves the simplicity of Iranian cinema, the absurdism of Yorgos Lanthimos and the poetic films of Bela Tarr.

Line Producer

Hiroyuki Ishiguro was born in Japan, in 1991. He graduated from Aoyama Gakuin University in 2014, (BA in International Business). After graduating from Aoyama Gakuin University, he has worked for Japanese Investment Bank for 2 years in Tokyo. Following his passion to produce film projects, he started his postgraduate studies in Filmmaking (Producing) at Goldsmiths, University of London.

Cinematographer

Madhav Mathur is an aspiring cinematographer studying at Goldsmiths, University of London. He pursued his fine arts degree in Visual Communications from College of Art, affiliated to Delhi University, India as he was drawn to photography and film making from an early age. Upon graduation he joined the NDTV media institute to enter the world of broadcast journalism. Thereon he briefly worked as a travel filmmaker at Kunzum. In addition to the academic background pertaining to filmmaking he has also dabbled in extracurricular such as a tenor in the Delhi Youth Chorus. He is also a graduate in Tabla
column3:
a famous Indian musical instrument and has been a lawn tennis player for 12 years, currently into long distance swimming and running marathons.

Editor
Daniela Rullo was born in Naples in 1986. As a child, she showed a vivid imagination and a sensitive nature. Her passion for moving images brought her in London where she is currently studying editing. She doesn't believe in limitations and constraints and thinks that art in all its forms and expressions can help with her quest for the key to the essence of things.

Camera Operator

Taylor Nelson, USA 1990.  Taylor is a camera operator, and studied Media Communications with a minor in Film Studies at North Carolina State University. The years following her undergraduate career were spent soul searching, always thinking about the film industry as she jumped from one career to another. Now, six years after graduating, she has decided to obtain her Masters in Cinematography at Goldsmiths, University of London, in order to fulfill her dreams of working with like-minded filmmakers on progressive and creatively innovative projects.

Sound Designer

Cam Griffiths is a sound designer, multi-instrumentalist, and composer from Margate, UK. A keen creator of noise and soundscapes, Cam graduated with first-class honours in Music from Brunel University. Since then, he has self-produced his own album, composed for film, theatre and community music groups, the Central Marching Band of the Royal Air Force, and works as a session musician. By combining his love of analog photography with sonic experimentation, Cam started sound designing for films and animation. In the future, he hopes to become a sound effects editor for animated films and write music for elevators.

column1: Dark water is a coming of age horror short film about Jace and Kyle Cosper, young brothers spending the last couple of hours on the water with each other before one goes off to college. When a 10 foot Great White surfaces the waters of their beach, the two brothers must learn to work together to make it to the shore and survive the jaws of the deadly beast.

This film will be an all out intense film. We will not only be scaring the hell out of audiences and keeping them at the edge of their seats biting their fingernails but we will also be passing along a good message throughout the film. This is not your typical shark movie where a shark is hungry and wants to feast on the protagonists, this is a film based solely on survival and how the brothers fight to survive.

In order to make this film a reality we are in need of $5,000, which will go towards building the shark, insurance for the film, Visual Effects for the things we can't do practically, and lastly film festival fees.
Every and all donation's are greatly appreciated and will continue to push us in the right direction towards making this film the best it can be!

$20 - Digital Thank You Card
$50 - Autographed Mini Poster and Digital Thank You Card
$100 - Special Thank You Video from the cast and crew of the film, Autographed Mini Poster, and Digital Thank You Card.
$200 - Official Dark Water Movie T-Shirt, Special Thank You Video from the cast and crew of the film, Autographed Mini
Poster, and Digital Thank You Card
$500 - PRODUCER LEVEL 1 - Receive all of the above as well as name in the beginning, ending, and rolling credits.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is an 'all-hands-on-deck' project! If you are unable to financially contribute, we most definitely are greatly appreciative of any and all advice, tips, and any resources we can use to help build onto our project! If you can can contribute in any way please reach out (www.dbpfilms.co/contact)&
column3:
and be apart of our amazing journey!

column1: Home is a dramatic fantasy short film about a young girl who loses her parents in a mysterious disappearance.  She spends the next 15 years searching for them but has no luck in finding them.  Over the course of this time, she withdraws herself further from everyday life.  She consistently falls behind on her rent, alienates friends, and struggles to even make it to her weekly counseling sessions.  Through all of this, she experiences vivid dreams that she swears are more than dreams... perhaps visions.  Though her relentless hope to find her parents paints her as a lunatic, she can feel that they're out there somewhere.

Some recent, tonally-similar films to Home are Arrival and Blade Runner: 2049.  I want the film to be deeply rooted in reality, so when the fantastic events at our climax arrive, they wow our audience.

When I wrote home, I was writing from the perspective of someone who has been somewhat-nomadic throughout life.  It wasn't until I met my wife that I felt like I had a home anywhere.  But I eventually found that the film ""Joe Dirt"" was quite right in its cheesy line, ""Home is where you make it.""  And with the arrival of our daughter Luna, we're a home to a filmmaking family who loves to create together.
Our hopes for the film are to make it a serious festival contender and submit it to as many festivals as we're able.  Festival submission fees have also been worked into the total fundrasing amount.
The cast and crew of the film are all folks that I've worked with quite a bit and I know that they'll come out and work to make Home truly amazing.  Let's meet some of them!
Giselle has been professionally acting for 10 years, taking part in theater, film, voiceover, and commercial production.  Most recently, she's discovered a great talent &
column2: love for writing, having been commissioned to write feature and short film scripts.

column1: Wade is a seasoned actor who has also discovered a wonderful talent for directing.  When directing, he has a unique ability in coaxing nuanced performances out of his actors.

J.D. has had a long career in the film industry, with passions for Directing, Assistant Directing, and Costuming.  She is detail-focused and because she's worked in nearly every department in film and theater, she knows exactly what it takes to build a film from from pre-production to final delivery.

I (Tim) am a cinematographer who got my professional start shooting behind-the-scenes shorts documenting the making of feature films.  After shooting nearly 40 of these, some in very challenging conditions, I learned to use natural and motivated lighting to my advantage in creating interesting and engaging stories.

As the cinematographer for Home, one of the things that I've done in pre-preproduction is to design every shot of the film (In our shot-list) to look and feel magical.  And a few of the tools that I'm excited to implement for the film are the camera and lens combination that we've secured for the shoot.  We'll be capturing everything on the Blackmagic Ursa Mini Pro &
column2: a set of vintage Cineovision High-Speed, Anamorphic prime lenses.  These will also play a vital role in crafting magical images for Home.

column1: You may also be wondering where the funding for the film will go.   Well, here is a list:
<li>Number one will be to the cast and crew.  We want to be able to pay our cast and crew for the time, talent &amp
column2: effort that they put into this film.

column1: • Second, funding will go to food and transportation for our cast and crew.  We want to make sure that everyone is well nourished and that everyone can get out to some of our more remote desert locations.

• Funding will also be going to the payment for our crew, rental of equipment, locations, purchase of props and set pieces that will help to create a more immersive story, and hard drives to store all of our important footage and audio on.

• I've also budgeted a small amount for any contingencies that might occur during production.  These contingencies include things like equipment failures and additional meals for days that run longer than expected.

One of the greatest challenges in bringing ""Home"" to life is going to be shooting at night in a remote desert location outside of Lancaster, CA.  Not only will getting folks out to the location be a hurtle but lighting our scenes will also be tough.  Fortunately, we will be using the power of carpooling to make sure that if we do get lost, at least we'll be lost together! :D  Also, the lighting scheme that I've planned for will be all battery-powered LED lighting, that is lightweight, powerful, and will last for many hours.

Over the course of 7 years, I've worked on over 50 feature-length films and have learned what to do and not do in order to bring a project through to completion.  I've also successfully funded the post-production of three previous short films here on Indiegogo, so I'm no stranger to the community.   I believe that through the hard work of our talented &
column3: crew, we will deliver a beautiful finished ""Home.""

column1: If contributing to the campaign for ""Home"" isn't feasible for you, perhaps you'll consider sharing it with your family and friends.

If you feel a deep enough connection to spend your hard-earned money on this, we (The cast and crew) would be immensely grateful for your contribution at any level.  Thank you so much for having a look at our campaign!

","HOME

Home is a dramatic fantasy short film about a young girl who loses her parents in a mysterious disappearance.  She spends the next 15 years searching for them but has no luck in finding them.  Over the course of this time, she withdraws herself further from everyday life.  She consistently falls behind on her rent, alienates friends, and struggles to even make it to her weekly counseling sessions.  Through all of this, she experiences vivid dreams that she swears are more than dreams... perhaps visions.  Though her relentless hope to find her parents paints her as a lunatic, she can feel that they're out there somewhere.

Some recent, tonally-similar films to Home are Arrival and Blade Runner: 2049.  I want the film to be deeply rooted in reality, so when the fantastic events at our climax arrive, they wow our audience.

When I wrote home, I was writing from the perspective of someone who has been somewhat-nomadic throughout life.  It wasn't until I met my wife that I felt like I had a home anywhere.  But I eventually found that the film ""Joe Dirt"" was quite right in its cheesy line, ""Home is where you make it.""  And with the arrival of our daughter Luna, we're a home to a filmmaking family who loves to create together.
Our hopes for the film are to make it a serious festival contender and submit it to as many festivals as we're able.  Festival submission fees have also been worked into the total fundrasing amount.
The cast and crew of the film are all folks that I've worked with quite a bit and I know that they'll come out and work to make Home truly amazing.  Let's meet some of them!

Giselle has been professionally acting for 10 years, taking part in theater, film, voiceover, and commercial production.  Most recently, she's discovered a great talent & love for writing, having been commissioned to write feature and short film scripts.
Wade is a seasoned actor who has also discovered a wonderful talent for directing.  When directing, he has a unique ability in coaxing nuanced performances out of his actors.

J.D. has had a long career in the film industry, with passions for Directing, Assistant Directing, and Costuming.  She is detail-focused and because she's worked in nearly every department in film and theater, she knows exactly what it takes to build a film from from pre-production to final delivery.

I (Tim) am a cinematographer who got my professional start shooting behind-the-scenes shorts documenting the making of feature films.  After shooting nearly 40 of these, some in very challenging conditions, I learned to use natural and motivated lighting to my advantage in creating interesting and engaging stories.

As the cinematographer for Home, one of the things that I've done in pre-preproduction is to design every shot of the film (In our shot-list) to look and feel magical.  And a few of the tools that I'm excited to implement for the film are the camera and lens combination that we've secured for the shoot.  We'll be capturing everything on the Blackmagic Ursa Mini Pro & a set of vintage Cineovision High-Speed, Anamorphic prime lenses.  These will also play a vital role in crafting magical images for Home.
You may also be wondering where the funding for the film will go.   Well, here is a list:
Number one will be to the cast and crew.  We want to be able to pay our cast and crew for the time, talent & effort that they put into this film.

Second, funding will go to food and transportation for our cast and crew.  We want to make sure that everyone is well nourished and that everyone can get out to some of our more remote desert locations.

Funding will also be going to the payment for our crew, rental of equipment, locations, purchase of props and set pieces that will help to create a more immersive story, and hard drives to store all of our important footage and audio on.

I've also budgeted a small amount for any contingencies that might occur during production.  These contingencies include things like equipment failures and additional meals for days that run longer than expected.

One of the greatest challenges in bringing ""Home"" to life is going to be shooting at night in a remote desert location outside of Lancaster, CA.  Not only will getting folks out to the location be a hurtle but lighting our scenes will also be tough.  Fortunately, we will be using the power of carpooling to make sure that if we do get lost, at least we'll be lost together! :D  Also, the lighting scheme that I've planned for will be all battery-powered LED lighting, that is lightweight, powerful, and will last for many hours.

Over the course of 7 years, I've worked on over 50 feature-length films and have learned what to do and not do in order to bring a project through to completion.  I've also successfully funded the post-production of three previous short films here on Indiegogo, so I'm no stranger to the community.   I believe that through the hard work of our talented & diverse cast & crew, we will deliver a beautiful finished ""Home.""
If contributing to the campaign for ""Home"" isn't feasible for you, perhaps you'll consider sharing it with your family and friends.

If you feel a deep enough connection to spend your hard-earned money on this, we (The cast and crew) would be immensely grateful for your contribution at any level.  Thank you so much for having a look at our campaign!",6.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Let's face it, the zombie and faith based film world have pretty much become repetitive. Why not be part of the first faith based zombie film? Why not shake up the genres by helping to create an action packed, dramatic, funny and scary film that somehow leaves feeling inspired? If you want your money to make an impact...this is it.
Let's be honest, the world as we know it...is becoming morality free.
Rampant racism, classism, hate, greed and the sheer misuse of faith are the culprits.
Most faith based movies rarely help and create a false sense of reality.
Typical storylines go: Everyone is almost perfect and when they mess up, God appears then bam...back to being close to perfect.
That's not real. Many of us are walking examples of God intervening in our imperfect lives. We cuss, we lie, we get betrayed, we betray, we cheat, we fail, we hurt, we get hurt...we human.

Zombie movies are more gore-fests than inspiring. Slow walking zombies that eat brains or have an insatiable thirst to kill without reason. The themes are repetitive and lack imagination. What if the zombies were different? What if they talked, ran, thought...etc? How would that change the landscape of zombie films?

We wanted to combine them both to create something different but of the same. This was done in hopes of inspiring heavy thought and discussion about faith. However, Six Hours will be about real people who believe in God, atheists,  zombies and how their lives intersect during an apocalypse. All in all, the viewer will not leave thinking, ""Why did I waste my time?"" but, ""Wow...I love God more"" or ""I need to love people more.""  (Yup, using zombies to inspire thought...sounds weird right?)

About Film

An Imam, Pastor and Rabbi walk into a private bar...that's not the beginning of a bad joke but the commencement of what they call, ""The Absolute Awakening.""Three men come together to put an end to the ""bastardizing of humanity."" They're fed up with normality of financial greed, over sexualization and government corruption. With this unified passion, they make a choice to master reset the country...one state at a time...starting with Georgia. 

They pick the world's greatest scientist and manipulate him into creating one of the most evil and discriminatory viruses the world has seen. Once the virus takes control of Georgia, the U.S. government calls for a missile strike to prevent the hordes of ""White Eyes"" from infecting the remaining country.

Six hours until the strike we find six strangers  of three different religions fighting for survival. As the clock ticks down, they find out their pasts intertwine and no matter their  religion...all they have...is just faith. Will they survive or will they disappear with the state?

My name is Devin T. Robinson X ""Egypt."" I'm a father, husband and drama ministry director at Berean Christian Church.   All my life I've been in awe of how little we know about God but how much we hurt other people for not knowing Him at all. This film is my imagination meeting reality. Lastly, I'm a writer, producer &

What Will We Do With The Money?
All of the funding is going towards finishing the film.
• Script Supervisors: Lakeisha Eaton and Kiara Barnes
If We Don't Raise The Entire Amount?

No matter what we will create a film. There is no other way to go. How can you have a faith based film without faith? We're committed to creating a phenomenal film and money isn't allowed to be a deterrent to our purpose. This film is bigger than money and we will make finishing it our obligation.

Let's face it, the zombie and faith based film world have pretty much become repetitive. Why not be part of the first faith based zombie film? Why not shake up the genres by helping to create an action packed, dramatic, funny and scary film that somehow leaves feeling inspired? If you want your money to make an impact...this is it.

They're fed up with normality of financial greed, over sexualization and government corruption. With this unified passion, they make a choice to master reset the country...one state at a time...starting with Georgia. They pick the world's greatest scientist and manipulate him into creating one of the most evil and discriminatory viruses the world has seen. Once the virus takes control of Georgia, the U.S. government calls for a missile strike to prevent the hordes of ""White Eyes"" from infecting the remaining country.Six hours until the strike we find six strangers  of three different religions fighting for survival. As the clock ticks down, they find out their pasts intertwine and no matter their  religion...all they have...is just faith. Will they survive or will they disappear with the state?

My name is Devin T. Robinson X ""Egypt."" I'm a father, husband and drama ministry director at Berean Christian Church.   All my life I've been in awe of how little we know about God but how much we hurt other people for not knowing Him at all. This film is my imagination meeting reality. Lastly, I'm a writer, producer & actor.
What Will We Do With The Money?All of the funding is going towards finishing the film.
Directors: Egypt Robinson  and Sidney Weaver
Cameramen: Corel Chapman and Darrick Watkins
Producers: Brittany Williams and Johanne Naipaul
Script Supervisors: Lakeisha Eaton and Kiara Barnes
If We Don't Raise The Entire Amount?

No matter what we will create a film. There is no other way to go. How can you have a faith based film without faith? We're committed to creating a phenomenal film and money isn't allowed to be a deterrent to our purpose. This film is bigger than money and we will make finishing it our obligation.",0.0,1,"2 Campaigns

Ockhi is a story of two young brothers, George, and Anil (age 18 and 12), have a loving family and they both help their father run his backwaters tour and fishing business. One early morning when they went fishing, their world turned upside down.
Ockhi in Bengali means 'The Eye' of a Cyclone, as it was originated from Andaman sea.

Abhinav Dubey is the Director of the film. He has a BA in Journalism and Mass communication from India, and MA in Filmmaking (Direction) from The Northern Film School, Leeds, United Kingdom. He has directed many short films and has won many awards for his Short Curtains. He has been working on this story from the past 9 months and waiting to tell the story to the world.

This was the deadliest cyclone in Indian Subcontinent after 1999. The warning came only an hour before the devastation began. This has caused a death toll of 245 persons and 661 still missing. Compared to the developed world, the facilities with government system for rescue and relief are limited.

The story is of two young boys' struggle for survival in a turbulent sea for 7 days will also create impact and more awareness for increasing the rescue and relief facilities at the disposal of the government. This will also encourage people at large to hold on in such adverse conditions for their own survival and a better life. The climate change is bringing more such difficult situations all over the world.
We want to tell the true story of survival which will not only show the world how people stand together at the time of crisis but also reveal the government functioning and how the system works.

Whatever we get through the funding, 20% will be kept aside for Kerala relief fund and will be used whenever such natural disaster happens. This film is for the people who survived, saved, and also in the memory of who lost their lives in the sea.

As we move towards the production of the film, the main challenge is to get the Visual Effects right. As we all know, Vfx cost a lot for a feature film, But we will try to make it as real as possible. The initial target is £45,000, and we would go ahead for a target of £100,000 as we want to give pure cinema experience.

It's not easy to shoot in the Arabian sea for long, that is one the biggest challenge for us to keep going, but we have managed to get the right people on board. We have also got the Government on board and they are more than happy to help in making the film and we will try to get the Indian Navy as well.
We really need your support to make this film get on screen, and we promise you will get the best experience and cinema coming from India!

We have a powerful script, budget, schedule, and crew. Now we need you. We're crowdfunding because financing an independent feature film is a challenging proposition for investors and we want to offer opportunities for people to get directly involved with the project. 'Ockhi' going to be a true community experience. We have many perks for you, please do have a look!

We understand that not every person has the money to donate, but what we hope you can take away from our project is the passion we have not just for this film, but for the people who have opened their doors and hearts to us. We are committed to faithfully sharing their story with you. You can help us share it with others. Spread the word. Everyone involved with this project will be very proud, remember... WE ARE ONE!
Don't forget to follow us on social media and tag us as in your posts! And use the Indiegogo share tools above!

A decade before, when I was studying Architecture, I used to wonder how these thousands of years old architectures still exist on earth, few excavated, few as ruins. We stand at the present time using architecture with modern innovative technologies. Will our present creations live long as them ? Or was there something special in the architecture of the past, which we still need to explore, the secrets hidden in their layers of stones.

The quest for quenching the creative thirst landed me in a film school few years back. And I learned how to preserve few precious moments, people and even objects for many years, after their lifetime and be shared with many generations and geographies. I find Architecture and Filmmaking have lot of similarities and one of them is that, both deal with capturing the present and holding it for many years. Capturing an Architectural piece like Kanheri caves ( 1st Century BC Buddhist Architecture) in a Documentary film will create synergy.

Mumbai is an Indian city which is exploding with population at present time. Different class of people co-exist in the city just like two thousand years back, when the Buddhists had built these caves in the same place. They had built houses for living, prayer halls for worshipping, community halls and many more. Even they had individual water-storage with every cave unit along with the rain water harvesting system. All were rock-cut caves built on a mountain surrounded by a dense forest.

Now, Mumbai city has grown around this mountain and forest keeping Kanheri in its heart. Exploring this BC era's Architectural marvel along with the present urban spaces, is the journey of this Documentary film.

The pre-production of the film has started. Also we have been getting in touch with the Archeological experts, Historians and Conservation Architects for the film. We are also collecting the Architectural footprints of the caves and the whole settlement that was built that time. And trying to find out the hidden design principles along with the architects and Historians to understand the civilisation more and talking with the Urban planners to understand what all we can adapt from them to our present time.

This subject needs a good amount of research work and shooting and documenting on the old Architectural piece. For the complete production of the Documentary film we have estimated a budget of $ 50,000. We are also tying to get in touch with the Documentary Fund Providers across the world. Here in Indiegogo we have kept an initial target of $15,000 to reach first. If it resonates with you please come and be a part of us in creating this film. Hope we could achieve our goal with the help of you. You can provide whatever you can, every little amount counts and makes it big in the end. Also share this small idea with more people whom you think are like-minded. That will help us big time.

This film once made will be taken to various Film Festivals, Architectural colleges as a research material and seminars. Through this film we want to create more awareness and sensitivity towards our own heritage and keep it surviving for at least another thousand years.

All contributors will be named under the section of ""Contributors"" in the end-credit of the film. Other than that there there will be t-shirts, posters and other goodies on the theme of the film depending on the amount of contribution. Also the highest contributor will get the title of Executive Producer.
If you are not willing to contribute, please spread the word so that people around us get to know about our film and watch it in future when its made.

column3:
>

 

This is a difficult time for our country, and it’s getting worse. So many of us feel upset and discouraged. We made this movie because the wisdom of the East has helped us feel calm and balanced in the face of this utter craziness.

 

We know this wisdom can make an impact in this country. Look how popular Hatha Yoga has been and it's just one method in the larger system of Indian spiritual practice.

 

Our culture is on the brink of bringing this wisdom into the mainstream. Our goal is to help make this a reality. And we need your help.
column4:
>

 

""There is now the possibility for movies to embody that arising state of consciousness.""-Eckhart Tollee

 

 

Now is it the time to answer a spiritual call to arms! Help us fight the coarsening of our culture and steward these wisdom teachings to the next generation.
column5:
>

 

 

Thanks to you, and the rest of our community, American Yogi has already been a success. In previous Indiegogo campaigns we have raised enough money to finish the film, hire a sales agent, and attract a prestigious distributor, Kino Lorber.
column8:
>

 

Our first theatrical showing of the film was held last Dec. 1 at the Smith Rafael theater in Marin county. Keep in mind, December is the month when all the theaters are heavy with movies coming out for academy award consideration… We were delighted when—not only did we have a good week—but because of the fantastic word of mouth from inspired moviegoers, American Yogi was held over for five weeks.

Our distributor called the box office “outstanding.” We’d like to invite you to continue this momentum with us.
column9:
> 

When we held our East Coast showing of the film in February at the Rubin Museum in New York City, it was to the same outstanding response. Viewers expressed so much emotion and gratitude for the movie. Many reported feeling they had received a healing blessing.

 

""People who have not made the trip to India or met a guru like Maharaj-ji will find 'American Yogi' an inspiration for their spiritual journey.""

-Ram Dass

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

 

Kino Lorber has fulfilled their agreement with us by showing it in two theatres and creating a DVD. Now it's up to us to publicise the movie and get it out into the world. Film experts are telling us that we can cross over to a mainstream audience because our film is funny, fast paced, inspiring and entertaining.
column10:
>

 

If we don't put our energy and money into American Yogi now, it will become another wonderful small movie that sits quietly on the shelf. We want to make an impact and help other conscious films become successful.

 

So we consulted with Stephen Powers, who was instrumental in success of The Secret. He referred us to Dea Shandera-Hunter, a former Executive Vice President at MGM and former VP at Disney. She suggested the following plan to get us on the map:

 

1) Rent a theatre for a full week with a focus on getting reviews in the LA press. Good reviews in LA would lead to showings in New York and other major cities, creating more exposure and momentum.

Cost-$14,000

 

2) Conduct a comprehensive publicity outreach on radio shows, blogs, podcasts, magazine articles, spiritual centres, churches and traditional print media.

Cost-$16,000

 

This is why we need your help. Your contribution shows the film industry that people want conscious movies.
column11:
>

(People waiting for food at the Kanchi Neem Karoli Baba temple in India.)

Twenty Five percent of the profits for American Yogi will go to feeding poor people in India and to the Maharaj-ji temple in Tao​s.

 

""American Yogi is a lovely, rejuvenating movie. I laughed many times, and was moved nearly to tears by its spiritual profundity.""- Anne Lamott

 

(Maharaj-ji picture, mala and altar cloth)

* A copy of Be Here Now autographed by Ram Dass

* An altar cloth from Vrindavan, India, blessed by an Indian Saint

*A scarf from Varanasi, India, blessed by an Indian Saint

*A medallion of Maharaj-ji from his Vrindavan ashram blessed by a Saint

*A rudraksha mala from Varanasi, India blessed by a Saint

*Unique poster art from India

 

*Executive Producer credit at end of movie

*A photograph of Maharaj-ji suitable for framing. (see below)

And more cool stuff! Take a look at the Perks.

 

 

Featuring an awesome world music soundtrack by Jai Uttal and Krishna Das.
column12:
>

A deeply inspired film! About what the Western mind calls fiction and the East calls reality. -Shankar Mohan, Director, International Film Festival of India

People who have not made the trip to India or met a guru like Maharaj-ji will find American Yogi an inspiration for their spiritual journey. -Ram Dass

American Yogi is a lovely, rejuvenating movie. I laughed many times, and was moved nearly to tears by its spiritual profundity. -Anne Lamott, author of Hallelujah Anyway

Joyful and a true delight. I loved it! -Marci Shimoff,author of Happy for No Reason

American Yogi will open your heart and just might change your life. James Baraz, author of Awakening Joy.

Feedback from viewers:

""I am so excited to be a part of this brilliant journey of the heart! It will transform the lives of so many.”

""Watching American Yogi turned out to be a huge blessing for me. I LOVE it! And your story so resonated with me on levels deeper than you can imagine.”

“It just seems quite important that it be available, as I think there are so many of us out here that want to know we're not alone.”

""Thank you so much for this film. I have just watched it and I can't stop smiling.”

""By the end of the film I was left with a feeling of greater love for all of existence.""

 

 

 

Steven Newmark, Director

Dr. Newmark is a filmmaker and psychotherapist who specializes in relationships and spirituality. His best-selling relationship videos have been featured in the New York Times, San Francisco Examiner, Houston Chronicle, and on the Late Night with David Letterman Show.

Zoe Durga Harber, Writer/Producer

Zoe is a writer who lives in Forest Knolls, Ca. She has received awards for her poetry and essays and is published in an anthology called Remember Me As a Time of Day (Burning Bush Press, 2012). Her two new books of poetry areThe Enlightenment of the Noodle-Makers Wife and Twelve in Love. Her work as a psychotherapist and meditator inform the content and themes of her writing.

Jaime Byrd, Editor/Producer

Jaime is a three-time Emmy award nominated director and editor and founder of Blind Lyle Films. She has directed and edited several short films, documentaries, and music videos, as well as a web series called Luck and the Virgin.

Jai Uttal, Musician

Jai Uttal is a grammy award nominee and a pioneer in the world music community with his eclectic East-meets-West sound.

Krishna Das, Musician

Known as yoga's ""rock star,"" Krishna Das has taken the call and response chanting out of yoga centers and into concert halls, becoming a worldwide icon and the best-selling western chant artist of all time.

 

HELP US MAKE IT HAPPEN! NAMASTE

column1: My name is Dylan Hoffman, and I will be directing Jack Unplugged. I am a senior Film Production major at Keene State College. I worked on and produced a short film last year called ""Forget About Us"", and now am stepping into the role of director with Jack Unplugged for the first time, hopefully the first of many. This film is extremely important to me, as I think if I get my chance to tell a great story and direct the film, people will enjoy it the way I do, and will lead to more fun opportunities in the future. So this film is as much me proving myself to others as it is proving it to myself. We love this story, and we hope you will too.
You too can be a part of the Jack Unplugged family and help us on this journey by donating to this fundraising campaign.

Jack is a typical college student, trying to figure out what he wants to do with his life. Meanwhile, he is still recovering from the break-up he has had with his first and only girlfriend. Ever since then, he has drowned out the world with music. One day, he meets a girl, and they get to know each other. Jack is starting to remember what love feels like after so long without it, but is afraid of making the same mistakes again. He has high hopes to be happier and finally live his life unplugged.
So here is our budget broken into more detail:

While our wardrobe and prop budget is important, you can see that most of the budget of our film (or any film for that matter) is put towards behind-the-scenes expenses that (hopefully) the audience will never see. So the larger the budget we have, the more of it we can put towards the artistic side of the film, the thing that really makes it what it is. Our goal is to have enough money that we don't have to worry about all of the behind-the-scenes expenses and simply worry about making a great film.

As for our rewards, we have various tiers of prizes for our campaign supporters, ranging from your name in the film's 'Special Thanks' credits to t-shirts, DVDs, CDs, and the opportunity to meet the crew and celebrate the film.
If we don't reach our goal, the ratio we have in each department (wardrobe, food, transport, etc.) will largely stay the same, just with less money to stretch out between them.

On the other hand, if we surpass our goal, we will have the opportunity to have higher production value and truly pull out all the stops when it comes to what is in the film and how creative we can be.

Either way, this is a non-profit venture, and all of the money we earn here will be for the film. We don't consider money in our own pockets very important when compared with the film. So no matter how much we make, none of it will go to waste.

This project will be the culmination of several years of studying film and making short films, with this film being my magnum opus for the foreseeable future. When I produced ""Forget About Us"" last year, it came out very well and was very character-driven with a lot of care put into it. That is something I always want to be known for, interesting characters that you care about, a good story, and putting care into every part of it.
If you help us fun Jack Unplugged, we can promise you both interesting characters and an interesting story. We are very excited to bring this vision to reality for everyone to enjoy.

This will be a very important film, and sometimes difficult and busy, but we are so happy to have the opportunity to make it, and no amount of support is too little for us, so we thank you on behalf of our film-to-be.

The biggest challenges to any film production are money and time. We already have our schedule put together and our cast together, so money is the next big hurdle. That's where our campaign supporters come in.

With our budget, we can focus more on making a good film and less on the preparation and behind-the-scenes challenges, and we can overcome unexpected financial obstacles that may come our way. Things like paying for parking, renting a location, renting any vehicles or equipment we may need, reimbursing our actors for driving in from out of state, and of course using the remaining budget at the end to reward our supporters with specially-made prizes to show our appreciation.

Working on the film last year, I've experienced these problems firsthand and found the best ways to avoid them, and our budget saved us on many occasions that could have stopped us in our tracks. The trick is to always get creative, and solving problems becomes easier with ingenuity and making sure to do everything in an efficient and thoughtful way.
If you can't afford to support Jack Unplugged financially, you can always support us socially.
You can find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jackunpluggedfilm/

We love engaging with our supporters, so definitely comment and ask questions when we post about the movie and talk about behind-the-scenes info. We love making movies, and we certainly love talking about making movies just as much.
and when the film is finished and screened in late April, it will become available on YouTube so definitely get to the premiere in Keene when it's time or check it out online.

And as always, even just telling a friend to check out the film or watching it with your friends and family is a huge service to us. Nothing shows that people truly care quite like seeing the number of views go up over time, knowing that we have succeeded in making something that people will watch, enjoy, and come back to with friends.

My name is Dylan Hoffman, and I will be directing Jack Unplugged. I am a senior Film Production major at Keene State College. I worked on and produced a short film last year called ""Forget About Us"", and now am stepping into the role of director with Jack Unplugged for the first time, hopefully the first of many. This film is extremely important to me, as I think if I get my chance to tell a great story and direct the film, people will enjoy it the way I do, and will lead to more fun opportunities in the future. So this film is as much me proving myself to others as it is proving it to myself. We love this story, and we hope you will too.
You too can be a part of the Jack Unplugged family and help us on this journey by donating to this fundraising campaign.

Jack is a typical college student, trying to figure out what he wants to do with his life. Meanwhile, he is still recovering from the break-up he has had with his first and only girlfriend. Ever since then, he has drowned out the world with music. One day, he meets a girl, and they get to know each other. Jack is starting to remember what love feels like after so long without it, but is afraid of making the same mistakes again. He has high hopes to be happier and finally live his life unplugged.
Dylan Hoffman - Director, Art Production Designer
What We Need & What You Get
So here is our budget broken into more detail:

While our wardrobe and prop budget is important, you can see that most of the budget of our film (or any film for that matter) is put towards behind-the-scenes expenses that (hopefully) the audience will never see. So the larger the budget we have, the more of it we can put towards the artistic side of the film, the thing that really makes it what it is. Our goal is to have enough money that we don't have to worry about all of the behind-the-scenes expenses and simply worry about making a great film.

As for our rewards, we have various tiers of prizes for our campaign supporters, ranging from your name in the film's 'Special Thanks' credits to t-shirts, DVDs, CDs, and the opportunity to meet the crew and celebrate the film.
If we don't reach our goal, the ratio we have in each department (wardrobe, food, transport, etc.) will largely stay the same, just with less money to stretch out between them.

On the other hand, if we surpass our goal, we will have the opportunity to have higher production value and truly pull out all the stops when it comes to what is in the film and how creative we can be.

Either way, this is a non-profit venture, and all of the money we earn here will be for the film. We don't consider money in our own pockets very important when compared with the film. So no matter how much we make, none of it will go to waste.

This project will be the culmination of several years of studying film and making short films, with this film being my magnum opus for the foreseeable future. When I produced ""Forget About Us"" last year, it came out very well and was very character-driven with a lot of care put into it. That is something I always want to be known for, interesting characters that you care about, a good story, and putting care into every part of it.
If you help us fun Jack Unplugged, we can promise you both interesting characters and an interesting story. We are very excited to bring this vision to reality for everyone to enjoy.

This will be a very important film, and sometimes difficult and busy, but we are so happy to have the opportunity to make it, and no amount of support is too little for us, so we thank you on behalf of our film-to-be.

The biggest challenges to any film production are money and time. We already have our schedule put together and our cast together, so money is the next big hurdle. That's where our campaign supporters come in.

With our budget, we can focus more on making a good film and less on the preparation and behind-the-scenes challenges, and we can overcome unexpected financial obstacles that may come our way. Things like paying for parking, renting a location, renting any vehicles or equipment we may need, reimbursing our actors for driving in from out of state, and of course using the remaining budget at the end to reward our supporters with specially-made prizes to show our appreciation.

Working on the film last year, I've experienced these problems firsthand and found the best ways to avoid them, and our budget saved us on many occasions that could have stopped us in our tracks. The trick is to always get creative, and solving problems becomes easier with ingenuity and making sure to do everything in an efficient and thoughtful way.
If you can't afford to support Jack Unplugged financially, you can always support us socially.
You can find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jackunpluggedfilm/

We love engaging with our supporters, so definitely comment and ask questions when we post about the movie and talk about behind-the-scenes info. We love making movies, and we certainly love talking about making movies just as much.
and when the film is finished and screened in late April, it will become available on YouTube so definitely get to the premiere in Keene when it's time or check it out online.

And as always, even just telling a friend to check out the film or watching it with your friends and family is a huge service to us. Nothing shows that people truly care quite like seeing the number of views go up over time, knowing that we have succeeded in making something that people will watch, enjoy, and come back to with friends.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1:
8 friends are quarantined in a house over the holidays which leads to murder, suspicion and mayhem.

It’s got everything
column2:
Christmas.

Suspicion.

Blood.

Ebola.

Millennials.

Presents.

A doctor.

A bathtub full of dead bodies.

Jealousy.

Revenge.

It’s basically an 8 character murder mystery set in one location.  But with the perks of Ebola, being quarantined, hazmat teams on the street, the visiting doctor, and elicit affair, etc…  (It’s very close to what’s known as the one set, five character money-maker.).

$65,000 is an incredibly low budget for a feature film(the low 50's after rewards and 8% Indiegogo fees), but Alexander and I are used to working with a lot less and making it look like a million bucks.  If we raise more than our goal, it will be well spent and increase the production value.

The reason I’m collaborating with Alexander is because he can shoot what’s in front of him and make it look like a million bucks.  (Unlike other directors who spend a lot of time and a lot of money and it still looks mediocre.)

Our perks are very exciting.  Custom made Quarantined Christmas ornaments.                          And actual props from the movie for the higher end donations.  The coolest props are first come first serve – I will start giving the coolest props as rewards first – it’s like numbered editions.(Estimated delivery of rewards are contingent on the success of the campaign.  Ideally we will shoot this Spring for a Thanksgiving release… so rewards where you’re in the film would be Spring and all other rewards will be sent out this fall.)

If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help
column3: get the word out!  Please share our campaign on your page!
column5:
showinfo=0"">

THE CAST

Kodi Baker (Cal)

Kodi Baker was born on a small farm in Michigan.  After moving to Los Angeles, he began a career acting in Film and Television from Disney Channel’s “Lab Rats” to ABC Family’s “The Neighbors” to Syfy Channel’s “Face-off”. He later went on to travel internationally as a male model starting in Milan Italy he is now represented in five countries across the globe not including the United States.

 

Isabelle Du (Janet)

You may have recognized international model and actress Isabelle Du on the last 6 seasons of Syfy's Face Off as all sorts of creatures. Although a Californian native and Chapman University graduate, Isabelle has worked and lived abroad in countries such as Vietnam, Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and the Philippines.  Having gained traction in the Vietnamese soap opera Female Bodyguard, she's also starred in numerous commercials and television shows such as the multiple Emmy Award Winning CBS The Amazing Race &
column6: Lifetime's American Beauty Star with an upcoming role in horror thriller Actress Wanted.  She’s hosted for AfterBuzz TV’s Law &
column7:
Order SVU Aftershow and currently travels throughout the US as a live presenter.

 

Bryan Scamman (Matt)

Bryan Scamman is a Los Angeles based actor who fell in love with acting in his home town of Boise, ID. Upon moving to LA to pursue the dream, he teamed up with his sister for their hit YouTube Comedy Web series “Sibs”. Bryan is known for his roles in several films and tv show including Jesse Thunderwake: American Icon and SyFy Channel’s “Face Off” and “Game Face. He also has lent his skills as a skateboarder to several commercials including McDonalds, Mini Cooper and the San Diego Zoo. 

 

Augustine Hargrave (Steven)

 

Nayeli Morales (Jazz)

 

Christoff Visscher (Victor)

Christoff Visscher was born in Silver Spring, Maryland where he first gained an interest in acting after landing the role of The Beast in Beauty and the Beast. He went on to study theatre at Hope College and Goldsmith’s University in London. In 2013 he moved to Los Angeles where he began his television and film career. He can be seen in short films like Party Foul and on shows including Hollywood Game Night and Face Off. 

 

Megan Albertus (Trisha)​

A simple child of the 80’s, Megan Albertus was born and raised in Spokane, WA. Her childhood was largely spent with her nose in a book, frolicking on her grandparents’ farm or dancing in ballet class.  Megan attended Washington State University, graduating with degrees in Criminal Justice and Political Science. Instead of putting any of that education to use, and much to her family’s shock/horror, she decided to move to Hollywood. Working both behind the scenes and in front of the camera, Megan’s resume includes film, television and commercial experience. Some career highlights include participating in ten epic seasons as a creature model on Syfy’s SFX makeup competition show, “Face Off,” a glorious season working with “Mad Men,” and getting doused in blood on her favorite television show, “A 1000 Ways to Die.” When not hustling for her next gig, Megan can be found chilling with her many feline companions. A crazy cat lady to the core, she is also an avid animal shelter volunteer.

 

Al Underwood (Dr. Festus)

 

 

THE PRODUCTION TEAM

Jim Beinke (Executive Producer)

Originally from St. Louis, Missouri.  Attended California Institute of the Arts in the early 80’s.  Began his career doing rock videos, most notably making the Quiet Riot mask.   Created creature effects for such movies as “The Craft” and ""Three Kings"" at Alterian Studios in the 90’s, and ""Planet of the Apes"" and “Men in Black II” at Rick Bakers Cinovation Studios in the 2000’s.  As well as “Fantastic 4 : Rise of the Silver Surfer” and “Hellboy 2” at Spectral Motion.  Just finished 13 seasons as the technical advisor of Syfy Channel’s “Face Off”.  Executive producer of ‘The Monster Project’.

Alexander Ray Williams (Writer/Director)

Bakersfield, California native and lover of literature, Alexander Ray Williams gave up a computer science degree to move to Los Angeles and pursue a career in entertainment. Alexander has held many industry positions, from Production Assistant, and more recently, Sound Mixer and Boom Op, to Gaffer and DP on various productions. These duties would take up Alexander’s days but his nights would be filled with the study of story and screenplays and the practice of writing and directing. Alexander has written and directed such short films as Film Festival Selection ""bricks"", ""Almost Armaggedon"", ""The Babes of Washington"", ""One Who Will Listen"", ""The Tragedy of Loneliness"", ""The Legend', and ""These Bodies"". 

 

 

MAKE-UP EFFTECTS

Make-up Effects by Spectre Effects.

https://www.facebook.com/spectreeffects/  

Pre-made prosthetics by Roland Blachoflor’s RBFX and

Rob Burman’s Rubber Wear. 

Contact Lenses by Professional Visoncare Associates. 

 

 

HIGH END PROPS AND WARDROBE

Here are some of the cool Hazmat suits and Riot Gear.

 

 

THE HOUSE

Here are some inspiration pics of how we are going to dress the house.

 

 

THE STREET

Here are some inspiration pics of the look we are going for outside in the closed off street.

 

 

THE TENT

A message from Alex

showinfo=0"">

column1:
0,"

THE FILM: Girl Alone is a dramatic and shocking, but ultimately empowering scripted short from an exciting new team. It's a tense modern day drama with a unique structure, a clever twist and a sting in the tail. A visceral portrayal of one young woman who refuses to accept the hand she is dealt, it's a topical and controversial story for the 2018 MeToo audience. Girl Alone is a film with a strong female lead - and we have a great name lined up for the role.


WHY WE NEED YOU: The team themselves are already contributing a huge amount of their own time and resources for free - but it's not enough to fully fund the production. This IndieGogo funding campaign will pay for every aspect of production that the team and crew are not already contributing themselves. Your contributions will make this film a reality - covering the costs of filming on location with our cast and the post production. Without your help this film won't happen - with your generosity we hope it will not only be a gripping piece of film-making but also a short that can make an impact in festivals around the world.

WHAT YOUR HELP WILL MEAN FOR THE PROJECT: We need £9,000 to cover our costs and enable us to produce Girl Alone. Although the team and crew are already being incredibly generous with their time, resources and equipment, we need your help to pay for things like: our cast - and the casting director to ensure they're fantastic for the roles
column3: make up supplies, camera and sound equipment rental
column5:
location fees and insurance. Every penny you contribute will bring us closer to our goal and help make this film a reality.

WHAT YOU'LL GET: As well as the warm fuzzy feeling of helping with an artistic endeavour you'll also qualify for a range of rewards depending on how generous your contribution is. Every contributor who pledges at least £5 will get a reward - and the more you can spare the more special and unique these perks will be. We appreciate your support - and we want to share a little bit of the Girl Alone experience with you all. From copies of the finished film, to a signed script, an autographed key prop, a VIP invite to the very first screening, and even an on-screen role as a character in the film, there are great perks for each and every backer. Every contribution will help, and however much we raise we're hoping to make the film a success no matter what.

THE TEAM: Girl Alone is a project we all really believe in - and we hope you will see why as it comes to fruition. For David (Producer) and Linda (Writer) this will be the first produced short, and Girl Alone will be major step for them both as they look to carve out a career in scripted drama. Keith (Director) and Phil (EP) worked together on the award-winning short Rabbit Punch - and have high hopes that Girl Alone can eclipse their previous success and reach new audiences. However, none of this can happen without your support!

KEITH: I may have spent my life in the past - or rather making films set in the past. For the last 15 years I have been making history documentaries and series for both cinema and broadcast. I even managed to pick up a few awards along the way. However, what I really want to do is put the pantaloons and corsets away! My last short, the multiple award winning Rabbit Punch, was my first foray into contemporary drama. Now, I want to follow it up with a film that will test my skill as a director and surprise the audience along the way. Girl Alone is that film - a gritty drama that will subvert your expectations and show you a different reality.

DAVID: With 15 years in Documentary Development this will be my first foray into producing a fully scripted drama project. Drama is my passion - I even achieved an MA in Script Writing while working full time in TV Development. Girl Alone is the perfect project for me to get my hands dirty working on something exciting and challenging in equal measure. When Keith showed me Linda's script I knew this was an opportunity worth grabbing with both hands. I'm sure you'll agree with me when you see the finished film.

LINDA: I am a young screenwriter and Girl Alone is my very first full short film script. I graduated from University in 2017 with a Degree in Film and I wanted to challenge myself to write a short, but powerful, drama script.  The story of Girl Alone is something that had been whirling around in my mind for some time before I finally committed it to the page. I was heavily influenced by social-realist films such as Fish Tank (2009) and Tyrannosaur (2011), especially their uses of location to impact the story and their moral ambiguities and conflicts.

PHIL: Although most of my carer has been spent working in production on major feature film and TV series, I have also produced several award-winning short films with talented directors, including Rabbit Punch with none other than Keith Farrell.  While I spend a lot of my time working on projects with big budgets and even bigger stars, Girl Alone is a project I really want to help bring to fruition as the exec producer.

COLM: As our cinematographer, Colm Whelan is the person who is going to craft the beautiful images you will see on screen when Girl Alone is complete.  Although based in Ireland, where he worked on the IFTA winning series ""Wrecking the Rising"" and most recently on History's ""Vikings"",  Colm is no stranger to the North West, last year he worked on two to hugely successful short films from these part ""Mum"" @mum_film and ""Rabbit Punch @rabbitpunchfilm.   With Colm on board I am sure we will emulate the success of those two films.

OUR STARS: Over the course of the campaign we will be announcing the casting of the key roles in Girl Alone.  We can now reveal who the first cast member is, British comedian, Keith Carter.

Keith is playing the Boyfriend, the key antagonist in the film, whose actions set the story in motion. 

This is Keith's first ""serious role"",  he is one of the leading lights on the stand up circuit, his work has featured on ""Johnny Vegas' Tatt"", ""Jason Manford's Tonightly Show"" &
column6:
he played the cabbie ""Chill"" in the criminally under-rated British comedy ""Under The Mud"".

We’re thrilled to have Keith on board and very excited to work with him.  You’re going to love seeing him in the finished film.

BIG THANKS: We'd also like to take this opportunity to thank Michael O'Sullivan and Josh Moore for their work on the campaign images you can see here and on the Facebook and Twitter pages - we think they look great! And also thanks to editor Siôn Roberts and cameraman Jam Thomas for their work on the campaign video.

ONE LAST THING: Please spread the word about Girl Alone far and wide. You're a well-connected lot - help us get the message out and raise the funds we need. Share the links on your social media, tell your colleagues, friends and families. Every extra person you can help us reach is one more potential new member of the Girl Alone team!

the exec producer.COLM: As our cinematographer, Colm Whelan is the person who is going to craft the beautiful images you will see on screen when Girl Alone is complete.  Although based in Ireland, where he worked on the IFTA winning series ""Wrecking the Rising"" and most recently on History's ""Vikings"",  Colm is no stranger to the North West, last year he worked on two to hugely successful short films from these part ""Mum"" @mum_film and ""Rabbit Punch @rabbitpunchfilm.   With Colm on board I am sure we will emulate the success of those two films.OUR STARS: Over the course of the campaign we will be announcing the casting of the key roles in Girl Alone.  We can now reveal who the first cast member is, British comedian, Keith Carter.Keith is playing the Boyfriend, the key antagonist in the film, whose actions set the story in motion. This is Keith's first ""serious role"",  he is one of the leading lights on the stand up circuit, his work has featured on ""Johnny Vegas' Tatt"", ""Jason Manford's Tonightly Show"" & he played the cabbie ""Chill"" in the criminally under-rated British comedy ""Under The Mud"".We’re thrilled to have Keith on board and very excited to work with him.  You’re going to love seeing him in the finished film.BIG THANKS: We'd also like to take this opportunity to thank Michael O'Sullivan and Josh Moore for their work on the campaign images you can see here and on the Facebook and Twitter pages - we think they look great! And also thanks to editor Siôn Roberts and cameraman Jam Thomas for their work on the campaign video.ONE LAST THING: Please spread the word about Girl Alone far and wide. You're a well-connected lot - help us get the message out and raise the funds we need. Share the links on your social media, tell your colleagues, friends and families. Every extra person you can help us reach is one more potential new member of the Girl Alone team!",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: Take an active role in the writing of our history.  Let's make the series Ann Maguire: Circle of Heroes, and tell this inspirational story to the world on a big, mainstream platform.

Ann Maguire is one of the greatest heroes that no one has ever heard of.  But we all know her work.  We all benefit from it, in profound ways that have altered the paths of our lives.  In the really big ways.
If you make a living in the profession of your choice without hiding your sexuality, you can thank Ann and her circle.
If your life is free from fear, and unrestricted because of Gay Rights laws, you benefit daily from Ann’s work, and that of her circle.

If you have had a mammogram in the last 30 years, you can thank Ann and her circle for the reliability and consistent quality of that service.  If you, or anyone you know, has been impacted by breast cancer in the last 30 years, you have been helped by the work of Ann and her circle.  Perhaps your life has even been saved by it.
If you, or anyone you know has ever been impacted by homelessness, you have been affected by Ann’s work, and that of her circle.
Do you live in the vibrant city of Boston and share in its quality of life?  Ann and her circle had a part in that too.
Profound, yes?  Seismically powerful, right?  What’s missing?  The recognition, the knowledge, the history.
The names of Ann Maguire and her circle deserve to be household names like other great heroes.  But they are not.  Why?  Because one of us needs to write the history.  No one will do it for us.
So I am doing it.  In a 4 part documentary series.  And you can be a part.
Our history can take its place among the great stories, where it belongs, and you can be an essential part of that.
Ann Maguire: Circle of Heroes will be a four part documentary series that tells this unknown, but vitally important story, the way it should be told.
Each chapter will be devoted to one portion of this body of work:
4. Social Justice, One City Service at a Time.
The high production values you see on TV and the movies require high quality equipment.  The first $10,000 raised will go immediately into 2 areas:

• An additional camera and mic so that our interviews will be more dynamic to watch and will feature the requisite flawless audio. You may have noticed that the scenes in the first film containing 2 people simultaneously had inconsistent audio, and in 2 cases the focus was flawed.This won’t fly for mainstream platforms.
• Purchase of extant video and photos from the period from libraries, museums and TV stations.This is what makes documentaries come alive.
The next $10,000 will go to a studio quality trailer for marketing purposes and to start studio editing.
You will play an essential role in bringing our history to the world.
You will get regular updates about interviews and progress.
You will get access to a private Vimeo site where you can view edited interviews, video, and photos as they come in.
You will get complimentary seating at a prescreening of the each of the parts of the series.
You will get a DVD copy of the series.
You will get screen credit in all four episodes

Some social movements never really get off the ground. A few do, and make a huge difference in the lives of millions.  This story explains what makes the difference between just wishing, and real world success.  More than ever, we need activist roadmaps and Ann's story is just that!

You can play a vital role in getting this story to the world. Women, and the LGBTQ community have long struggled to have their stories told through a film industry dominated by traditional filmmakers.  This is changing, but much more needs to be done.  I am uniquely positioned to tell this story.

If you are a veteran of the LGBTQ rights movement, you still have an untold story. If you helped build the breast cancer movement, you have an untold story.  If you were homeless, your story is invisible. You can participate in having these stories added to the history our children learn.

This is a long road, and there is much work to do.  A four part series for mass distribution requires high production values and marketing.  I am as tenacious as they come.  With your support I will get this done. I will use every dollar to make a film series that can hold its own on any platform.
Get the word out! Share the campaign with everyone you know who might want to be a part of the project.  If you can't make a contribution, you probably know someone who can.

Perfectly Oblivious is a comedy-drama film written and directed by award winning filmmaker Honeymoon Aljabri.
The film follows Jane and her twin brother Eric as they embark on a road trip across America to fulfill their mother’s dying wish: discover who their biological father is.
On their way, they will find out more about themselves, meet new friends, maybe even fall in love. Oblivious is a movie about love, loss and laughter – even in the darkest of times.
Honeymoon Aljabri - Director, Screenwriter, Producer
Mahmoud Olympio - Director of Photography
The film has already completed pre production and principal photography. All that remains now is to edit the footage and get it out there to win some festivals!
We have been given an estimated budget of $5000 for festival entry and the cost of a professional edit. Every penny will help to get the finished work out there!
If you can't afford to back Perfectly Oblivious financially - that's okay! Share the campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram: every little helps to get the film out there.

Tune in and DIE!

The Collector's Halloween special comes only once a year! Don't miss out on stories that will chill your bones! A group of teens go searching for a missing body, a babysitter is stalked by something malevolent, a porn star finds a mysterious bite on the back of his neck, and two girls uncover something that may very well lead to the end of the world!

Meet the cast and crew of FAME CINEMA. An independent group of kiddos in their 20’s attempting to make the greatest horror films possible! We officially formed back in early 2017, and since then have been compiling a body of work, and perfecting our skills as filmmakers.

Weird Fiction is an anthology. It takes a lot of inspiration from films such as “Creepshow” and television shows like “Goosebumps.” Each of the segments has a heavy 80’s horror influence, from story aspects to music inspirations. I present to you...

GOODNIGHT, DADDY: In the town of Bakersfield, people go missing all the time. After one particular disappearance, two teens decide to skip the school dance and go searching for the body...and something sinister lurks nearby.

NIGHT OF THE SITTER: Liam wants to get with Brooke. She agrees, but only on one condition, he must watch her younger brother Cade for the night. To bad for Liam that Cade is kind of stranger...and there’s something even stranger going on in the upstairs bedroom.

THE INCUBUS: It’s just another night on the job for porn star Dan. After waking up the next morning after a weird night of shooting, he finds a mysterious bite on the back of his neck. Believing he is turning into something otherworldly, he embraces his transformation.

COSMIC TERROR: Paige and April are left alone for the week. After discovering a strange being in their house, things start to take a turn for the worst after Paige takes one of the creature’s possessions. Looks can be deceiving.  

Weird Fiction was filmed completely without a budget. It’s a passion project. Now that it’s finished, we want to share with the world this remarkable thing we have created, and we want the horror movies we took inspiration from to live on.

Don’t take our word from it, check out what these people think!

 

The film is completed, now we want to get it to you! Money will be put towards the costs of independent distribution, and the costs of showing it in theaters all across Pennsylvania (first PA, then...the world!) Any additional money will go towards future projects.

www.facebook.com/weirdfictionmovie

Instagram @weirdfictionmovie
