Florida Man is a Superhero parody which will follow the epic chronicles of our protagonist as he attempts to change the boring headlines and rescue us from our boring, everyday lives. He'll go toe to toe with his archrival Big Business, and hilarious chaos will ensue!
We need to feed our cast and crew as well as buy props and set dressings. That costs money!
As for what you get, view our reward tiers!

The Impact

This world needs more light hearted comedy to bring laughter and joy to everyone. Help make our dream come true!

column2: ChallengesNone, other than the typical challenges of shooting in Florida (cough cough, rainy weather), but we have baked in several backup plans, and backup of backup plans, etc.

Jayden, a lazy and inexperienced criminal with a bad temper, robs a CVS. When his getaway driver can’t pick him up, he steals an Uber from an old man to escape the crime scene. During the ride, he realizes that it is an Uber pool so, when an off-duty cop enters the car, the comedic tension and suspense increase as he worries if he will be discovered by people in the Uber.

We need money for the production to pay for hair, make up, costume, location permits, and food for our actors and crew. When you contribute, you get your name in the credits of the film and get to be part of the filmmaking process. It takes a lot to make a film come to life and your contribution can make the film a reality!
Any amount of money contributes to making this film complete and is greatly appreciated.

Being Different: 101 Global LGBTQ Individuals Who Changed The World will be an original documentary outlining the contributions that members of the LGBTQ community have made, individually and collectively, to changing the world.

Being Different will historically, politically, and socially contextualize the efforts of 101 LGBTQ people who changed the world in order to demonstrate how these individuals balanced their desire to change their social context with personal and social discrimination due to their sexuality.  Understanding how sexuality-based discrimination influenced, negatively or positively, their efforts will also be discussed.  By reversing the heterosexist erasure of these individual’s sexualities, we intend to uncover the true historical significance of these individuals and their contributions.

Kevin Feraday is the Director of this project.  He has been producing his own short films for 17 years. Recently Kevin founded Kevin Feraday Productions to create and produce work of a more commercial nature.   Sean Story is a professional mix engineer who specializes in mixing music that was recorded by real musicians playing real instruments.  Christina Ienna is a Toronto based filmmaker and cinematographer with extensive experience in documentary, narrative and commercial production. She is a Women In the Director’s Chair (WIDC) alumnae and holds Associate Member status within the Canadian Society of Cinematographers. Colin Story is a musician and writer based in Toronto and is the music director of the project.

This project requires funding from the LGBTQ community which, in turn, is matched by funding from several arts foundations, government cultural programs, and charitable organizations.  The project budget is $250,000, of which $25,000 is required from the community. Your help will make this happen!
It is Time to Tell the Story - Help us do that!

Being Different will be a source of inspiration and pride for the far-too-many people who have shame associated their own LGBTQ status (or of someone close to them).    Being Different will teach youths and adults that ‘being different’ is normal, and that difference is worthy of celebration.  The global champions profiled in this documentary will be role models and a source of inspiration for new generations of LGBTQ innovators.

Other Ways You Can Help

The more people who are aware of this project and its potential impact, the better.  Please help us by sharing this project with your friends and community.

Rallying from a previous attack, a group of American soldiers learn about Operation Greif, a mission where german spies infiltrate American squads disguised as Americans. As the night grows dark, a squad member's past is put into question. Tensions rise as the squad question each other’s loyalties and wonder who truly is the enemy.
We are all students at the University of New Mexico in our final year, looking to make the best short film for our senior thesis. We hope to take the film on the festival circuit with help from you.

All campaign funds will be directly used for renting props, costumes, generators and feeding our crew of volunteers. With your help we will be able to buy and rent what we need, while continuing to feed ourselves in the process. Whether we reach our goal or not, 100% of contributions will be directly used in the project. Any amount of money helps!
Spread the page around to as many people you can.

column2: >A short horror film, 'The Worst' follows a troubled young woman, who after a failing to achieve her life goal, embarks on a long road trip home with her estranged father when a dark and monstrous being threatens her life, she is forced to choose between overcoming her fears or risk losing everything.
>After years of an estranged relationship, father and daughter release years of pent up rage and resentment
column3: this boiling pot of emotions contained and pressurized by a late night drive acts as the perfect ground for dark and strange things to occur, for anxieties to come life.

column2: >'The Worst' was born out of my own messy and ongoing journey with anxiety
column3: this little dark voice that sits deep in my heart that tells me things will only ever go wrong and that it's all my fault because I'm not smart, not pretty, not kind, not enough.

column2: >I'm not someone gifted at ""dealing with my emotions"" as more healthier and mindful people would say - if I feel something negative I thrust those thoughts into the abyss hoping they'll disappear forever but instead they sit in my gut like swallowed teeth, eating at me from the inside out.
>I've always run from emotions, run from my anxiety but what if I could no longer escape it?
>I wrote 'The Worst' because I wanted to tell a story about a woman who could no longer run from her fears, who had to look her demons in the eye and speak to them.

>'The Worst' is for all those people that have that cruel and incessant voice in the back of their head that tells them they're pathetic, lazy, not enough. It's for all those people who spend every day running away as fast as they can from it's death-like grip.
>What if we stopped running for a moment?
>What if we stopped and had a chat with our demons instead, would it be so bad?

>The writer and director of 'The Worst', Sharon values films that are able to explore emotionally honest themes but do so in experimental ways. Sharon aims to find a nuanced balance between the emotional truths of drama and the reality bending nature of surreal-horror with her latest short film.

>Having dedicated herself to film with a fierce passion, Sharon has worked non-stop to be on as many film sets as possible resulting in her producing and directing several projects since pursuing her BA in Creative Arts at JMC Academy.  From these experiences she has gained an invaluable understanding for the film process and is eager to apply her lessons into practice.
>Sharon's biggest fear is not being able to do what I love.

>My name is Lisa Ho and I’m co-producer of ‘The Worst’! I’m drawn to films that aren’t often given the attention in the mainstream as I believe everyone deserves the chance to tell their stories. I believe in my team and am incredibly excited to support them on their creative journey. My biggest fear is letting people down.

>My name is Lachlan and I am Co-Producer of ""The Worst"". I am keen to be apart of the project and excited to see where it goes! The Worst is a great story with deep emotional discussions that I am keen to help explore.
>My biggest fear would have to be not living up to my own expectations.

>Georgia is the talented cinematographer for our short film ‘The Worst’. Having previously studied Fashion Design and currently studying for her Bachelor's in Film and Television at JMC Academy, she is able to effectively apply her detailed eye for colour, texture and composition to our film, tying character, camera and world together. She is a strong asset to the team and will enhance the overall execution of the project.
>Georgia's biggest fear is having to write a few short sentences about herself.

>Tara Sriharan is a 2018 JMC graduate who has been working in production design for just over 2 years. She has assisted in the art dept. on various short films, grad projects, music videos and two features. She's excited to actualise the vision of Sharon Mani, and can't wait to see it on the screen.
>As she has a terrible sense of smell, Tara's biggest fear is not noticing a gas leak that could be fatal.
>A recent UTS graduate, Stefan Varvaressos-Abdi is a screen writer, film director, and most notably a video editor. He will be assembling and editing The Worst to make it the very best it can be.
>Stefan's biggest fear is the potential loss of his creativity.

>My name is Jordan, and have just recently graduated from JMC Academy, I'm the film composer for 'the worst', and have been writing film music for various short films and documentaries over the years. Mainly focusing on 'epic orchestral scores' but am diverse in a multitude of genres.
>My biggest fear without a doubt would have to be drop bears!

>Film is a wonderful venture but it's also an expensive one. The budget below breaks down where funding will be allocated and ensures that all your contributions go directly to bringing to life our vision.
>Here is where our funds will go!
>If you would like to help us out, but don't have the cash, please share this page on social media and follow us on:

column1: ","A short horror film, 'The Worst' follows a troubled young woman, who after a failing to achieve her life goal, embarks on a long road trip home with her estranged father when a dark and monstrous being threatens her life, she is forced to choose between overcoming her fears or risk losing everything.
After years of an estranged relationship, father and daughter release years of pent up rage and resentment
column2: this boiling pot of emotions contained and pressurized by a late night drive acts as the perfect ground for dark and strange things to occur, for anxieties to come life.

column1: 'The Worst' was born out of my own messy and ongoing journey with anxiety
column2: this little dark voice that sits deep in my heart that tells me things will only ever go wrong and that it's all my fault because I'm not smart, not pretty, not kind, not enough.

column1: I'm not someone gifted at ""dealing with my emotions"" as more healthier and mindful people would say - if I feel something negative I thrust those thoughts into the abyss hoping they'll disappear forever but instead they sit in my gut like swallowed teeth, eating at me from the inside out.
I've always run from emotions, run from my anxiety but what if I could no longer escape it?
I wrote 'The Worst' because I wanted to tell a story about a woman who could no longer run from her fears, who had to look her demons in the eye and speak to them.

'The Worst' is for all those people that have that cruel and incessant voice in the back of their head that tells them they're pathetic, lazy, not enough. It's for all those people who spend every day running away as fast as they can from it's death-like grip.
What if we stopped running for a moment?
What if we stopped and had a chat with our demons instead, would it be so bad?

The writer and director of 'The Worst', Sharon values films that are able to explore emotionally honest themes but do so in experimental ways. Sharon aims to find a nuanced balance between the emotional truths of drama and the reality bending nature of surreal-horror with her latest short film.

Having dedicated herself to film with a fierce passion, Sharon has worked non-stop to be on as many film sets as possible resulting in her producing and directing several projects since pursuing her BA in Creative Arts at JMC Academy.  From these experiences she has gained an invaluable understanding for the film process and is eager to apply her lessons into practice.
Sharon's biggest fear is not being able to do what I love.

My name is Lisa Ho and I’m co-producer of ‘The Worst’! I’m drawn to films that aren’t often given the attention in the mainstream as I believe everyone deserves the chance to tell their stories. I believe in my team and am incredibly excited to support them on their creative journey. My biggest fear is letting people down.

My name is Lachlan and I am Co-Producer of ""The Worst"". I am keen to be apart of the project and excited to see where it goes! The Worst is a great story with deep emotional discussions that I am keen to help explore.
My biggest fear would have to be not living up to my own expectations.

Georgia is the talented cinematographer for our short film ‘The Worst’. Having previously studied Fashion Design and currently studying for her Bachelor's in Film and Television at JMC Academy, she is able to effectively apply her detailed eye for colour, texture and composition to our film, tying character, camera and world together. She is a strong asset to the team and will enhance the overall execution of the project.
Georgia's biggest fear is having to write a few short sentences about herself.

Tara Sriharan is a 2018 JMC graduate who has been working in production design for just over 2 years. She has assisted in the art dept. on various short films, grad projects, music videos and two features. She's excited to actualise the vision of Sharon Mani, and can't wait to see it on the screen.
As she has a terrible sense of smell, Tara's biggest fear is not noticing a gas leak that could be fatal.
A recent UTS graduate, Stefan Varvaressos-Abdi is a screen writer, film director, and most notably a video editor. He will be assembling and editing The Worst to make it the very best it can be.
Stefan's biggest fear is the potential loss of his creativity.

My name is Jordan, and have just recently graduated from JMC Academy, I'm the film composer for 'the worst', and have been writing film music for various short films and documentaries over the years. Mainly focusing on 'epic orchestral scores' but am diverse in a multitude of genres.
My biggest fear without a doubt would have to be drop bears!

Film is a wonderful venture but it's also an expensive one. The budget below breaks down where funding will be allocated and ensures that all your contributions go directly to bringing to life our vision.
